story:
What Is The Spirit of Yorkville?

While most of Toronto's colourful Victorian buildings that once stood as testament to this spirit and housed the Yorkville Village life are gone, the spirit remains and is a treasure we are going to celebrate with a Festival every year, beginning May 22/23 2015, here in Toronto. This date commemorates Toronto's first Love-In at Queen's Park (pictured above) in May 1967 when 5,000 people joined together for love and peace. Buffy Sainte-Marie and Leonard Cohen sang that day, and many of Toronto's unique young artists joined them, to celebrate that never to be forgotten Summer of Love.

How You Can Feel The Spirit and Join The Fun

Whether you remember the spirit of Yorkville because you were a part of it or you just want to hear some great music and vibrant poetry - or just hang out in a room full of happy people, come and join us in May and be able to say, "I was there at the first Spirit of Yorkville Festival."

Get Your Festival Tickets

This campaign is the best place to make sure you get one of the few tickets for each of the two evenings and one afternoon of performances at The Pilot Tavern. (EARLY BIRD tickets 25% off until April 30 now available at spiritofyorkville.com)

The Pilot represents the last club standing from the days between 1962 and 1972, when thousands of young people poured onto Yorkville Avenue every weekend to listen to poetry and dance to local musicians: Luke and the Apostles, Kensington Market, Nucleus, Cathy Young, The Paupers, Ugly Ducklings, Edward Bear  and more.  Many of the early artists went on to establish international reputations. Joni Mitchell, Neil Young, David Clayton-Thomas, John Kay, Goldie McJohn, Gordon Lightfoot, Bruce Cockburn, Dan Hill, Murray MacLaughlan and dozens more troubadours of the day were joined by Bob Dylan, Joan Baez and others from around the world, right here in Toronto. 

What We Need & What You Get

From these humble 'first year' beginnings, The Spirit of Yorkville Festival will create the platform for an annual event. We need $12,000 to pay for our performers, the equipment and the venue. Any funds left over will provide start-up money for next year's festival.  You get Festival Tickets! or if you can't attend, some cool Basquiat Art, or a rare one of a kind poster. 

These Are Pretty Awesome Perks!

We are offering some very special perks - written memoir by Johnny Brower, The Heatwave Trilogy (see Bob Segarini's hilarious review of Brower's book), rare memorabilia, and rare vinyl by The OFFS, with cover art by Jean-Michel Basquiat.

With "BASQUIAT-Now's The Time" installed at The Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO) Toronto has truly gone Basquazy. Considered a master of social commentary and political observation, Basquiat painted and wrote in a style all his own. His short career ended in death at 27 but the body of work he left staggers in both size and scope. In 1984 his friends The OFFS, a New York City punk band, asked if he would do their first album cover. With his works selling for tens and even hundreds of thousands, he nonetheless happily agreed and did their cover for $500, knowing they would easily get that back in record sales. This image has been recreated in a screen print selling for $30,000 and original albums are fetching over $3000. In 2009 a limited edition 25th anniversary reissue quickly sold out. We have 3 copies of this reissue, which include black vinyl, for $200 each. They are currently priced at $400 online and at The AGO gift shop. This is a rare collectible that will go quickly. See the perks page for more, awesome items.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we understand. Please help the cause by putting out the word to your friends and colleagues. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to easily let your community know about us on Facebook or Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Charlie Liu, a 14-year-old top prize winner in renowned International Piano Competitions. I have performed on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and the Oprah Winfrey Show, and at 8 became the youngest ever to have performed in all 3 concert halls inside the world-famous Carnegie Hall. I am also the youngest ever picked as a scholar for the prestigious Lang Lang International Music Foundation.

But the achievements I'm proudest of? Raising thousands of dollars through my "Rescue Music" benefit solo recital for the Plainsboro Rescue Squad in 2014 and my first benefit solo recital for Univ. of Iowa Children's Hospital as well as the "Young Artists for Haiti" Worldwide Piano Prodigy Collaboration in 2010.

I'm starting this campaign to create a "Rescue Music" Foundation, and through the Foundation provide financial help to young musicians across the country, who will thereby be able to give back to their communities and help spread the love of music with their own benefit recitals.

I believe that the promotion and preparation of the Foundation-supported concerts would raise everyone's awareness to all-volunteer rescue squads - who provide critical emergency medical services (free) to many communities without their realizing it - while also raising kids' interest and confidence in their music and motivation to help and give back.

That is the true spirit of the name "Rescue Music". Helping the communities is a necessity, and it's not just for adults - kids want to help too! My "Rescue Music" concert was a successful model of kids helping raising much-needed funds and awareness, and the many concerts funded by the "Rescue Music" Foundation will sure enjoy much bigger success!

If you love your community, if you love music or if you believe kids are the future of this country, please fund my campaign and help kids give back to their communities with music. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

Each recital costs money to startup (hall rental, insurance ...), ranging from hundreds to higher. However, usually much more gets donated by the concertgoers and much awareness is raised with the promotion, making it worthwhile. The Rescue Music Foundation would help cover the startup cost and associated expenses of concerts by young musicians, while the concert donations go to help the local rescue squads (or other worthy charity causes, as approved by the Foundation).

The first $4000 will go to setup cost (incorporation and non-profit status etc) and first year expense (like tax prep) of the Foundation itself. Then $6000-8000 goes to funding around 8-10 community concerts. The rest will go to help build a professional website, and promote the Foundation through social media campaigns - we need to let the kids and communities know there's a foundation to help them!

Ideally, I hope to raise a lot more than the current goal of $15000, because the promotion and website cost could be expensive but necessary in the first years. Also any additional amount raised will help create more and a sustainable series of concerts, and possibly allow donation to rescue squads and other worthy charitable causes directly by the Foundation.

If the campaign ends up not reaching my goal, the funds actually raised will first go to setting up the Foundation. Funding community concerts will be done based on how much is raised. Promotion will be the lowest priority - without funds for it I might simply rely on word-of-mouth and social media in friend circles.

The Impact

Most people didn't realize that their local rescue squads are all-volunteers (except for some states) and need donations/fundraisers to maintain their daily operations, which are usually provided for free yet absolutely critical to the well being of so many communities. Most kids also don't have access to classical music concerts or understand why one would spend so much effort learning classical music or any music well.

The Rescue Music Foundation combines the goals of help them out. It will help kids become more caring, thoughtful, hard-working and confident through preparing, promoting for the concert, performing in the concert, and knowing that their hard work lends great help to the community. Thus it will help out the local rescue squads, all the while helping to spread beautiful music. There will be an emphasis on classical music as I myself is an classical musician and will be able to help out to some of these concerts through my reputation and performances. However, I envision a mixed styled concert acceptable to the Foundation as well.

As I noted, I had raised thousands through my "Rescue Music" and other benefit solo recitals and benefit events. I have seen the enthusiasm of the communities for good music, to help good causes. A lot of the young musicians would like to help their communities out, but they need someone/organization to help organize, fund, and point the way. That is what the Rescue Music Foundation is about.

Once again, if you love your community, if you love music or if you believe kids are the future of this country, please fund my campaign!

Risks & Challenges

From my own experience, the challenges of the concerts would be to get the word out. With enthusiastic young performers and their families, and given the fact (based on my own experience) that local newspapers are eager to help out spreading the word for a great cause, I do not see this as a big problem and I believe the concerts will be successful once set up.

The real challenge for the Foundation is to get the word about itself out, other than enough and/or continued fundraising. To overcome this, I will rely on my network, your help and your network, and hopefully a larger amount raised so the Foundation could hire professional help to get the word out in the first years.

Once the word is out about the Foundation helping, I am certain there will be enough children and good causes applying for Foundation's help, and the Foundation can selectively help out the most worthy and trustworthy ones. I do plan to get help from friends to volunteer for the Foundation, thereby keeping the Foundation's own expense to a minimum.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us out by spreading the word about this campaign to your friends, families and network! The Indiegogo share tools (in the share box below pitch video) are very helpful sharing my campaign. Thank you!

story:
The Commission have been providing a melodious,  upbeat brand of hip hop music to the "Mountain West" for the better part of the last 5 years. Salt Lake City, UT; Eastern Montana; Boise, ID; North Nevada; Tucson, AZ; and Las Vegas, NV are some of the cites in this region who have acclaimed The Commission as "The Hip Hop music we want on the radio". Harnessing their love of old Italian Mobster stories, The Commission imaged themselves as a super organized hip hop tandem of talented MC's coming together to break through and survive common struggle. The group prides on putting out great music that uplifts peoples moods, makes them dance, and recites the choruses in their everyday. One secretary from Texas sent a email saying she was "just singing 'Remember' all day in the office." When you engage The Commission's music you reminace when hip hop was a genre that was simply about enjoyment and having a good time more than about degrading women and talking about the newest car. This key asset to the group has attracted one of the most wide array of fans to performances you will ever see. You will see the standard 20 - 30 year old at The Commission show as well as a 55 year old grandma singing along. They have been one of the most sought after, not paid for spot, opening acts in the region by national acts because of this attribute.

Why the Commission?

A theory to this, we believe, could be their strong down to earth mentality to the world. "Realistically humble", was the word used in publications written about them. All 3 members have been through troubling pasts ranging from incarceration, to drunken abusive homes, to selling drugs to make ends meat. However one thing changed all that. The adoption of family life. All three members stay grounded raising children they refuse to allow to go through those same negative experience. "We were supposed to be the so called 'next generation' yet the figures in our life didn't supply the example we should have seen." They were able to vent that through music to which  enticed people of all walks of life. The negativity stayed where its suppose to be. In the art of music! The Commission all support & raise their families, 40+ hour a week jobs, and still contribute to produce music & performing. 'Humble!' The best word to describe this individual character, music, and presence. "We want to entertain and tell a story that people can relate. Blood sweat and tears is metaphorical and literal trials we have invested to create this music for fans." says The Commission. They are now just asking for the chance to inspire more fans just like you. reverbnation.com/commission801

What is the Funding for?

You can view the recognitions  of this perserverant group below; but to the point. The Commission are asking for the funds to aid in spreading their music to markets that will embrace their music. Just a few pre-fielded markets are L.A., San Diego, Oakland/Bay Area, Seattle, Portland, Dallas, Alburqurque, Miami, Orlando, and more. About 20+ with more regions being qualified.

They played by the rules, they used conventional means, they paid every talent manager to help them get ahead, and rubbed all the "right" shoulders. But they see now that the talley of success they have accrued thus far only came from rubbing elbows with one group of people. The Fans! The Commission will engage the only people that have the real clout to determine their success. You the fans past, present, and future!

We, The Commission's exposure & management team, have created a highly effective digitial/ground campaign strategy to penetrate these markets and expose this quality, harmonious, unique brand of hip hop to the masses in this tour. The breakdown will be (20 markets/over 6 - 8 months):

- $6500 for Social Media/Online Push that will garner a opening introduction and continuous brand recognition to these markets

- $8000 to execute a customized "Industry" campaign including "Taster Days" to the DJ's, radio stations, and hip hop music afficianados in these markets and partners in sub markets to see key endorsements

- $30k - $40k for ground teams for grassroots promo and local PR firms to liaise public outreach and opportunities

- $30k for fuel, upkeep, maintenance of Tour Transportation. Tour vehicle already attained

- $7500 for tour management team to coordinate, report, procure, budget, analyze and optimize entire tour.

The entire tour budget is $75,000. Every contribution is truly appreciate, but we broke down to be equipped for the tour at $35 - $50 from 1500 fans; or $100 x 750. Yeah we were surprised how reasonable it was too. This campaign is to offset costs of the needed resources to give the music a fair, none corporate monopoly backed chance, to flourish on these stops. We look to commence the tour shortly after the crowd fund concludes.  Looking to add your town if not coming already.

Commission Recognitions received:

- Reverbnation's 1st, 2nd & 3rd top Hip Hop artists in the Mountain West region 3 years straight

- Reserved, not paid for, spots from promoters to open for national acts like E-40, Twista, Naughty by Nature, DMX, The Game, Ice Cube, B-Legit, Cypress Hill, and many more.

- Articles published in several City Weekly's, I.N.K. Mag, Crazy N Sane Mag, Lowrider Mag. As well as several music blogs. Specifically "Best Hip Hop Group", From City Weekly 2010.

We thank you in advance for looking in on funding The Commission's "Made Men U.S." Tour. We hope to garner you as a fan either way the wind blows on your decision to contribute.  facebook.com/commission801

story:
Why, hello!  

Thank you for stopping by and reading about my story and worthy cause. 

My name is Tessa, and I am a classically trained musician, voice teacher, and Arts administrator & advocate.  I was trained at the Peabody Institute of the Johns Hopkins University and the University of Wisconsin-Green Bay.  And as part of my pet project, Riding for a Reason, I have been cycling hundreds of miles to raise funds for various causes in my hometown, as well as to give back to my hometown the only way I know how--with music--since 2011.

In 2007 I traveled to Florence, Italy for a week-long study abroad course as an undergraduate.  I recently was invited by my mentor and former voice teacher to join the course as a non-student in March 2015.  Despite a hefty price tag, I knew I needed to make this trip happen yet again.  The first time I traveled to Florence, my perception and life changed remarkably for the better. With your help, I will be able to make the second trip even more memorable and beneficial for my performing, teaching and arts administrative career.  Your donation will help me to achieve these career-developing and enhancing activities during  my week in Florence:

  •      Performing in the several venues, taking intensive Italian language training,          and rehearsing with incredible musicians
  •      Auditioning for Advanced Degrees at conservatories (I have been                          auditioning in the USA as well for Doctoral of Musical Arts programs) and          music festivals 
  •      Sitting at the Round Table discussions for the Del Bianco Foundation                 for their annual meeting 
  •      Reconnecting with several musical and arts administration colleagues I              met the first  time I visited Florence  
  •      College credit toward my Doctoral Degree (once degree is started)

Being a freelance musician and not-for-profit administrator, I do not have the means on hand to pay for this trip out of pocket.  I am seeking your help in order to make this incredible career enhancing opportunity a reality.  This strategic trip will help me broaden my performing experience, gain knowledge of international arts administration & philanthropy, and lead to future study of an Italian art form in its homeland. 

For those who donate more than $50, there will be a CD of my singing with a variety of repertoire for your listening pleasure!

Even if you can't donate, I would appreciate if you let friends and family know of my campaign!

To learn more about me, visit my blogs:

Riding for a Reason
Tessa's Homegrown
Versant Vocalist

My name is Tessa, and I am a classically trained musician, voice teacher, and Arts administrator & advocate.  I was trained at the Peabody Institute of the Johns Hopkins University and the University of Wisconsin-Green Bay.  And as part of my pet project, Riding for a Reason, I have been cycling hundreds of miles to raise funds for various causes in my hometown, as well as to give back to my hometown the only way I know how--with music--since 2011.

In 2007 I traveled to Florence, Italy for a week-long study abroad course as an undergraduate.  I recently was invited by my mentor and former voice teacher to join the course as a non-student in March 2015.  Despite a hefty price tag, I knew I needed to make this trip happen yet again.  The first time I traveled to Florence, my perception and life changed remarkably for the better. With your help, I will be able to make the second trip even more memorable and beneficial for my performing, teaching and arts administrative career.  Your donation will help me to achieve these career-developing and enhancing activities during  my week in Florence:



     Performing in the several venues, taking intensive Italian language training,          and rehearsing with incredible musicians


     Auditioning for Advanced Degrees at conservatories (I have been                          auditioning in the USA as well for Doctoral of Musical Arts programs) and          music festivals 


     Sitting at the Round Table discussions for the Del Bianco Foundation                 for their annual meeting 


     Reconnecting with several musical and arts administration colleagues I              met the first  time I visited Florence  

     College credit toward my Doctoral Degree (once degree is started)
Being a freelance musician and not-for-profit administrator, I do not have the means on hand to pay for this trip out of pocket.  I am seeking your help in order to make this incredible career enhancing opportunity a reality.  This strategic trip will help me broaden my performing experience, gain knowledge of international arts administration & philanthropy, and lead to future study of an Italian art form in its homeland. 
For those who donate more than $50, there will be a CD of my singing with a variety of repertoire for your listening pleasure!
Even if you can't donate, I would appreciate if you let friends and family know of my campaign!
To learn more about me, visit my blogs:Riding for a ReasonTessa's HomegrownVersant Vocalist

story:
Desire

 My second album, Original Game, is a study of Desire, exploring it as this game people play together, and as this game Desire itself plays with every man and every woman. It's exploring the many facets of Desire -as lust, freedom, immortality, self-awareness and love.

Original Game :  Deck of Cards

The project started with the concept of Desire as the first -original- game people have been playing together for as long as humans can remember being humans. I wanted to produce an album that would bring about a fresh perspective to this theme, old as Time. 

Musing on the words game, and original, and the concept of timelessness, I decided to release the album as a deck of cards, for playing cards are, indeed, this other game people have been engaging in for the past few centuries. 

This idea came as a fun, new medium for music release, as well as an wonderful, exciting artistic challenge. I've divided the four suites between four visual artists from Montreal: Allex Bel, Adbala Kaufman, Audrey Desrosiers, and Emilie Leger. Together, they will bring about four different interpretations of every song. Each suite holds a special meaning, and each of the 13 songs has its own story -making for a unique, complete work of art.

As for the music, the most convenient way to present it was to put it on a USB key, in a basic card format. The USB card, which will perfectly fit in the pack of cards, will thus feature the 13 tracks, the complete artwork series in digital format, the lyrics, the songs' stories, the game rules, the credits, wallpapers, promo pictures, exclusive behind-the-scenes content, and more! 

Where the money will go

The starting goal is $5300. The printing of 500 custom-made decks of cards, and their packaging, sums up to $2573.03, and 500 USB cards come up to another 2,656.50$. All the additional funds I may get from you will go straight to paying the bills, which are: 

- the studio time
- the sound engineer
- the session musicians
- the four artists
- the graphic designer who will be putting it all together
- all the exclusive new merch items

Every dollar you will give me will become a part of my budget for the production and release of the pack of cards, thus contributing to bringing this incredible Work of Art to Life. 

Are you ready to play your part in the Original Game? Here's how -and what's in it for you!

story:
The campaign ends soon!

Our campaign is nearly over! It ends on Saturday, June 6th at midnight (PST). We are hoping to get to a level of $5,000, and it is within reach! We chose "flexible funding", so whatever funds we will have raised at the close of the campaign will be used for our CD. We'll need to trim our original budget some, but a great CD is now within sight, thanks to all contributors!

Who we are

Since 2011, three cohorts evolved into The Squares by playing many gigs in Cape May, New Jersey, at venues like the Pilot House and the Mad Batter. The Squares are a woman and two men: Debra Donahue, M.Q. Murphy, and J.M. Kearns. Please click on Gallery (above) to see a slide show of our history, featuring one of our original songs! MQ and JM play guitars (including electric lead by MQ), and all of us sing lead vocals and harmonies. JM and MQ write original songs, bunches of which will be featured on the CD, as will some cover tunes that we can't do without.

Funding, perks, and all that

We are raising funds to cover recording, mixing, mastering, design, manufacture, and promotion of our CD. Because our music is eclectic, we plan to divide the work among several studios and then entrust our project to Oasis, the excellent CD manufacturer. Everyone who contributes $10 or more will receive a free CD download, and we have lots of special perks for contributors at higher levels...including private house concerts and so on. (See Perks on right!) To give us needed info for your perk (such as delivery address or T-shirt size), you can message us here on IndieGogo or on our Facebook page (see link at the bottom of this page), or we will email you for the info.

Why this CD now?

Our fans have no product to listen to, but they're always requesting it. In the Squares we have two people (Debra and MQ) who have never released a CD, and one person (JM) who has released exactly one. We know many people are eager to hear our voices on a recorded project (and we feel the same way!) and this CD will make that happen. Those who attend our live gigs will be able to take our music home with them. The CD will also be a way for us to expand our reach -- by achieving airplay on radio stations such as WXPN in Philly and WFUV in New York, who do so much to support independent music. The next step - no doubt - will be opening for Lyle Lovett... You'll be helping all this happen if you support our venture.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge for any recording project is to get the right studio, the right engineer, and the right backers. Things have to be done in a way that lets the artists relax and be themselves. The artists also have to have major input into the process at every point. Speaking of backers, that is why the funding needs to come from you -- our friends and supporters. It's the only way to retain creative control and deliver the kind of artistry that you want.

We did a pilot project of three songs "at home" on basic equipment (you'll be able to watch/listen to them on our Facebook page). That helped us learn how to navigate as a trio in the recording process; now we're ready to use outside facilities for more demanding/complex songs. We will make sure that every step of this journey has our fingerprints on it.

J.M.'s experience as a former recording engineer (Nashville) is our ace in the hole, as we make sure that we have the personnel, equipment, and freedom to keep the process on course.

story:
Christophe Elie - New CD Bridging Borders

On October 22nd, 2014, I booked a day in the studio and began the journey to make my second album Bridging Borders.  The album explores both the beauty and challenge of those intersections in life of culture, religion, language and geography.   

This album is a reflection of the idea that despite those differences that divide us, it is those differences that make us stronger.  My Album Bridging Borders invites you to explore and celebrate those differences between us.  

This album though is nothing without you.  Join in, contribute in whatever way you can, become a part of the vision of Bridging Borders!  You can pre-purchase the CD, purchase tickets to the CD release or book a house concert. 

My CD release party will be a musical celebration of the idea of Bridging Borders.  A representative from Wakefield for Refugees will share the story of the families from Syria that have come to settle in Wakefield. Recommendations from the Truth and Reconciliation commission, that studied the issue of Residential schools, will also be shared. 


This album is made up of 11 songs, the songs explore stories from within and beyond our borders.  The Borealis Expedition a song that charts the tragic journey of the Karluk, that left our West coast just over 100 years ago that was shipwrecked, a hopeful song called Two Feathers that considers Indigenous, Canadian relations, a French Chansonnier song written about Quebec's Charter of Values, "Can you see me" considers the refugee crisis.  A song about the Middle East, a song about Haiti, songs about our heritage here on this land, about war and peace, about our steps through life 

These songs are about our time we are sharing on this earth right now, these turbulent times.  The album is a shamelessly hopeful one that explores the beauty and tragedy of the intersections that both divide and unite us. 

If you're not familiar with my music, you can always check out my first album at  http://chriselie.bandcamp.com. 

CD Release Party

The Bridging Borders CD release party will be held on Sunday June 5th at 4:00 at the Blacksheep Inn, Wakefield QC.  Joining me as special guests will be North Easton, Eniid and my musical partners - Rock Stock and Barrel.

The CD Release will include a representative from Refugees for Wakefield who will be providing an update on their progress. There will also be a reading related to the recommendations from the Truth and Reconciliation Commission that reviewed the impact of Residential schools on the indigenous community. 

How can you support the Project?

This is how you can get involved :

  • Give a BucK
  • Pre-purchase the CD Bridging Borders
  • Purchase my first CD or one of the various packages
  • Host a Bridging Borders House show
  • Please share this with other music lovers
  • Share the idea on Social Media - A new album is coming out that explores the challenge and beauty of our differences - Bridging Borders.

The Impact

It has been 8 years since my last CD :

  • I knew this past fall, the time had come for these songs to see the light of day
  • These songs are all about the struggles that we are all having in this world. My hope is that these songs may spark discussions we need to have to bridge the borders between us
  • The impact is all based on you, it is you all who listen, share and talk about music that magnifies the impact of a song  

  • This is my second CD so I feel more prepared facing the challenges to completing and releasing this album

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you'd like to support this project in another way :

    • Share this campaign with friends of other cultures, languages, religions 
    • Share this Project with others
    • Come out to my show, I'll keep you posted on upcoming shows  
    • Discuss the themes from this album with strangers, colleagues, friends and family

    Special thanks

    Special thanks to Dave Draves who has been my fearless partner on this project,  The album is being recorded in his studio Little Bullhorn Studios.  Thanks to Tara Shannon who worked closely with me on my songwriting on this album.  North Easton, Robin Earl, Shaun Clare, Anne Vaillancourt, Sean Sisk, Corey Johnstone, Amanda Rheaume, Eric St. Cyr, Carol Goodman all played a part in some way in the making of this album. The campaign photo is by Richard Smith of a bridge in Pensacola Florida.   And thank you, for listening to the music!

story:
My name is Levi Kerr and I am an artist from Lancaster, Pa. Thank you for visiting this fundraiser! As soon as a song becomes that moment that you are inside of, that place, is the "why" behind why I write and love music. Those are the moments I have been chasing while writing and recording these songs. The album I am planning to release is 9 songs I have chosen from about a 9 month period of writing last year. As I began to take my songwriting more seriously during this time, I really wanted them to be captured in a raw, up close and personal feel. So I went to Carter Mahnke, a producer and now great friend, to flesh out these songs and I believe we have done them justice. We spent many hours pumping out each part in Carters bedroom studio in Norfolk, Va. as well as other incredible musicians from the Norfolk and Lancaster community.

As it stands now, the album is just about ready to be mastered and then can be published for your hearing! So please, YOU can partner with me to help me raise the funds to release this record!! I've come up with some awesome perks to get the giving season a brewing! Plus, you can use this to pre-order the record! (you know you want that on vinyl)
 Again, thank you for checking out this campaign, I would be honored to have your support!



What We Need & What You Get
Breakin' it down for folks in more detail:

So what all do i actually need? How can you really help me?
These are some of the expenses and how they break down:
   •   Producing/Recording costs: 1,500
   •   Analog Mixing: $860
   •   Mastering - $450
   •   Album Artwork - $200
   •   Printing Physical Media and to pay musicians est: $2,000-$3000

          Fortunately, we have been able to make this record on an extremely affordable budget and done with integrity at each stage. To pay for these jobs to get completed I am looking to raise at least $5,000 through your support. That is the goal, here's a taste of the incentives:
          My personal favorite perk would have to be the set of film photo's Carter Mahnke developed in his own room! Many more other options including vinyl pre-order and t shirts yada yada. Anyway, I hope you can take a few minutes and find a level of support that you can give and get an awesome gift in return!
          If I cant quite reach the goal I have set for this campaign, the vinyl release will be set back and I'll keep painting away for the rest of the funds to get that done. 



The Impact !


A few reasons that I believe this project has a lot of value, will be exasperated in this paragraph. To start, Carter Mahnke has poured so much hard work and precision into the recording process that I cant resist but mention him first. Right off the get go we were on the same page, excited to track with our reel to reel 8 track and tascam 4 track. We were set on capturing real performances and songs that are full of life. Transparency in the recording process was an ease with Carter around and it really shows. A record that sounds great and feels alive is really valuable to me so I wanted to make sure that every aspect was geared towards that motive. The feel of the album is coherent, symbolic, and eerie but warm. Solid musicianship and excellence have been my standards for the writing process, being positive I had written and crafted these songs to the best of my ability. Also, having a cast of incredible musicians on the record helps (I can't do it all!! haha). Carter laid down some beautiful synth and energetic drums, Jon Sieler on upright Bass, Taylor Brandt on violin, Megan Perry Fisher composed a beautiful piano part for the song 'Cold Spin'... the list goes on. Needless to say, I am super blessed to have the golden touch of the community around me on this record.
I couldn't resist going on a tangent and inserting a favorite quote of mine here, but this isn't an essay so I'm not too worried, I think it captures what I am trying to say with the whole value thing.

          "It is the cardinal difference between gift and commodity exchange that a gift establishes a feeling-bond between two people, while the sale of a commodity leaves no necessary connection" The Gift by Lewis Hyde

          Treating these songs as they were a gift to me to give out has been a high priority of mine. So even at the mixing stage these songs were mixed using analog gear and lots of care and allowing each song to find its place. If by the end this gift exchange, people are connecting with those same moments of creativity and joy as in the recordings, then my heart will be full.



Other Ways You Can Help!

If your broke, or just dont think you want to give to this campaign, no worries! Its a good thing to save money and yeah im not gonna go into that now BUT there are some things you can still do to help!
Getting the word out about pre-ordering the album, sharing the perks etc. through social media, face to face, and even through telepathy if your able to. There's a bunch of nice little colored bottons that help you share it on facebook and twitter and stuff. Once again, thank you so much for taking time out of your day to check out this campaign, for your support, and for sharing the gift!

Heaps of Love,
Levi Kerr Schlosser

story:
Short Summary

Utopia Entertainment is a company that brings Kpop to Australia. I don't know about you guys but the lack of Kpop in Australia has definitely been driving us insane. Some of you may remember us from The Eric Nam showcase that was held in November last year? Well we had such an amazing response that we are back for more and this time aiming for a bigger and better showcase!

You guys know LunaFly...right? Well we are planning on bringing them down under for an epic night of performances and fan signing  As well as the gorgeous LunaFly boys our showcase will also show off some local talents. Your contributions will go towards fight costs, venture hire, accommodation and of course feeding our amazing volunteers. So any contribution that you make will help this event (and future events) happen. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal at $8000 to help get us started but this isn't going to cover everything. So please pledge whatever you can! But we aren't expecting you to give us your money without getting anything in return so we have organised some awesome goodies for pledges that vary depending on the amount they pledge.

For more details on what these goodies are check out the "Perks" section.

The Impact

Lets face it, there is a serious lack of Kpop within Australia but a reasonably large and ever growing audience for it. Utopia Entertainment aims to meet Australia's need for more Kpop by organising for Kpop Idols and Groups to visit Australia to perform and meet their fans from down under.

Other Ways You Can Help

Stay tuned to find out about volunteer positions that may be available during the Showcase or contact us through our Facebook page with any questions. 

If you have a business and would like to find out the perks of sponsoring our event then please contact us at utopiaent.brisbane@gmail.com

story:
I'm Jen Hajj, a singer-songwriter based out of Idyllwild, California. I tour extensively, playing festivals, house concerts, cafes, and spiritual centers. My music has been described as comfort food that takes listeners to happy places.

I was looking for a quiet space for creativity when I stumbled upon the perfect place to record music...in a bomb shelter in my back yard. I must admit, it is super creepy. There are spiders, and it is lit by a single light bulb. It is cold and institutional, like a prison cell. But this little concrete room has a natural reverberation and warmth I never expected, and I'm able to capture the hushed, intimate undertones of my songs in a way I've never experienced before.  Listen to this song, my first recording in the bomb shelter. 

This bomb shelter is...the bomb.

Now I'm getting myself set to record a CD of lullabies and bedtime songs in the bomb shelter.  These songs are special to me. They bring me comfort and peace, which I would like to share with you.

A contribution to this campaign will help me transform the tracks I record into something that can be shared with the rest of the world.  It will cover the expenses of mastering, manufacturing and distribution of the new CD, including pitching it to folk radio stations across the globe.

You can read more about me and the genesis of this project on my blog.

Here's the Nitty Gritty. Most of the production costs are coming out of my investment of time and energy. I'm looking for $2000 in support to help me distribute this project.  This includes:
  • $500 to pay someone to fine tune and master the bomb shelter tracks
  • $500 to manufacture CDs (I'll start with 300-500)
  • $1000 to promote the CD out in the world.  This will be done using a variety of methods including mailings to radio people and showcasing at folk music conferences. $1000 is actually a low number...this could be easily doubled or tripled, with expanded outcomes.

There are perks. Check them out. The biggest perk? The feeling that you helped create something unique and interesting.

    Can't donate? That's not a problem. There are other ways you can get involved.
    • Do you have a skill? If you can help me accomplish any of the above, in kind, then the need to raise money is less critical.
    • Do you have ears? You can be a listener/reviewer to help me with quality control.
    • Do you like me? Just share this with someone who might appreciate it.

story:
We are Cryptopsy, an extreme metal band from Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Apparently, we are a "boundary pushing tech juggernaut" and we sound like "we’re racing each other into a giant meat grinder, on motor bikes, and that we all have rabies and advanced degrees in jazz composition" (according to Mad Sourman from MetalSucks.net).


INDEPENDENT ARTISTS

After being on a record label for our entire career, in 2012, we decided to go independent.  We released our album Cryptopsy and we were extremely pleased with the outcome.  Supported by our fans, we distributed and sold thousands of albums across the entire globe and had the opportunity to tour Japan, Western and Eastern Europe, the UK, South America, Scandinavia, Canada and we even got to play on a metal cruise ship. Without fans coming out to the shows, buying our merchandise and our music, this would never have been possible.


MORE MUSIC

Cryptopsy has a lengthy writing process as we strive to top our previous release and challenge ourselves creatively.  After three years, many of you are eager to hear new material.  We listened: Instead of an album, we will release a series of EPs entitled The Book of Suffering. This approach will allow us to put out new music more often while remaining true to our standards of quality.

With your support, we will be able to fully share our creative vision of extreme technical music through enhanced sound, original artwork, videos and live show visuals. 

----------------

This is how we would breakdown our funding:


RECORDING/MIXING/MASTERING

Cryptopsy’s sound is all about intricate details.  Although we are extremely brutal, a great deal of thought has gone into the tempos, time signatures, guitar and bass riffs, vocal patterns, lyrics and samples. For this reason, we will work with respected sound engineers to bring out the subtleties in the music. First, all of the writing and tracking will be done at The Grid, our guitarist Christian Donaldson’s new fantastic studio here in Montreal. Second, the mix will be in the hands of the legendary Jason Suecof in Florida. And finally, the great Alan Douches at West West Side Music in New York will handle the mastering.


LIVE SHOW

As performers, we aim to leave everything out on the stage every single night.  We now want to visually tie in the concept of the EP with updated banners to enhance our concert experience.


MUSIC VIDEO

The release of new Cryptopsy music videos was one of your top requests.  For The Book of Suffering Tome 1, we will produce a professional music video to visualize the technical brutality of our sound. 

THE PERKS

We couldn’t do this without you.  To thank you for your support, we have exclusive t-shirts, girly tank tops, hoodies, signed cds and vinyls. In addition to the more traditional merchandise, we will be offering signed Flo Mounier cymbals, online lessons with each band member, guest performances on your band’s album and a song mix by our guitarist Chris Donaldson.  For those who are interested in memorabilia, we are offering our trusty stage banners that have traveled the world with us.

WHAT IF WE SURPASS OUR GOAL?

Our goal is the bare minimum required to record/mix/master this EP, as well as produce artwork, a music video and updated banners.  But there is more that we would like to create for you such as a play-through video, a tour documentary and more music.  As we get more funding, we will be able to give more back to you.

THANK YOU

We hope that every extreme metal fan will be exposed to The Book of Suffering Tome 1.  We are extremely proud of the material; it is some of the most brutal, technical and fresh music we have ever created.

Even if you don’t have the funds available to help us out, please spread the word about our campaign and talk about the album.   Take this Facebook Banner photo (right-click "save as"), and make it your Facebook banner to let others know that you support Cryptopsy's The Book of Suffering Tome 1.

We sincerely appreciate your support! 

Cryptopsy



--------------------------------

story:
Hello beautiful people and welcome to our Love Dynamite campaign.

We are J.O.!

We are very excited about our EP and our single, Love Dynamite.

We formed our group and had our first show in March 16, 2014. Since embarking on our mission of intergalactic love power expansion, we have been performing and spreading love at various venues all throughout WA and along the way developing new songs.

We have complete creative control but we are entirely self-funded. We have been working hard in the studio recording and mixing our songs. We are hoping to release our EP this summer.

In an effort to promote our EP and share our music, we have decided to create a music video of our single, Love Dynamite. We have found an amazing talent, Izzy Corey, to work with us on our music video.

Our goal is $2500.00

Any pledge amount counts, we have amazing rewards for all contribution levels. We would love to have you be a part of our journey by contributing and helping us create this music video. Let’s build together, it's the J.O. way!

Thank you very much! Peace, love, and prosperity!

story:
UPDATE! ;) Exclusive t-shirt only available to backers!

Select the $25 Perk for the exclusive t-shirt and this can be yours! :D

Short Summary

We've been so thankful for all of your support thus far in helping us realize our dream and potential as independently funded “DIY” artist. All your support from the last year and a half has allowed us to reach markets we never would have been able to reach without. Recently, we've been working on getting our next album out to you and with this one we are pushing the envelope even higher. With doing so, comes more and more attention from eyes in the industry which leads to more and more opportunities for us to make it to that next level. This is where you come in with your contributions to this campaign; you will be personally involved in the production and promotion of our new album “The Artificial Heart”. By helping us achieve this, you will become a part of our family and our journey.


What We Need & What You Get

This fundraiser is to help give us a jump start on the financial expenses that go into creating an album. $5000 is our goal and it will put a significant dent towards the expenses for our album and upcoming touring. There is still much more time and money that we will be investing on our own and you can see the full breakdown of costs below for full transparency.

Check out the sample of the upcoming merchandise we will have available for you soon! 


Exclusive Fundraiser Packages

We've created some awesome and unique perk packages for your level of contribution! Check 'em out!



The Impact

By taking part in this campaign you, yourself, are taking charge and helping to shape how we make music. You are putting faith in us to come through and show you that we've learned a lot over this past year. This time heading into the studio we kept in mind the people that helped us get to where we are and with that the responsibility on us is so much higher in order for us to push that envelope farther than ever.

With that in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle for “good enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this thing will be reflected in the final product.

Here's to making our best album yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't know what to think about this idea and aren't sure you can commit – there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We don't expect everyone who's listened to and enjoyed our music to jump on board, just let people know this is happening. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.

story: Canopus has been a band for 3 years. They have played shows all over Los Angeles and OC. At these shows they have been asked many times, "Do you guys have anything recorded?" Their answer is no. Why is this you ask? The reason is funding. This is why we come to our friends and family help us make the music you already love to hear on a recorded surface. The more funding we get, the more songs we'll be able to record and give to you. You decide if you want an EP or a full album!

story:
Let's make the comeback stronger than the setback!

SEE BELOW for shipping and release update... "when you contribute" WE ARE STILL LIVE

Since we reached our original goal, this page is allowed to continue to accept contributions. We will be leaving this page live since we are currently $3000 over our recording expense budget, due to an unexpected amazing resource/producer/mixer who has agreed to work with us! We are so excited! Thank you everyone for your support, loyalty and enthusiasm!

Be a part of this monumental recording by contributing and receiving everything from autographed cd's and European tour posters to private concerts! *All details and health update included in the above pitch video. *** INTERNATIONAL support welcome!! ***

*Please read the My Story page on Devil-Doll.com for complete story about Colleen's health journey and update.  Join the Devil Doll mailing list for future updates...

Benchmark Goals

-$48,000 +++ - All funds beyond this point will be funneled between various areas such as, printing new merchandise w/international sales, creating new artwork & logos, photoshoots, additional gear or recording equipment, additional film/video footage, travel & rehearsal expenses for future Southern California performances, preproduction for future recordings etc.

-$47,000 - 3rd music video

-$44,000 - vinyl production (of new album & others)

-$40,000 - 2nd music video

-$35,000 - Maintenance & upkeep of new website/store/merch/social platforms

-$32,000 - Hiring of a publicist

-$29,000 - Re-pressing of past 2 CD's

-$26,500 - Music video for title track

-$21,500 - MAKE THE RECORD. Preproduction, Musicians, Recording, Mixing, Engineer & Producer fees, Manufacturing, Distribution, Graphic Artist, Photographer, Merchandise printing, Mailing costs *We will be recording in the same studio Prince recorded Purple Rain. It is the same room where Queen of Pain was recorded.

*Please keep in mind that Indiegogo takes an 8% commission on both contributions and mailing costs. All the numbers you see here reflect this.

** EACH WEEK we will be adding NEW 'Limited Edition' perks. Be sure to follow the Devil Doll Instagram page @DevilDoll_Official for previews!

Thank you everyone for all of your support throughout my career in sickness and in health. May you make memories with these new songs and may they carry you in your time of need. It is my pleasure to create music for you. Love, Colleen xo

*Please share this page and help us get the word out!

www.Devil-Doll.com

Follow Devil Doll on Instagram!  @DevilDoll_Official

Facebook.com/DevilDollBand

________________________________________________

When you contribute...

- Please use a PERMANENT mailing address, because although **all physical items including cd's will be mailed throughout April 2020... as a contributor you will get a download link to the new album before the worldwide release date.

- Please direct any issues or questions about your items or otherwise through the link in your confirmation email. They will route directly to this platform which we will be able to effectively manage. This page has a link link should you have questions regarding larger contributions etc... OR you can email us at info@devil-doll.com, but correspondence through the IndieGoGo platform will be MUCH quicker and easier to track. Please include your order number.

- Autographs. Any autographed items will give you the option to have the item signed out in one of the following categories -  1- none, / 2- "Love, Colleen" (only) / 3- to 'billing name' Love, Colleen/  4- will message DDoll with info **which means >>> send us a message here on the platform with your order info and autograph instructions **

- All other inquiries, please send them to us through this platform for quickest response.

THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!!!! -xo

story:
Who is YoungHeart?

We are a Christian band made up of four siblings. Our mission is to sing of God’s love to strengthen in His truth and our vision is to inspire a generation to let go of all that they think they are, for all that Christ is making them to be.

This campaign is important to us because it helps us reach people in a way that we otherwise would not be able to. Music gives us the opportunity to connect with thousands of people around the world for one greater purpose, Jesus. By donating to our campaign you are helping make that possible. With your help we can continue to reach the world for Christ by using the gifts He’s given us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to do this project. A lot of these funds are going towards studio time. Here’s the cost split up.  

  • Recording: $10,000
  • Travel: $500
  • Packaging/Promoting: $2,000
  • Music Video: $2,500

We love to give back so we’ll be offering rewards like free songs, merch and so many other cooler things!

If we do not reach this goal, we’d still put the funds towards recording. We would just be limited in what we do with the recording.

 

The Impact

We may be young (spanning from 12 to 19), but we want to remind others that they can make a difference regardless of their age. Jesus calls us all to have a childlike faith and we hope that our music will encourage others to develop that faith and spread the gospel in whatever way God has equipped them to do so. Our medium just happens to be music and we want to be good stewards of what God has placed in our hands.

In June 2016, God called us to sell our house, buy an R.V., and tour the country for five months. We played in over 40 cities wherever God brought us; ranging from large parades to small church gatherings. God connected us with @trustgodbro, @christian_worship, and @heis1stbrand on Instagram, and within a year grew our Instagram following to over 28,000 followers. We are currently planning for Borderline Music Festival. A two day Christian music festival with over 7 artists (Capital Kings, Unspoken, Building 429, Tedashii, etc…) and an estimated attendance of over 12,000 concert-goers over two days.

It would mean alot if you helped us reach our goal!

 

Risks & Challenges

Developing a project is a lot of work and can be a major risk for us and those involved, as it can easily end up being a waste of time and money. It would involve some challenges such as long travel times to and from the studio, as well as packaging and promoting the final outcome. However, we are confident that God has opened many doors that have led us to this moment and if God is in it, then we have no reason to fear or over analyze the risk factors.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute with a monetary donation, we’d love if you could spread the word by mouth or on your social media platforms. Anything helps and we’d be very grateful for your support.
story_txt:
Who is YoungHeart?
We are a Christian band made up of four siblings. Our mission is to sing of God’s love to strengthen in His truth and our vision is to inspire a generation to let go of all that they think they are, for all that Christ is making them to be.
This campaign is important to us because it helps us reach people in a way that we otherwise would not be able to. Music gives us the opportunity to connect with thousands of people around the world for one greater purpose, Jesus. By donating to our campaign you are helping make that possible. With your help we can continue to reach the world for Christ by using the gifts He’s given us.
 
What We Need & What You Get
We need $15,000 to do this project. A lot of these funds are going towards studio time. Here’s the cost split up.  

Recording: $10,000
Travel: $500
Packaging/Promoting: $2,000
Music Video: $2,500

We love to give back so we’ll be offering rewards like free songs, merch and so many other cooler things!

story:
Our Story

Cate and Chris met six years ago and were immediate comrades. We both had varied musical pasts and had stepped away from writing and playing. After relocating to the same block in New Orleans, we began to casually pick up our instruments again and found that we had quite similar natural aesthetics for music.  Over time, we began toying with harmonies and collaborating on songs, with no real intentions of performing out or recording.  The music gradually became a central bond in our friendship and strengthened our creative musings.  A year or so later, Chad entered the picture.  He became sweethearts with Chris and mutual best friends with Cate.  After hearing a couple rehearsals, Chad started to lend a rich third part to our harmonies and piano fills over the guitar and uke.  Needless to say, it became swiftly apparent that he was the vital finishing touch to the band’s sound. The three of us continued to write and play around the neighborhood; on friends porches and in living rooms.  Never seeking an audience, just truly enjoying the craft of songwriting and the feeling of making music together.  On any given day, you could hear our three part harmonies lofting out of Chris’ open door.  One day, while singing on the front porch, a Bywater local heard us playing a tune and invited us to do a local gig.  We came up with the name "The Wanting" in reference to the "high lonesome sound" of early bluegrass and traditional Appalachian music. There's a pervasive yearning in those songs that really speaks to the human spirit.  It’s that feeling that was the inspiration for the name and the essence of our songs. From that moment on, our band became mobile, continuing to be booked around the city at some very unique venues and on the local radio. 


The genuine response that we have gotten to our music has been really incredible.  We've received a great deal of support as a band from our favorite watering hole, BJ's in the Bywater, and our local radio station WWOZ.  We began to get booked at BJ’s due, in large part, to  Ryan Scully.  Scully is the singer and guitarist from the legendary New Orleans jazz, funk, rock band, Morning 40 Federation.  He has been and continues to be one of our biggest supporters and introduced us to WWOZ DJ AJ “The Boudin Man” Rodrigue. To be asked to play, streaming live/in-studio on WWOZ's long running "Kitchen Sink Sessions”, was a huge honor for all three of us and the response we received contributed greatly to our decision to record this album. During our performance a DJ from the station phoned in and said, "Those guys are the Peter Paul and Mary of 2017". We pinched ourselves a few times, had a band meeting the next night, and here we are...in the early stages of recording our debut album "Autumns Daughter". Right around that time we met Recording Engineer, Ben Mumphrey.  We were offered a deal to stay and record the album at “Studio in the Country” in Bogalusa, Louisiana. We are all extremely thrilled to render these songs and give them a new life, as a collection, with accompanying art work and music videos. With your support we hope to do so in the fall of this year.

 

Your Support

We are hoping to raise enough funds to rent the studio, hire the engineer, pay musicians, and for mixing and mastering. All of this combined will most likely cost more than our goal amount but it will get us well on our way. Once we have the album complete we will set up a small tour and hopefully play in a town near you! 

We have some really great perks set up, the most special being recordings on one-off records. The record will be made on vintage recording gear from the 1930’s that records directly to vinyl. We'll record a handful of our songs in one take, probably on his back porch. Those who choose this incentive will get a unique, one of a kind Wanting record! We are also doing some live studio Skype or FaceTime performances for our supporters outside of New Orleans. 

 Thank you very much for your consideration and supporting our passion! We hope to have our debut album "Autumns Daughter" for you very soon!!

story:
Everyone in Beckon Lane is passionate about music! We have spent a long time writing these songs, testing them live, tweaking them and making sure every single song that will be featured on this album is brilliant! 

We decided to start this campaign to fund our album recording sessions, we are not asking for the whole amount, but for what will be part of the recording. The amount raised will help us make sure we can spend more time in the studio, recording every note as perfectly as possible and with the help of mixer/engineer/producer Philip Wilbraham, and we can release an album that we as a band, as well as everyone involved and contributing, can be proud of! 

We are campaigning to raise the amount of £2000. The actual budget is going to be a little over double that amount, although we cannot be sure until we have the final bill land at our table. 
Remember, we are asking you to buy our record in advance, to help with the costs of recording, PR and other costs involved, so Another Paradise can be released. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Like we said, we need to raise £2000 to record this album. This is only part of the costs we are anticipating. 
  • We have thought long about what we can offer you. There will be an exclusive album deal which includes having your name printed in the album liner notes, for certain contributions you can receive a campaign exclusive Tshirt, pre-sale tickets to our Album/single release show and more. We will also be updating from the studio, previewing tracks, and sharing lyrics from here! 
  • What will happen if we don't raise the amount we want? Nothing, we will still use whatever we get to record the album, we might ask you to send beans and coffee over the winter period though. 

The Impact

If you help us raise the amount, this would mean we can record this album without any compromises. We are planning on getting a PR company involved to help us push the album further.

This album is our next chapter, the most logical step forward for us as a band. So far we have released two EPs, which were greatly reviewed by webzines, and we know that combining everything that we have learned over the years, from our our experiences and growth as a band and as individuals, will make Another Paradise a special release to everyone involved. 
 

Risks & Challenges

We are only asking for part of the money required to record our album. If we cannot raise the whole amount we will still record the album and continue with our release. Everyone contributing will still get their perks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The campaign is running for 60 days, which is plenty of time for anyone to think of what they want from us! If you can't contribute directly, please help us by sharing our campaign with your friends, family and rock music fans! 

  • Don't forget we are on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Instagram, as well as our own website (www.beckonlane.com). So if you want to help us by sharing this campaign, please plaster it all over social media! 

We will update you as much as possible on the progress of both this campaign and the recording! Another Paradise WILL be out 2018!

story:
Hi! I’m Gleb Kolyadin, and you might know me as the pianist and composer for iamthemorning. This time I invite you to take part in creating something unusual.

Last September iamthemorning received the Album of the Year at the Progressive Music Awards.

An incredible luck and honour, it gave me hope that I might spark your interest with something different – an instrumental album. With several years in the making, this project became the essence of everything I enjoy as a musician. Classical piano, ethnic influences, electronic oddness, minimalism, art-rock and fusion – all blend together.

I put together a group of amazingly talented musicians to help bring this all to life, and I am sure the names will get you excited. To keep things interesting, I asked them all to unleash their creative freedom, so be prepared for unique and wild. Also, for all you audiophiles out there, I’m preparing a special high resolution treat.

The project is well on its way, and the piano recording is already scheduled at the same amazing Moscow studio that brought you piano of the Lighthouse.

 

Iamthemorning always sets its bar high when it comes to recording, and we've always been working very hard to be able to afford to live up to this bar, and used crowdfunding a couple of times before. This project is no different – it keeps striving for perfection. 

But this time, it's only me and you guys. As previously with iamthemorning, every penny goes towards the actual recording, mixing and delivering the album, and every penny counts. This is the crucial moment, and I put the destiny of this record into your hands, knowing that together we can make it happen. Join in, spread the word, and I promise the result is going to be like nothing you’ve heard before.

 

Rewards: 

  • ​Link to the album download a day before the official release
  • Signed and numbered CD from a limited edition, printed specifically for the campaign
  • Wooden USB-flash with engraving and hi-res version of the album
  • Beautiful album cover t-shirts
  • Signed score sheet
  • Stickers with cover artwork 
  • Collection of all musical drafts and improvisations from 2012 to 2016
  • Short piano track composed specially for you

 

Accounting:

  • Recording/Mixing ~ 11000$
  • Photos/Videos/Design/Artwork ~ 1700$
  • Manufacturing ~ 1900$
  • Shipping ~ 1600$
  • indiegogo and paypal fees ~ 1800$

story:
About me

For those of you who don't know me yet, I am Lucía Jackson, and I am a professional singer and dancer. I was born in New York City and raised in Spain, where, at an early age, I fell in love with music and dance and realized that I want these art forms to be my life's work. I began my dance and singing training in Madrid, Spain. I attended the Professional Dance Conservatory of Madrid. At the same time I was completing my High School Diploma and learning music at the prestigious school of Musica Creativa on scholarship. At 18, I came back to New York City to pursue that dream after being accepted into The Ailey School for Dance completing a Certificate Program and a Scholarship Program. I am fortunate to have performed and worked as an artist since coming back. Currently, I'm a dancer with FJK Dance Company and Dardo Galletto Dance in NYC.

As a vocalist I have performed in NYC with Marty Schwartz, Bud Maltin, Carmen Estevez Flamenco Band, Ron Jackson, Burning Gums, The Art Lilliard Big Band at Iridium, Drom, Hillstone, The Zinc Bar, The Clinton Foundation, Still, I have not yet had the experience of recording an album of my own. It is an important and very special step in my career and for me as a singer. I know it is possible with your support!

 

 

My Project

Debut Album 

This campaign is raising funds for my Debut Album as a jazz singer and I have a wonderful quartet of musicians working with me: My great dad and jazz guitarist Ron Jackson; Yago Vazquez on piano; Matt Clohesy on double bass; and Corey Rawls on drums.

             

If we reach our goal, I will be able to:

  • Record a fully produced album of ten to twelve songs in a professional studio with my quartet, plus I will have guest musicians play for a few of the songs ($7,000-$9,000)
  • Pay for rehearsal space and the time needed to rehearse with the band before going to the studio ($600-$1,000)
  • Pay for photography, art work, design and manufacturing of the CD ($2,000-$3,000)
  • Cover the costs of radio and press promotion ($3,000-$5,000)
  • Throw a CD Release Party with all the musicians and guest artists at a NYC venue! ($1,000-$1,500)

What I will give to you:

  • A sincere thank you for anything that you can contribute towards this, either financially or by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.

  • Great Exciting Personalized Perks!

Thank you so much for helping me bring this project to life. Your passion, your generosity, and your support are invaluable. All of the band members and I are deeply grateful, and we look forward to seeing you again or meeting you in the near future!  

                       

                                  

UPDATES!

GREAT NEWS!

Thank you everyone for my successful fundraising event on Wednesday, December 21 at Dardo Galleto Dance Studios! We raised $2,000!!!! Now we are 40% toward my goal! Please keep supporting and sharing my campaign so we can reach 100%. Also thank you to everyone that's given so far. We have about 3 weeks left. With your support, we can make this dream possible!

Thank You
