story:
Who we are

Greetings, Friend! We are female fronted (and axed!) thrash/death metal band POKERFACE from Russia. Our music is quite unusual combination of old-school thrash riffs and female scream-growling vocals. Since the moment of formation in 2013 we released two albums - EP 'Terror Is The Law' and LP 'Divide And Rule', and performed many notable shows with such bands like Sodom, Kreator, Megadeth, Sepultura, Overkill, Children of Bodom, Vader, Death DTA, not only in Russia, but in Europe as well.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to record and release a full-length 10-track album "Game On" in first months of the next year. The new album is going to be a natural evolution of our previous works, but different and much more versatile at the same time. There would be still fast and agressive thrash riffs, but songs will be a bit more complex - we added melodies, groove parts, so particularry it would remind some mix of thrash, melodic death and groove metal. There will be some experimental songs also, songs you would never expect from POKERFACE. 

New album "Game On" will have strong ideological concept - we plan to work on album's artwork with the man, who did great arts for the famous (we won't be afraid to say legendary) band, but we keep his name in secret). So, as you can see, we have a really serious intentions to make this album a really strong work, which will allow us to make a huge step further on a big worldwide metal stage!

And we did some demos of new songs, so you could check them out!

So, it's a fair deal: you support us - we reward you, isn't it? Let's see what we can offer to you besides a good album, of course)

  • CD album signed (Terror is the law, Divide and Rule, Game On)
  • T-shirts with album covers or POKERFACE logo
  • 2 Packs: CD+T-shirt+poster or 2CD+2T-shirts+poster on your choise
  • used drum cymbal - Paiste crashes 18" and 20"
  • canvas with 'Divide and Rule' album art (that original one!) as on picture at the top
  • our "emergency"/spare guitar (with or without band members signatures), which is being used at concerts - Gibson Les Paul white: 

Body - Mahagony
Neck - Set, Mahagony, 22 Frets
Bridge - Tune-O-Matic 
Bridge Pickup - IBZUSA F1 by DiMarzio
Neck Pickup - Ibanez V7
Knobs - 2 Volume/2 Tone/3-Way Switch

 

Our Expenses

You might ask us, what 6500e is about? What is included in this amount? We made the approximate list of necessary expences, so that's how we are going to spend this sum:

  • instruments and vocals recording at studio - 1000e
  • album mixing and mastering - 750e
  • artworks - 750e
  • merch printing - 500e
  • music video shooting and producing - 1000e
  • touring expenses - 2000e
  • IndieGoGo fees (5% + approx 4% for transferring money = approx 9%) - 540e
  • Total - 6540e

What Happens if We Raise Less?

If we raise less than 6500EUR, the album will be made anyway and we will fulfill all our obligations to those who back us up. But of course it will take longer since we will have to do non-musical jobs to earn some of the money ourselves and borrow the rest of it. 

What Happens if We Raise More?

If we manage to raise more than 6500EUR, we will make more different merchendise and will make our tour much longer!

Other Ways You Can Help

We need all your help you can provide! If you can't contribute for some reasons, you always could share this Campaign to your friends and all the people who might be interested in our music and all the other things we do. So please, SPREAD THE WORD! We live in the century of internet and social media, and even one small repost can work wonders and make us closer to our goal. Remember, It's all about you, your belief and your wish to help!
story_txt:
Who we are

Greetings, Friend! We are female fronted (and axed!) thrash/death metal band POKERFACE from Russia. Our music is quite unusual combination of old-school thrash riffs and female scream-growling vocals. Since the moment of formation in 2013 we released two albums - EP 'Terror Is The Law' and LP 'Divide And Rule', and performed many notable shows with such bands like Sodom, Kreator, Megadeth, Sepultura, Overkill, Children of Bodom, Vader, Death DTA, not only in Russia, but in Europe as well.

What We Need & What You Get
We want to record and release a full-length 10-track album "Game On" in first months of the next year. The new album is going to be a natural evolution of our previous works, but different and much more versatile at the same time. There would be still fast and agressive thrash riffs, but songs will be a bit more complex - we added melodies, groove parts, so particularry it would remind some mix of thrash, melodic death and groove metal. There will be some experimental songs also, songs you would never expect from POKERFACE. 
New album "Game On" will have strong ideological concept - we plan to work on album's artwork with the man, who did great arts for the famous (we won't be afraid to say legendary) band, but we keep his name in secret). So, as you can see, we have a really serious intentions to make this album a really strong work, which will allow us to make a huge step further on a big worldwide metal stage!
And we did some demos of new songs, so you could check them out!
So, it's a fair deal: you support us - we reward you, isn't it? Let's see what we can offer to you besides a good album, of course)

CD album signed (Terror is the law, Divide and Rule, Game On)

T-shirts with album covers or POKERFACE logo

2 Packs: CD+T-shirt+poster or 2CD+2T-shirts+poster on your choise
used drum cymbal - Paiste crashes 18" and 20"
canvas with 'Divide and Rule' album art (that original one!) as on picture at the top
our "emergency"/spare guitar (with or without band members signatures), which is being used at concerts - Gibson Les Paul white: 

Body - MahagonyNeck - Set, Mahagony, 22 FretsBridge - Tune-O-Matic Bridge Pickup - IBZUSA F1 by DiMarzioNeck Pickup - Ibanez V7Knobs - 2 Volume/2 Tone/3-Way Switch


 
Our Expenses
You might ask us, what 6500e is about? What is included in this amount? We made the approximate list of necessary expences, so that's how we are going to spend this sum:

instruments and vocals recording at studio - 1000e
album mixing and mastering - 750e
artworks - 750e
merch printing - 500e
music video shooting and producing - 1000e
touring expenses - 2000e
IndieGoGo fees (5% + approx 4% for transferring money = approx 9%) - 540e

Total - 6540e


What Happens if We Raise Less?
If we raise less than 6500EUR, the album will be made anyway and we will fulfill all our obligations to those who back us up. But of course it will take longer since we will have to do non-musical jobs to earn some of the money ourselves and borrow the rest of it. 
What Happens if We Raise More?
If we manage to raise more than 6500EUR, we will make more different merchendise and will make our tour much longer!

Other Ways You Can Help
We need all your help you can provide! If you can't contribute for some reasons, you always could share this Campaign to your friends and all the people who might be interested in our music and all the other things we do. So please, SPREAD THE WORD! We live in the century of internet and social media, and even one small repost can work wonders and make us closer to our goal. Remember, It's all about you, your belief and your wish to help!

story:
What Am I Doing?

Hello!

   My name is Caleb Henry, and I started this campaign in hopes of reaching my goal of raising enough funds to record my debut EP! This EP, entitled "Where Am I?" is a culmination of songs that I've written over the years that express my reflective thoughts on love, loss, being too comfortable at the bottom, and trying to find the light through it all. These songs are a blend of Country, Blues, and Alternative with my own little twist of American Rock and Roll.

   I started playing music when I was just a kid, but fell in love with it far before that. My only exposure to playing music in front of a crowd in my younger days, was on Sundays on the worship team at my parents church. I always loved playing on the worship team because it really drew out my creativity, which caused me to start writing my own songs. Now, at 21 years old, over 348 original songs, and many different venues and stages later, I'm finally stepping out in pursuing my solo music, as well as still continuing to play the stages of Hollywood with my Punk Rock band D.K.A.

What I Need To Raise!

  • $2500 is what I've calculated to be the total cost to record a 4 song EP. This money goes towards paying for a studio, recording engineer, rented equipment, and necessary production costs.
  • For all those who donate $10 or more, a link to download a copy of the EP will be available once it is released!
  • In the unfortunate event that not all the funds are raised, the money that has been donated will go into a secure place where I will continue to raise money and put my own money in as well.

The Impact

   For those of you that know me, you know that I've been heavily involved in music for many many years. It's rare that there is a moment where I do not have music playing either out loud, or through my headphones. I've always felt that music was the most powerful force on earth, outside of God, and that it knows no boundaries when it comes to human connection. It's my philosophy that if I die without changing anybody's life, that it was a wasted one for me. But if I can change even one person's life, and show them something more than themselves, then everything was worth it, and music is how I think I'll be able to do that. This is why this campaign, and what I've already done and am continuing to do with D.K.A., along with my solo music, is so important. I can't get enough of music, and I want to give what I get to everyone in hopes doing what I can to make this world a better place.

Other Ways You Can Help

   It's no surprise that finances are tight for everyone right now, especially during the Holidays. So it is very understandable that not everyone will be able to give financially. But even your prayers and encouragement are extremely helpful and very much appreciated! You can also help spread the word about this campaign by using the sharing tools! Many artists have relied solely on word of mouth because of how powerful it can be! But regardless, I have faith in my friends, family, and fans that we will be able to get this thing done, and get original and heartfelt music to the world!

I wish a very Merry Christmas, a Happy New Year, and God's blessings for all of you!

-Caleb

We have been planning and saving for this trip for over a year, and in May of 2017 the dream will become a reality! If you are financially able to help make this trip go smoothly, we would be overjoyed and so grateful to have your assistance. We will bring home recordings and videos for you to enjoy! Thank you, from Accapellaré.

www.accapellare.com

story:
Short Summary

Denice Rippentrop has spent the last 30 years composing gospel music for choirs. Throughout her career, no one has inspired her more than Amy Carmichael. Now, to honor her, Denice has embarked on a journey to share the power of her words through music. The funding of this project will help to spread Carmichael’s powerful words and legacy worldwide.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $30,000 dollars to complete production of the album at Avatar Studios in New York City, where the Hamilton soundtrack was recorded. Along with the studio's expenses, Denise has secured the talents of Broadway vocalist Vanessa Libby and pianist Allison Beck. In the event the project is not fully funded, any donations will be set aside until enough funds are secured to move forward with the project.

By donating you will not only be commemorating Amy Carmichael’s legacy, you will also receive the following gifts:

For a donation of$50, you will receive recognition on the packaging of the final album

For $100, you will receive the above and a copy of the final album

For $ 500, you will receive the above and a copy of Amy Carmicheal’s If

For $1000, you will receive all of the above and a selection of sheet music from the compositions

*If you so choose, your donation can be made in the name or memory of a loved one – just send us an email.

The Impact

In addition to honoring Amy Carmichael, a portion of the proceeds from this album will be donated to the Dohnavur Fellowship, which continues Carmichael’s work in India and around the world.  Click here for more information about the Dohnavur Fellowship.

Risks & Challenges

The music has already been written and the studio and recording artists have been secured.  Once we have gathered enough funding, the project will enter production.  Everyone involved has participated professionally in similar projects in the past, so this project can move forward with little risk.  In the event that not enough funds are raised by the deadline, all money collected will be held until enough has been secured to proceed with the recording.  No donation incentives will be altered, no matter how much time may pass.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who wishes to contribute is able.  If you wish to contribute, spread the word about our project!  If you know someone who will be interested in the album when it’s finished whether they can make a contribution or not, tell them!

If you have any questions, concerns, or would like to contribute in another way, feel free to contact us at IfWordsCouldSing@gmail.com.

Additional donations can be made directly to this address:
Beautiful Star Publishing, Inc.
8270 North Hayden Road #2047
Scottsdale, AZ 85258

If you’re mailing a check, please make it out to Herberger Arts and Design Entrepreneurship Students (the Arizona State University student group that is running this fundraising campaign!).

story:
How did I get here?

  • Who would have thought that a little Black girl (oldest of 3, from a teenage mom) from the Westside of Chicago, would graduate college, work and teach dance in Europe?  That is the POWER of ONE and the impact of the arts.  Throughout my entire life, the Power of One was in my teachers and mentors.  My village built up my self esteem and life skills by their words, leading by example and exposing me to the performing arts in my childhood. Thanks to Ms. Dalber for helping me create and submit my first book, The Princess and The Giant, for a writing contest in 3rd grade. Thanks to Ms. Clarkson for taking me to Cats & Jammin' Kids, my first dance recital in second grade.  Thanks to Ms. Manos for taking me to my first opera in 7th grade.  Through speeches, spelling bees and oratory and writing contests, I found my gift and sphere of influence primarily through poetry, stories and music.
What We Need & What You Get
  • THE BIG NUMBER; $3500= $1800 for roundtrip airfare + $1400 for lodging + $300 for supplies. I have 35 days to raise $3500.
  • W.I.I.F.M. Besides the euphoric feeling of knowing you're giving to something great, you're probably thinking, "What's in it for me?" As a supporter of this campaign you deserve perks.  Perks range from authentic gifts from Thailand to singing telegrams or event performances.  Peep the perks to the right of this page.
  • You know the saying, "shoot for the moon but it's okay if you land on the stars"? If I don't hit the goal of $3500 to pay for a month, I can alternatively do a 2 week stay.  So, your funds will be used for the intended purpose either way. But, who wants to aim small for such a huge opportunity?  The longer I stay, the greater impact for me to make.

What Impact?

  • Even with technology, nothing can ever replace the impact of human contact. My physical presence is a gateway  for youth over 8,000 miles away to connect with and glean from the expertise and experience through the lens of an African American woman. 
  • Why am I so confident about this international impact? The MouthPeace in Thailand is an extension of what I've always done: empower and edutain through the arts.  From my 1 year tenure teaching dance to teen girls in Ireland, I know firsthand that the arts are a great unifier and learning tool.  Youth everywhere have something to say.  It's important that I give them tools to strengthen their voice.  I also expect to glean from their culture, so that I can use those tools with youth here in the U.S.
  • THAT'S NOT ALL! Aside from teaching the youth, during this residency I will be completing the  draft of my one woman show, "Everybody is a Star".  I started filming the documentary over a year ago. This autobiographical piece will definitely empower and entertain people of all ages. 1 month to dedicate to this without competing with the rigors of daily life, will help me get a lot accomplished on this special project.  Some perks offer complimentary access to this show.

Risks & Challenges

  • The main challenges of making this campaign a reality are MONEY and TIME. Remember, it's 35 days to $3500. Yep, this  is a $100 a day campaign. You see, I must come up with the money within a month, as my flight, housing and teaching plan must be submitted for approval by 3/1/15. 
  • Another challenge is combating the 'starving artists' mentality.   It can be difficult to procure financial support when people don't highly value the arts as a necessity.  
  • Aside from this campaign, I've applied for a scholarship.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, you've read it all but you can't give money.  Do you have an airline discount or know someone that does? Are you a business that can sponsor or know someone that can? That's a contribution.  Never underestimate the Power of One: One dollar, one call, one share, one tweet, one referral.  So, please feel free to use my Indiegogo share tools right away. The Power of One helped me get here today.

Enough talk.  Let's ACT!

story:
Short Summary

Obscure Alternative Rock hailing from The Netherlands, inspired by Nine Inch Nails, Marilyn Manson and Placebo.

The Band was formed around leadsinger/guitarist Julien Graute. He wrote the material for the debut EP.  The recording took place in an old garage and was produced by Jaap Van Der Kleijn.

Kid Harlequin is fronted by Julien Graute (Vocals, Guitars) and completed by Arianne Van Der Steege (Guitars), Bronco Kuijt(Bass) and Sharon Harman (Drums).

Those of you who are familiar with our previous EP 'Kid Harlequin'(2014), know that we set a high standard in everything we do and it's our goal to make our first album even better, but we will need your help to do this!

We've made a list of perks starting at only € 7,-  will persuade you to join us in our campaign for the first Kid Harlequin album in 2015!


What We Need & What You Get

We want to release and promote our album. We want to:

  • Press it on 12" vinyl, with artwork by our very own Remon Berkers
  • Press it on CD Digi-pack, with artwork by our very own Remon Berkers
  • Release it in April 2015 (with  kick-ass party's in Amsterdam, Rotterdam )

With your help, we will be able to make that happen! Of course, we have some nice stuff in return.


What Do You Get?

We have the following options to choose from if you want to support our project:

  • Order our EP
  • Order our T-Shirt
  • Order our goodie bag ( T Shirt, Sticker, Poster, EP, cotton bag)
  • Pre-order our album on Vinyl
  • Pre-order our album on CD
  • Pre-order our album digital by exclusive download.
  • Nothing! That's right! If you don't want anything, you can still give us money!
All items include shipping in the Netherlands. Extra shipping costs outside the Netherlands are mentioned for each perk, where applicable.

What If I Don't Have Money?

If you don't have any money (or don't want to give us what little money you have), you can also help us:

  • Tell people about this campaign, share the link & make them buy our stuff as gifts for you
  • Like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter

Project Details

We've already finished recording our album. The proceeds of this campaign will go to making sure we are not the only ones who can enjoy it! Specifically, the money you pledge will go towards the following:

  • Pressing vinyl albums and CD's
  • Producing & printing artwork

If we raise more than our stated goal, we will use those funds to release a professional music video.

No PayPal or Credit Card?

Last but not least: don't have a PayPal account or credit card, but want to order something through this campaign? Drop us a line on Facebook or e-mail us at info@kidharlequin.com and we'll work something out!

story:
WCFH

The Women Composers Festival of Hartford has, for the last fourteen years, provided an educational and entertaining platform for the promotion of women composers. The festival's goals include fostering music by women composers through performances, outreach, and development. We seek your assistance in continuing this tradition with this year's festival, March 4-8.

With four days of concerts and presentations hosted by venues across greater Hartford, the festival is featuring a variety of works by composer-in-residence Lisa Coons, as well as works by local composers, including performances by guest artists.

Your donation allows us to continue bringing well-crafted programs and excellent guests to the Greater Hartford area to enrich the cultural life of the city, and give the compositions performances of the caliber they deserve.


Guest Artists, Services, and, inevitably, Basics

We're aiming to grow the festival this year, and that means hiring expert musicians and renting beautiful, resonant performance spaces in addition to printing programs, paying performance licenses, etc. 

We receive in-kind support as well as individual donations and grants, but enhancing the festival with amazing guest performers Iktus Percussion, the Alpaca String Quartet, and the New England Guitar Quartet means expanding our support base to pay these artists their worth in time and effort. You are that base!


Continuing the Festival Mission

Our festival has immediate impact and long-term significance.

We employ professional musicians in our area. 

We provide concerts and lectures to audiences from all over Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York.

We put a spotlight on women composers, whose work has been in shadows for centuries. 

We've been putting on this festival for fourteen years, and your donation allows the festival to keep celebrating the diversity of music by women composers, advocate for recent and historical repertoire, foster the development of new music, and support continued performance of works. With each festival, more music is presented to an ever growing audiences of enthusiasts and scholars. The festival has featured hundreds of performances in its thirteen years, including dozens of premieres, including works commissioned by us. Emerging composers whose works have been featured in the past continue to develop their careers with ongoing support and interest from festival audiences.


We'd Like to Thank You

Your support means a great deal! Any funds received go directly toward artists and service providers. Anything received above our goal will help support future planning for 2016 and beyond. No gift is too small. To thank you for your assistance, we have a number of thank-you gifts, each named after a woman who has been significant to the history of music so that you can remember that your support is significant to the future of music!

All donors will be eligible to receive Women of Note, the exclusive seasonal donor e-newsletter, and be recognized in our festival program.

Most of all, we'd love to see you at the festival!

Still on the fence about whether to support our campaign?  Check out these videos from our board members and friends:

President of the Board, Penny Brandt

story:
Emilie: A vocal performance major and aspiring Opera singer at the University of Texas at El Paso. Follow this link to see a recent performance. 

The German Experience:

I will be spending my summer abroad along with some classmates in Freiberg, Germany. Performing Opera roles in student productions, Arias and Scenes in the Bergstadtfest concert with the Middle-Saxony Orchestra and chorus in the Middle-Saxony Opera’s mainstage production Der Vogelhandler on the Kriebstein Outdoor Lake theater. As well as studying Brahms lieder and the German language. I will also be receiving credit towards my degree plan from the German language and culture courses I will be taking. 

Help me get there and YOU will be giving me the opportunity to make professional connections which can help me later on when I pursue a career in the Opera world.

YOUR IMPACT

Your donation is much appreciated and every bit helps.

Expenses:

  • Tuition
  • Housing/Food/Transportation (Both to and from Germany and any travel while there)
  • Workshops with Industry professionals: Opera directors and Conductors
If you don't donate that's all right! You can still help by Passing the link around!

story:
We are Answer the Muse, a transcendent, life-affirming musical experience.  Ours is a journey of sound, repertoire, and performance, continuously evolving over the past five years. During this journey, we have played for audiences at spiritual centers, music and art festivals, social justice events, and more, all of which represent our commitment to the transcendent and transformational possibilities of music.  So far, we have released two well-received CDs that capture the power, excitement, and possibilities in our performance and music.   Now, we extend to you an invitation to join us as we continue our evolution, spreading our message of love, possibility, and transcendence to an ever-widening audience. We are pleased to announce the arrival of our newest CD, entitled Now!.  This album represents the latest step in our musical evolution.  Now you can become a part of this journey, and help us bring this project to fruition.  This 13-track CD of all original material represents an expansion on the musical themes and ideas of our previous albums, bringing a new energy and perspective to our performance.  Our goal, to raise $3500 dollars to cover production and printing expenses for this exciting new album.  By way of thanks, we’re offering a number of exciting incentives to say thanks for your participation that will be sent to you just in time for the holidays!

Thank you from Answer the Muse!

story:
Indiegogo EQUANIMOUS - RELAXATION AND MEDITATION MUSIC Part 2

Thank you so much to all the generous supporters of my first campaign https://igg.me/at/crystalmusic  on Indiegogo . We have reached our goal of funding the purchase of the musical instruments for the sound therapy album. With the crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo.com we successfully raised nearly $2,200 to make this project a reality!

All the funds have been spent on specially crafted musical equipment which includes a set of #432hz clear crystal singing bowls, a set of #432hz frosted singing bowls, some other musical instruments and recording studio equipment.

Since the end of the first campaign, I have been traveling extensively in order to get inspiration and learn new sound therapy techniques. This included attending a sound therapy workshop by Master Santa Shakya in Kathmandu and I will put the techniques I have learned in the album.

The creative process of the album has begun I’m putting my whole heart into it and cannot wait to show you the final product.

For EQUANIMOUS Part 2, I hope to raise enough funds to use it for marketing on different platforms so that more people will get to know and experience the benefits of sound healing. Since the first campaign, I have received a lot of inquiries as many of you have missed it. This is a great opportunity for those who missed the first campaign to take part in this amazing project with some very special new perks, including handpicked gifts from Nepal!

I’m so excited to bring this project to life and I hope to release the album by the end of December. Thank you so much once again for all the support.

Background :

Hello, I’m Malbert Lee and I’m very excited to be making my first instrumental music album. It’s all about relaxation and sound vibration, helping people to be calm and equanimous via the sound of the crystal singing bowl. 

In the past few years I have been going on a journey of yoga, mindfulness, sound healing and have discovered how we are all connected in some ways as well as to the universe. I have always been passionate about music and am amazed at how powerful a medium it is in helping people to boost their emotion and energy.

The singing bowl has a long history of being used for meditation, music, relaxation and personal well-being such as yoga, music therapy and sound healing. With the use of modern technology the crystal singing bowl was created with the aim of achieving similar benefits for people. It has since defined tunes by producing pure, rich and heavenly sounds that help people to unwind and feel rejuvenated. This is the reason I am making this album. With a set of crystal singing bowls I hope to create harmonious music that will resonate with everyone.

After attending a couple of sound healing workshops and personally experiencing the benefit of crystal bowl music, I have decided to create an instrumental album through this medium. The sound is heavenly - very calming and relaxing, perfect for meditation and in the yoga class.

As most of us live such highly stressful lives, I want to help people find inner peace by balancing their energy and connect to themselves again. I hope to raise enough money so that I can get the right equipment for the production. The equipment includes a set of clear crystal singing bowls, recording studio equipment and, perhaps, adding the crystal harp if extra funding is raised.

The album will have over an hour of pure instrumental music, including a section that will help balance the seven chakra body energy points. Animal can also enjoy the music too as their ears are very sensitive to sound vibration and my cat loves it when I play crystal music. It will be released this year and will also incorporate an audio guided meditation as bonus track. I will make another album next year and it will be available for everyone who support my project here in Indiegogo for free in digital form.

With your help I am confident we can make this happen! Thank you for your support.

Malbert Lee

story:
Wow! Milan Credle Music just got a front page story in the news:

Check it out here: http://lancasteronline.com/features/together/ra...

My Story 

I’ve been waiting for my whole life to make music that can impact the world or at least some of the people in it. It’s always been a dream of mine of being on the big stage, leading people in life to their purpose, but also in arms reach for others to be apart of my journey and feel like they can achieve their dreams. Dreaming is for the brave, and I want to inspire people to BE just that. 

I’ve always had a deep connection with music since a young kid. I always felt deeper while listening to music than others around at an early age. I loved the sounds of the electric guitar and base guitar complimenting each other OR the piano and saxophone holding each other up over the live drums. I started singing and rapping at nine years old. It wasn’t too long after that where I began writing poetry and songs. 

Coming from where my family and I came from, living your dreams like that was literally just a dream. As a young black male in the DC area, there is only a few that can say that someone they know personally “made it” and still is in reach. So many people I grew up with and grew up seeing were overflowing with talent of all sorts but was never heard or seen. And because of that, there is little hope floating around. Just joy to see another day. 

Inspired by greats like Bob Marley, Bob Dylan, The Beatles, Rick James, Luther Vandross, The Isley Brothers, Tupac, Common, Biggie Smalls, Erykah Badu, Lauryn Hill, Nas, Jay-Z, Outkast, J. Cole, Kendrick Lamar, Lecrae, and DC’s own GoGo Music with Chuck Brown, Backyard Band, and TCB, I aspire to these platforms to influence and affect culture and humanity to see the world through my lens and live out what you were meant to be in life. 

You may ask me why while processing all of what I have to say. When I look into my beautiful wife eyes and think about our journey, our passions, our dreams and goals; when I look into my 3 daughters eyes and see the endless possibilities of who they will be; when I look at my team’s faces and see the confidence and motivation to take this to the next level; when I see family and friends with talent but in the same shoes I’m in with life and circumstance choking the very thing that keeps them up all night dreaming with joy; when I think about all of the people I grew up with, family or friends or even enemies that are now dead or in jail who had dreams and their life and freedom were cut short; and lastly when I reflect on the biggest influence in my life and what He did over 2000 years ago; this is why I do what I do. This is why we do what we do.

 

What Do I Need The Money For?

I understand that I may or may not hit my goal so I will be thankful for whatever support I recieve. To begin with, after much planning, prep, and recording, I can happy to say the entire album is professionally recorded. (meaning it's studio recorded and mixed)! Now it just needs to be mastered and radio-ready to be distributed by major music outlets. Please see the list below for what exactly I need to finally debut my first official album.

Marketing/Promotion ($1000)

Mixing/Mastering of the album ($1000)

Website Launch ($200)

Merchandise ($700)

Touring/Touring equipment ($600)

Visual Content ($1500)

 

Others Ways You Can Help

Book me for concerts/tours, collaborations, live interviews, press/blog write-ups

story:
The San Francisco Wind Ensemble

  • Six years ago, the San Francisco Wind Ensemble brought together over 50 of the Bay Area's most talented musicians with one goal in mind - to provide top-notch performances of new, seldom-played, and classic wind ensemble literature for San Francisco audiences. Today, after having recorded an album at Skywalker Studios and performed as a guest ensemble at both regional and international music conferences, the SFWE has established a reputation across the globe as a world-class wind ensemble unlike any other on the West Coast.
  • This campaign is absolutely crucial in continuing to fulfill our mission. The SFWE collaborates with talented conductors from across the country and the world. But these collaborations require travel expenses and additional operational costs. 
  • Your generous donation will help make our January concert with conductor/composer Johan de Meij a reality. In addition, your donation will make ongoing performances with SFWE Artistic Director and Founder Dr. Martin Seggelke, who currently resides in Florida, possible for years to come.
story_txt:
The San Francisco Wind Ensemble

Six years ago, the San Francisco Wind Ensemble brought together over 50 of the Bay Area's most talented musicians with one goal in mind - to provide top-notch performances of new, seldom-played, and classic wind ensemble literature for San Francisco audiences. Today, after having recorded an album at Skywalker Studios and performed as a guest ensemble at both regional and international music conferences, the SFWE has established a reputation across the globe as a world-class wind ensemble unlike any other on the West Coast.
This campaign is absolutely crucial in continuing to fulfill our mission. The SFWE collaborates with talented conductors from across the country and the world. But these collaborations require travel expenses and additional operational costs. 
Your generous donation will help make our January concert with conductor/composer Johan de Meij a reality. In addition, your donation will make ongoing performances with SFWE Artistic Director and Founder Dr. Martin Seggelke, who currently resides in Florida, possible for years to come.

story:
Passion and Drive!

Where would we all be if as children, our dreams had attention and support?  How many lives would be happier?  How many people wouldn't be serving time or dead and gone.  Potential is lying dormant in so many people today.  TrackHouse Productions is a team of individuals specializing in music production, songwriting, engineering, marketing, artist development, artist management, video and photography.  We have college degrees in our focused fields as well.  We all have paid dues interning with artist and at different studios.  The invested time helped us perfect our craft.  We believe in paying it forward.  TrackHouse helps and shares  our collected knowledge and experience with many.  However we would like to be able to reach more.  Our work is outgrowing our current work space. We need your help to invest in the dreams and goals of young artist.  Music is not a career to some yet music is life to those who can't go a minute without hearing lyrics or melodies in there head.  Our mission is to birth a creative place and environment for young artist.  A place where they can be inspired, encouraged, mentored, and guided to help turn their passion into a profession.  A place where they can express themselves musically instead of turning to the streets or negative influences. Musical talent doesn't guarantee fame but studies have shown that music improves motor and reasoning skills.  Music is the universal language.  We at TrackHouse would like to do our part in making sure music is positive and nurturing once it vibrates into ears.


We believe a dollar can add up!

We are asking for $1 from everyone who can invest it.  The funds will go towards purchasing the following equipment.

  • $6,500 for Office and Waiting Room Equipment & Furniture
  • $17,500 for Studio "A" Equipment and Furniture.
  • $8,000 for Studio "B"  Equipment and Furniture.
  • $5,000 for Studio "C"  Equipment and Furniture.
  • $6,000 for Production Room Equipment and Furniture.
  • $15,000 for 1 Year Lease with a building.

The First Step is.....The First Step

Fifty Thousand dollars will only be reachable if we begin NOW!  We are very motivated to reach the Goal and being able to step inside of our very own Music studio.  We are excited about the opportunity to be able to offer internships to those who are curious and or just loves music as much as we do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to invest a $1 maybe you can help by:

  • Spreading the word about our campaign.
  • Donating Equipment or a Building!

story:
Updates

10/17/15
-Day 1 video update

10/15/15

- Tightening up a couple new songs to record this Saturday and Sunday at Ohm studios. 

Let's make some music

It has been more than three years since sitting down in the living room of a small Santa Monica efficiency and recording my first album, Heavy and Dizzy. Now it is time to do it again - in Austin, TX.

If you don't know me, my name is Matt. An Illinois native who has been hopping around the country and making music in my free time. This project is small in scope but has been a long time in the making - and I'm coming to you for help. 

Here's the skinny. I am looking to produce a five song EP by the end of the year. Most of the music has been written and solidified and now it is time to get into the recording studio. Your support is what will help me get there. 

What I Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for y'all:

  • I want to get in the studio for  5 days and am looking to raise $2500 dollars minimum.
  • Backers will have access to cool perks like artwork and early releases.
  • If I don't reach the goal, that's okay! The project will just be scaled down. But, I am recording some music whether you like it or not!

Risks & Challenges

What are some of the risks? Bad music. Electrocution. Not following through.

What are some of the challenges? Writer's block. Funding. Rhyming the word orange.

But in all seriousness, of course there is risk with anything, especially creative. It's not for everyone and sometimes it just doesn't work. Take a listen to the album I made three years ago, which was produced in my living room with some friends. I promise the care, emotion, honesty and effort that went into that album will go into this one. There is a reason it has been three years since the last album. I want to make sure everything I record and put in the world represents me to the utmost.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share the campaign with your friends and see what they can do!
  • Wish me luck and pray I don't go crazy in the process.

Still not sure? Check out these links to some of my music.

https://shiftyteeth.bandcamp.com/
https://vimeo.com/shiftyteeth
https://www.youtube.com/user/ShiftyTeeth/videos
story_txt:
Updates
10/17/15
-Day 1 video update



10/15/15 - Tightening up a couple new songs to record this Saturday and Sunday at Ohm studios. 
Let's make some music It has been more than three years since sitting down in the living room of a small Santa Monica efficiency and recording my first album, Heavy and Dizzy. Now it is time to do it again - in Austin, TX.
If you don't know me, my name is Matt. An Illinois native who has been hopping around the country and making music in my free time. This project is small in scope but has been a long time in the making - and I'm coming to you for help. 
Here's the skinny. I am looking to produce a five song EP by the end of the year. Most of the music has been written and solidified and now it is time to get into the recording studio. Your support is what will help me get there.    What I Need & What You Get Let me break it down for y'all:  I want to get in the studio for  5 days and am looking to raise $2500 dollars minimum. Backers will have access to cool perks like artwork and early releases. If I don't reach the goal, that's okay! The project will just be scaled down. But, I am recording some music whether you like it or not!


    Risks & Challenges What are some of the risks? Bad music. Electrocution. Not following through.
What are some of the challenges? Writer's block. Funding. Rhyming the word orange.
But in all seriousness, of course there is risk with anything, especially creative. It's not for everyone and sometimes it just doesn't work. Take a listen to the album I made three years ago, which was produced in my living room with some friends. I promise the care, emotion, honesty and effort that went into that album will go into this one. There is a reason it has been three years since the last album. I want to make sure everything I record and put in the world represents me to the utmost.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Share the campaign with your friends and see what they can do! Wish me luck and pray I don't go crazy in the process.


Still not sure? Check out these links to some of my music.

https://shiftyteeth.bandcamp.com/


https://vimeo.com/shiftyteeth

https://www.youtube.com/user/ShiftyTeeth/videos

story:
Hollowbody Electric Band is starting a new project and we want you to be part of it!  

2015 has been a great year of creativity for the Band.  We released our “Prickly Stickers” CD (which was accepted for contention in the "Best Rock Album" category of the Grammys),

and we produced a couple of fun music videos that you can watch here.
  

Our Prickly Stickers CD had not even gotten back from being duplicated before Johannah and Peter finished writing most of the music for our next CD, “One Way Trip to Mars”—a rock opera inspired by the “Mars One” program (literally, a one way manned mission to Mars, currently scheduled for 2026). Our storyline explores the emotional and spiritual revelations of the mission’s central character as he comes to grips with the fact that he has left behind on earth everything and everyone he loves and cares about.  As you might imagine with a setting in outer space there are lots of opportunities for rich choral parts, musical innovations, and collaboration with other musicians.  Here's a small sample, "Space Journey," which Peter wrote after hearing several astronauts talk about their experiences in space. This song comes early in our storyline as the male protagonist (Captain Alex) embarks on the first phase of his one way flight to Mars.

Here's another little sample: it's just a rough demo of "Last of my Tribe," written by Johannah. At this point in the storyline the female protagonist (Cassandra) has left earth in a last ditch attempt to meet her astronaut partner (who is already on Mars) in order to start a new human colony as life on earth descends into chaos of nuclear destruction. 


We recorded “Prickly Stickers” in our own “Hollowbody Electric Studio” in Bath, but we are planning to record “One Way Trip to Mars” in a professional studio and get it professionally promoted—and that’s why we’re asking for support.  

Consider this quote from an August 2015 interview with Jud Caswell for Peter's weekly music column in the Coastal Journal, in which Jud talks about crowd sourcing as an integral part of the business model for today’s musicians: 

“Because of the way music works now, fewer and fewer people are buying CDs.  Everything you read at every level of the music industry—musicians are saying they don’t know how to make it work anymore.  As a musician you basically sell your presence at a venue, and you sell a physical copy of your CD—but there’s not much else.  Digital sales are not a big part of the business model anymore.  As a visual artist if you have someone who buys a couple of paintings, that could be a couple of thousand dollars or more; but if you’re a musician and they buy two CDs that's only $20 or $30 dollars.  Doing a crowd sourcing campaign gives fans an opportunity to be involved in your art in a way that they can’t be otherwise.”

OK!  We have a really nice set of rewards to share with you, based on your participation level (see sidebar to the right)--including a great T-Shirt for any contribution of $50 or more (see below). We hope you'll give us your support!

Peter, Johannah, Sheldon & Dave

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tania Solomon and Angel City Opera is the culmination of my entire adult life in opera.  I can't think of a better way to contribute than to create a haven for talent, an outlet for artistic vision and an inspiration for my community.  I am so excited every day as I work on this and watch it come to fruition!  With your help, my team and I will launch this company with two concert performances of Mozart's Die Entführung aus dem Serail (The Abduction from the Seraglio) .  And that's just the start- we have two more operas in the pipeline! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $3,905 Total

Our venue rental for 2 performances is $1000

 (First Christian Church of North Hollywood Social Hall in Studio City)

Accompanist cost for rehearsals and performances will be $850

Honorariums for performers will be $600

The cost to videotape is $500

(This will help us with promotions and investors in the future)

Miscellaneous materials $400

(This includes web hosting, logo creation, business licensing, refreshments and materials for a backdrop.)

Printing costs $200

(Flyers, programs, and business cards)

10% Contingency $355
(For the Unexpected!)

If our full goal isn't reached, the show must go on!  We will still pay for the venue and pay our accompanist and performers.  We will cut other costs as necessary or find other ways to fundraise, if possible.


The Impact

Angel City Opera is dedicated to bringing thoughtful opera to the greater Los Angeles metropolitan area.  Its mission is to keep opera thriving and flourishing by providing exciting live performances for the local community.  New opera audiences can constantly be fostered through exposure to anyone heretofore unfamiliar with the form so we leave no stone unturned.  We are currently working to provide school shows to underserved populations in LA and plan to have opportunities for folks to come to shows through Angel Tickets who wouldn't otherwise get a night out at the opera.  Los Angeles is also a hotbed for young, burgeoning talent in need of opportunities for experience.  Angel City Opera will be an outlet for these bright young stars as well as some who are more seasoned and have made lives here.  Audiences deserve to see all the talent our area has to offer.  Opera is bursting with relatable human emotion and conflict relevant to modern society.  Angel City Opera will never tire in its effort to find creative ways to bring opera to LA audiences.   

I had a taste of producing when I lived in South Florida.  I whipped up a concert version of La Traviata in a mere 10 weeks.  It was a huge success and garnered critical acclaim in the Sun Sentinel.  We sold-out the beautiful Josephine S. Leiser Center (owned by Florida Grand Opera) in the historic Riverwalk District of Ft. Lauderdale.  It was a simple but elegant affair in the same intimate format I am following with Angel City Opera.  It's a great place to start!  The success of my experience with La Traviata and the wonderful singers I cast bouyed my confidence for this endeavor but I am so much better equipped this time out.  With Angel City Opera, I have assembled a board of highly experienced producers to help guide me and an impressive Advisory Committee as well.  Being capable and confident goes a long way but surrounding yourself with the right people is the true key to success.  Please check out the bios of the incredible professionals who are helping me build this company at angelcityopera.com

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any start-up, there are risks. There are and have been many small opera companies that have tried and failed, so why will Angel City Opera succeed?  People.  Companies are not entities unto themselves but living, breathing collections of people.  Think of the word “corporation” it comes from the Latin meaning “form into one body”.  The people assembled to form Angel City Opera have many talents and years of experience producing and creating.  But it is more than that; they know how to access the people they need to fill in the gaps in their knowledge.  And if that isn’t enough, add discipline, drive and indefatigable energy!  That’s the kind of passion you find when you get involved with ACO.  We won’t give up on our commitment to fulfill every aspect of our mission.  I am personally working on this company every single day- that's the kind of commitment you are getting. 



Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can help just by getting the word out there.  We are a new company and any time people hear our name- Angel City Opera - that's  good thing! 
  • Direct people to our website angelcityopera.com.  If they get excited about our show, they will buy tickets and come see us.  We need to build our audience.  This campaign is just seed money.  In order to build a viable company, we need to grow and that means we need a reputation built on audiences. 
  • And of course, please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the campaign circulating.  Every donation counts.  Even if you can't contribute financially right now, you never know who among your friends will so share, share, share!

story:
Hello/Bonjour!


Hi! My name is Hugues Andries. I'm a 21 year old Canadian missionary. After my secondary education was completed, I decided to start a beekeeping business with my brother Thierry. I took several other jobs also such as working on a dairy farm for a year and a half and working on maple syrup farms. Since August of 2013, I have been working for an NGO in India, but that will end in June of this year. Please visit my website, http://missionnaireanabaptiste.org/english/ most of it is in French, but I have content in 8 languages. It is about my life in India and my belief in God. You can also order free gospel tracts on it, I transfer the orders to the Society that I work for.

Out here I work with supporting orphanages and providing basic medical assistance to the poorest villagers (those who pick the tea leaves that end up in your tea cups...). Plus we run a literature office from where local pastors can get tracts in many Indian languages. I believe reaching out to others who are in greater need than ourselves is a clear teaching of Jesus, and would like to keep on even after the end of my contract with this NGO (The Gospel Tract and Bible Society). 

For the last while, I have become interested in some of the Islands of the Pacific, namely New Caledonia (a French territory) and the Vanuatu Islands (formerly know as New Hebrides Islands, a joint colony of France and Great Britain). I have several pen pals now in those countries and am learning more and more about them, in the hope of bringing the Gospel and humanitarian help there someday.

Well, what do you know? Cyclone Pam hit both archipelagos mid-March and destroyed much of Vanuatu, the poorest and most exposed of the two archipelagos. I now feel compelled to go and help rebuild, especially in remote areas.

Here is what CNN had to say just as the storm was hitting the Vanuatu Islands. http://edition.cnn.com/2015/03/13/asia/cyclone-pam-vanuatu/ 

"The wind outside is terrifying," Michael Wolfe, World Vision's national director in Vanuatu, told that organization. "I can't imagine what it's like for families out there who weren't able to find safe shelter before the storm."
The archipelago nation northeast of Australia contains 83 small islands, many of which have little infrastructure and lack the strong housing structures that can endure a walloping storm.
Because of the tropical climate in Vanuatu, some of the housing is made of lighter building materials, including straw and corrugated metals.
Life on some of the islands has remained almost unchanged for thousands of years. "For search and rescue, for bringing food and supplies and medicine, it's extremely challenging," he said.

Estimates state that possibly 90% of the houses in Port Vila, the capital of 50,000 inhabitants, have suffered damage from this storm. There is probably a yet greater percentage of damages on many islands where there are few concrete buildings... these are the people that will receive the least international help and who will however need it most acutely. Also the people in Port Vila slums are already complaining about unfairness in international aid, and how it mostly focuses on the main towns and helping the richer people. http://www.medias24.com/filafp/afp-24152-Dans-les-bidonvilles-de-Port-Vila-les-plus-demunis-se-sentent-oublies.html 

Can we help them? Can we give of our time and money for them?

I come from a small congregation in Québec, and that is where the rest of my family lives. I am not able to raise sufficient funds for the trip only from our church, neither do I or my brother have enough revenue to do so, especially since I have not had a regular salary for 2 years.

I am thinking of going to Vanuatu in summer, once I'm back from this time in India. right now anyway, the situation is still too chaotic for me to be a real help there. It is possible that one of us will get funding for a ticket from a closer relative by then. But my brother and I cannot spare more than 3000$ for this trip, and this would barely cover more than one return ticket from Montréal to Port Vila. 

What we want to do:

Here are some things we want to bring to the Islands: 

- tents and beds for ourselves and a few spare one for people in immediate need

- food shipped in from New Caledonia or Australia

- bottled water and water filters (because of widespread dysentery) 

- medicine that does not need a doctor's prescription (such as vitamins, aspirin, re-hydration medicine) and such items as tooth paste, tooth brushes, shampoo, etc. 

- money for building materials

- used donated clothing

- educational books and free gospel literature

(damages in the rural areas)

But most of all, my brother and I want to coordinate our efforts with NGOs that will already be there (if any are) and help rebuild with the little carpenter skills that we have. We also want to help farmers rebuild and improve their farms, so that through them the whole population can have access to sufficient food instead of needing help from Australia, France and other countries. 90% of the crops have been destroyed, so food is a big issue, and that also means no income for most of the population, some struggling to even buy soap. The UN is asking for long term help, and needs $30 million for only three months of aid. Up till now it has gathered about $6.4 million. http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50455#.VRqbRfmsWSo

Why we we need you:

We think that $10,000 is about the amount we need to accomplish this dream to help in Vanuatu for 2-3 months at least. If we get around $5,000 only one of us will go, but it will still be worth it :)

SO WE REALLY NEED YOUR HELP: 1, 5, 10, 50, 100 dollar donations will all be welcome! We don't know how to thank you for your support, but hope that you will trust us with your money and pray that the Lord will bless you for this, as he blesses all those who help their fellowmen for His name's sake. International aid organisms and NGOs have said there are widespread fears of epidemics in some islands, and in some places there is already a lot of dyssentry. 

We also have little items you can get in exchange for your support. My brother and I work a lot with producing maple syrup and honey. We offer to send you some in exchange for your great help. SO BY GIVING A LITTLE MORE, YOU ARE HELPING US SUSTAIN A BUSINESS THAT WILL ALLOW US TO KEEP HELPING OUR FELLOWMEN. IF YOU LIKE THESE PRODUCTS, CONTACT US AT achandries@gmail.com TO BUY MORE OR DO IT THROUGH EBAY. However, as of now, we cannot promise such for non-Canadian addresses. We hope to find a way to thank our non-Canadian donors too. 

I know our goal of $10,000 my seem ambitious, but I really hope to get there thanks to your generosity and confidence. Should we gather less than $4,000 we will give it to an NGO called Christian Service International, and they will use it in Vanuatu rebuilding projects.

The impact your money can make:

Your money will go to people that have been left out by large scale aid programs. there are 166,000 people in need of immediate as well as long term life saving aid, in order to resume their farming, escape epidemics, make revenue, send their children to school, and have a happier life.

In India, I have gotten acquainted with the needs of poor villagers, with basic medical help, and with helping farmers, schools and orphanages. 

(suburbs of Port-Vila, picture taken by UN)

I hope and pray that you can trust me with your donations, and I will keep your email addresses if you wish, so that I can keep you updated with the work

Challenges:

The work in Vanuatu will be challenging because I have few contacts there. However, my brother and I are not afraid of the unknown, and here in India, I also had to carve myself a place in society, not knowing anyone before I got here. 

The languages should not be a problem since French and English are widely understood, but we will also try to learn some Bislama, the local language.


The geography of the country will make logistics a challenge, but a local friend will be there to help us find adequate transportation for the above mentioned goods.

Other ways of helping:

- Inform your friends about the need in Vanuatu and maybe they will be able to give to the cause

- Announce this as a prayer subject in your church

- There are share buttons on the Indiegogo page, you can use them too

Why we we need you:
We think that $10,000 is about the amount we need to accomplish this dream to help in Vanuatu for 2-3 months at least. If we get around $5,000 only one of us will go, but it will still be worth it :)
SO WE REALLY NEED YOUR HELP: 1, 5, 10, 50, 100 dollar donations will all be welcome! We don't know how to thank you for your support, but hope that you will trust us with your money and pray that the Lord will bless you for this, as he blesses all those who help their fellowmen for His name's sake. International aid organisms and NGOs have said there are widespread fears of epidemics in some islands, and in some places there is already a lot of dyssentry. 
We also have little items you can get in exchange for your support. My brother and I work a lot with producing maple syrup and honey. We offer to send you some in exchange for your great help. SO BY GIVING A LITTLE MORE, YOU ARE HELPING US SUSTAIN A BUSINESS THAT WILL ALLOW US TO KEEP HELPING OUR FELLOWMEN. IF YOU LIKE THESE PRODUCTS, CONTACT US AT achandries@gmail.com TO BUY MORE OR DO IT THROUGH EBAY. However, as of now, we cannot promise such for non-Canadian addresses. We hope to find a way to thank our non-Canadian donors too. 
I know our goal of $10,000 my seem ambitious, but I really hope to get there thanks to your generosity and confidence. Should we gather less than $4,000 we will give it to an NGO called Christian Service International, and they will use it in Vanuatu rebuilding projects.
The impact your money can make:

Your money will go to people that have been left out by large scale aid programs. there are 166,000 people in need of immediate as well as long term life saving aid, in order to resume their farming, escape epidemics, make revenue, send their children to school, and have a happier life.
In India, I have gotten acquainted with the needs of poor villagers, with basic medical help, and with helping farmers, schools and orphanages. 

(suburbs of Port-Vila, picture taken by UN)
I hope and pray that you can trust me with your donations, and I will keep your email addresses if you wish, so that I can keep you updated with the work



Challenges:
The work in Vanuatu will be challenging because I have few contacts there. However, my brother and I are not afraid of the unknown, and here in India, I also had to carve myself a place in society, not knowing anyone before I got here. 
The languages should not be a problem since French and English are widely understood, but we will also try to learn some Bislama, the local language.



The geography of the country will make logistics a challenge, but a local friend will be there to help us find adequate transportation for the above mentioned goods.



Other ways of helping:
- Inform your friends about the need in Vanuatu and maybe they will be able to give to the cause
- Announce this as a prayer subject in your church
- There are share buttons on the Indiegogo page, you can use them too

story:
Yo soy Macha

Culminada la trayectoria de éxitos de Las Hermanas Colón, Mari y Macha decidimos tomar caminos aparte: ella se retiró a criar ranas exóticas mientras yo insistí en continuar mi misión junto a nuevos compañeros musicales que han respaldado mi brillante carrera como Macha Colón.

Agradecida por el apoyo de ustedes, que durante los pasados siete años han cantado mis temas y gozado conmigo en espacios tan diversos como los barrios de Puerto Rico, las tarimas de Suecia y varios escenarios de New York City, ha llegado el momento de compartir con el mundo mi primera producción musical grabada en vivo junto a Los Okapi—y varias amistades que se jayaron con nosotros en el estudio.

“Our music can make everyone happy and heal even a broken heart.  
We believe in a world of acceptance, help us spread the love.”—Macha Colón


Los Okapi y su Tanquecito de Amor

Estamos listos para el lanzamiento de Tanquecito de Amor, nuestro primer álbum discográfico. Grabado en el estudio Music Dorks en San Juan-Puerto Rico, este proyecto es producto del esfuerzo artístico de Gisela Rosario en la voz y letras, junto al bajo de Aissa Colón, la batería de Gerardo Segarra y el cuatro puertorriqueño de Albita Montero. La producción musical estuvo a cargo de Mark Underwood.

Tanquecito de Amor es un concierto íntimo, un trabajo musical accesible a la frescura y la energía de nuestro performance grabado en vivo. Los temas son variados, juguetones y brutalmente honestos, inundados de la sensualidad vital que nos define. Una experiencia extrasensorial que te hará conectar con la magia de las canciones de Macha Colón y Los Okapi, un mundo fantástico que vive en mi cuerpo y en mi corazón.

MACHAPerks : Colección Visceral

¡El poder está en tus manos! Ayúdanos a finalizar la producción de nuestro disco. Consíguelo a través de esta campaña y contribuye escogiendo tus perks que cubrirán los costos de impresión del álbum discográfico, la realización de un vídeo musical y la producción de nuestro concierto de lanzamiento (además de repagar el préstamo para que el loan shark me deje quieta de una vez).

Además de tu disco y la descarga digital de Tanquecito de Amor, recibirás a cambio una variedad de MACHAfernalia de tu predilección impregnada toda con mi toque íntimo, piezas que, como mis canciones, ojalá te sirvan de terapia para el alma, vividas con intensidad y humor.

Jáyate conmigo, move it with me

Únete a la fuerza inclusiva de este trabajo que hemos realizado desde el gozo y el amor. Empuja este tanquecito para que todos podamos disfrutar de la aventura.

Jayémonos juntos.


Dale share y comparte en tus redes el link de MACHARAMA

http://igg.me/at/macharama

Riega las vibraciones de Macha Colón y Los Okapi. El futuro y yo te lo agradecemos.


ENGLISH

I Am Macha

After a successful journey with Las Hermanas Colón (Mari & Macha), we decided to take different paths: she retired to raise exotic frogs, while I went on a mission to keep collaborating with new musical partners who’ve supported my brilliant career as Macha Colón.

I am appreciative of you all. For the past 7 years all around the world you’ve sang along with joy from barrios in Puerto Rico, stages in Stockholm and various scenes in New York. So the time has come to share my first musical production recorded LIVE with Los Okapi and a cozy group of friends that got jayá-ted with us in the studio.

                “Our music can make everyone happy and heal even a broken heart.  
       We believe in a world of acceptance, help us spread the love.”—Macha Colón


Los Okapi And Their Little Love Tank

We are ready for the release of Tanquecito de Amor, our first ever music album. Recorded at Music Dorks studio in San Juan-Puerto Rico. This project was developed from the creative efforts of Gisela Rosario, lead singer and songwriter, together with Aissa Colón on the bass, Gerardo Segarra on the drums and Albita Montero on the Puerto Rican "cuatro". The recording was produced by Mark Underwood.

Tanquecito de Amor is an intimate concert, a musical experience that allows you into the freshness and energy that a live performance can provide. With tunes that are playful and brutally honest, infused with the vital sensuality that define us. An extrasensorial affair that will connect you with the enchanting songs of Macha Colón y Los Okapi, a fantastical world that will enter into your body and heart.  

MACHAPerks : The Visceral Collection

Power is in your hands! Help us finish the production of our Album. Get it via our campaign and contribute by selecting a perk that will support the printing of the CD Album, the making of a music video and the production of our Album Release Party. 

It will be more than just getting a CD or a digital download of Tanquecito de Amor. You will get our very own MACHAndise, impregnated by my intimate touch, hoping that these perks become like my songs, soul-nourishing and lived with intensity and a humor.

Get JAYÁ-TED With Me, Muévelo Conmigo

Join the inclusive force of this project that we’ve grown from a place of rejoice and love. Push forward this tanquecito and let’s enjoy this adventure together.

Let’s get together and feel JAYÁ-TED.  


Share everywhere the MACHARAMA link to our campaign

http://igg.me/at/macharama

Spread the vibrations of Macha Colón y Los Okapi. Me and the future thank YOU!

story:
Make Music LIVE! is a livestreaming music series that features jazz and world music outside of the mainstream Pop/Rock format. Currently there are four concerts in each series representing the following styles of music:

-Jazz
-Indian Classical
-World Groove ~Creative music from all areas of the world including North America
-Sacred Sounds ~Music that embraces the worlds wisdom and healing traditions

Make Music LIVE! provides an online venue that will feature the best of local, national and international artists. The series will consistently involve greater San Francisco and Monterey Bay Area musicians and will also include artists from around the world. With your support we have artists from Cuba, France, Brazil, India, Morocco etc. that will be part of this ongoing series. Performances will be recorded and attended locally in Monterey, Ca. at Wave Street Studios as well as streamed live for audiences in the U.S and abroad. 

  




For the kickoff of the first series we will have the first 4 concerts (a complete series) all in August. After that with enough public support the format for each series is 2 concerts per month for 2 months then a month off and then continuing with another series. There are four concerts per series and initially four series per year. With ongoing support this will be expanded to more concerts and more series per year.

Make MusicLIVE is seeking to raise $20,000 to pay for the first two series, a total of eight concerts. The costs per concert are about $4,000-5,000 depending on the size of the ensemble. The funds will go to pay the artists and the studio for live-streaming high quality video and audio of the performance. A small percentage will go for promotion and administrative costs. Following is the breakdown of how funds will be spent.

 $8,000 to pay artists for the 4 concerts (one series).
 $8,000 Studio Recording Time and Production for 4 live-streamed concerts.
 $2,000 Administrative expenses including web design and maintenance, office, promotional expenses, lodging expenses for artists etc.
 $2,000 Promotions expenses for tee shirts, advertising for live attendance etc.

All funds raised above the $20,00 will go towards the continuation of this project and future series with the initial goal being 4 series per year. 


Thank you for your support!

Steve M. Robertson

Music Producer, Musician, Founder and Director of Make Music LIVE!

story:
As an artist and a person, these last few years have been ones of deep growth and new insights. I am a mother of 2 small girls and a wonderful teenage step-son and the richness that brings into my life is so amazing. Our family is my focus and everything I do keeps them in mind. but I'm also more than just a mom (who does freelance web and graphic design), I am a singer and songwriter, and as in all things I come from the heart. 

If you don't know my work, I started out as a solo artist and was soon discovered as a featured vocalist for ambient electronic pop and thusly EDM remixes in the early millennia. I have co-written and sang with Balligomingo, Sleepthief, and Ryan Farish. I also have a beautiful American Roots duet coming out with Grant Malloy Smith later this year which I look forward to you hearing.

Since releasing my most recent (and first in many years) solo recording in 2013 titled Seven, I have been touring and writing and have a collection of new songs I'm excited to share with you. As an artist I have always found myself in a vulnerable state when hawking my wares but there has been an amazing transition in the last few years and now I just want to share with you. I want to share my heart, my mind, and my voice, all in 10 songs that really speak to the growing I have done over the last 2 years. Growth in self acceptance, love, sexuality, and spirit. I also went through a depression that I allowed myself to write from within, and I think is an important truth to share as well, especially since at the base I found of that time, I found hope.

I would be so honoured if you were able to contribute to me bringing these songs into the studio and into form for you to have and hear!

I'm aiming to raise $12,500 to get things going!

I am thrilled to say that Winston Hauschild is on board to co-produce with me! A Canadian darling with such successes as Hannah Georgas and The Wanting under his belt, he and I will be aiming to go into the studio over the month of July to create all of these songs in the best possible form that we can.  From there I will take what we have created and try and raise private funding to take the whole record to the next level. Anything above this goal will be put towards:

  • Hiring top notch session players from my amazing Grammy community
  • Recording these players with Al Schmitt (26 time Grammy winning engineer) at Capitol Studios in Los Angeles
  • Adding real strings
  • Having Andrew Scheps (Adele, RHCP, Lady Gaga, Lana Del Ray) mix the record
  • As well as manufacturing hard copies and doing a PR Campaign to get it heard!
Amazing goals to be aiming for along the way and I'm so blessed and honoured to have these incredible people open to working with me! But to start we just need the money to get Winston and I going. With a start up fund of 12.5k we will aim to make 10 amazing tracks available for you to hear from recording conception onward! If I hit a wall and no private funding comes together I will be delivering these finished and mastered versions to you in either digital or hard copy based on your contribution. However if I am able to take things all the way to the top, the dream versions will be delivered to you as well as all the behind the scene insights and exclusives only offered here via my Indiegogo campaign!

The Perks
I'm keeping things simple this time around with the possibility of some immediate return for your contribution such as downloads from my past until now. But I'm also offering up many personalized perks such as;
  • Autographed photos or CDs
  • Jody Quine T-Shirts
  • Hand written Thank you notes
  • I'll sing you a voicemail
  • Hand written Lyrics
  • House Concerts

From Your Heart

When you contribute to my campaign, you're not only helping keep music and art alive, you're helping dreams come true. Since joining the Grammy community 2 years ago I have met and made friends with so many amazing Grammy award winning musicians, that I can't help but dream even more. Yes I'd love to win a Grammy. I'd love to tour the world and sing for everybody I meet! And if we know each other personally you know I've never given up on my music. Even while raising 2 daughters and a step-son, with a husband who works crazy long hours, I am still working towards my music finding it's way into the hearts of many, to fulfilling what I feel I am meant for. I am more primed than I've ever been to make these dreams a reality, and you becoming a part of that reality would be just amazing!

The Halfway What If

Our goal is to record 10 songs for you. 

Each song will cost approximately $1000 each. Once we pass the $2500 mark (which ensures we can cover taxes, fees, setting up the ability to record, and all the little things along the way that cost money), then every time we hit a new $1000 ($3500, $4500, etc), a new song will come to fruition. I would love to be able to do all 10 but there is a risk we may only be able to do 4, or 6, or 9! Rest assured though, I will still give you my whole heart in each song and do my best to find the funding to finish the whole 10 for you to have and at the dream team level.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you're not in a position to chip in financially doesn't mean you can't help! Sharing this campaign can often go a long way too. Every bit that helps create awareness not only reaches more people to possibly contribute but more ears to sing for. 

I like to call my fans My Lights because the more you shine on me, the more I get to shine right back! So let's see how many lights we can turn on, shall we?
Please everybody SHARE SHARE SHARE!

And if there's a perk you'd be interested in having that you don't see here, drop me a line or leave a comment and I can try and add it to thelist! 

I appreciate, very much, your love and light, THANK YOU!

Let's #ShineYourLight #FromTheHeart!!

xoxo
jody

story:
The Scoop

I've got a new CD called New Paint with 11 songs recorded and I need your help to finish it up.  This is my first effort in 5 years and I've enlisted Jud Caswell to record it professionally, along with 14 fantastic musicians to help me bring the songs to life.  My best collection of tunes - and it's ready for production. 

The Project

All of my previous CDs have been recorded by me in my studio at home.  This one is different.  Recording at Frog Hollow Studios with Jud Caswell and his great gear has been a synergistic collaboration.  It raised the bar for me, and I'm delighted with the result.
Along with Jud, I brought in 14 musicians to help me out on this recording.  Excuse me, what I meant to say was 14 AMAZING MUSICIANS.  Oh sure, I still do some harmonies and play a couple instruments on some tracks, but this record is all about collaboration.  Some very fine musicians helped me out: Chris Simpson, Gary Lawless, Hal Ahlers, and Scott Woodruff - collectively "Leopard Girls" - bring a full rock band into 3 songs.  Jud joins me on several tracks with guitar, bass, and vocals. Jason Rafalak performs upright bass, along with Nancy Roderick on violin and Fred Cantu on sax for 2 of the jazz-influenced tracks.  You'll hear the trio Brio - Matt Loosigian, Deb Hensley, and Martin Swinger - harmonizing on 4 of the tracks.  Paul Benham is a masterful effects man with his e-guitar on a pair of tunes.  And the amazing mouth trumpet of Heather Hardy rocks the lead on one of the acoustic tracks.
All that adds up to a lot of studio hours!  Help!

The Deal

So now we're down to mixing, mastering, and production, and yes, it all costs more moolah.  But what a difference it makes to have a pro do these instead of me in my home studio! 
This is what it's all about, though.  I need to bring this project out of the studio and into the world, and I need your help to do it.
I'm offering some pretty cool perks for your generous contribution to the effort.  Along with the actual CD or download, you can get your hands on previous CDs/downloads (even the WHOLE COLLECTION), get your name in the liner notes, have me record a cover of a tune, or sign up for a house concert.  And if there's a perk that I'm missing, let me know and I'll add it just for you!
You can check out my previously released music on my website, welcomefarmmusic.com. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute in $$, you can still help get the word out.  The campaign needs to reach more folks than I personally know, so I'm very grateful if you share it with your friends. 
And stay in touch - I'll be announcing a CD release event or two coming up soon.  It would be great to see you in person!
