story:
About Me

I'm Grant Smith. 
For years I have been taking in pennies and stray dollar bills from my hat as I busk on the sidewalk, at festivals, and talent shows. It's finally time for me to take to the stage and perform for a solid hour in front of people I love: my fans. I hear people ask why I'm stuck in this small town of about 1,000 people. My simple answer is: Opportunity has yet to come a-knocking. Now I've decided to be proactive and get started! 

What We Need 

I'm asking for $3,000 and here's why: 
1. The venue I'm choosing is about $1,000 to rent out.
Check out the venue! The Coleman Theatre
2. To record a live album, I need great recording equipment.
3. To fill lots of seats, I'll need lots and lots of advertising, including a promotional tour around the four states. 

The Impact

This is something closer to my heart than anything else in the world (besides the American Heart Association because my actual heart is defective). As far as my literal heart goes, I don't mean the concert; making people happy is my passion. It's time I move my passion to a larger audience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute (even one dollar will help), don't sweat it! Please share and get your friends involved! Or come to the show when the time comes around.

story:
Singing in France!


Victoria, British Columbia's award-winning choir, Ensemble Laude has been invited to sing at the prestigious Choralies international festival in the south of France, in August 2016.

Here are some of the reasons why we are thrilled to go:

  • to hear the greatest in choral art
  • to perform in medieval churches and chapels
  • to learn and be immersed in culture
  • to improve our technical and performance skills
  • to be representatives for Canadian women and choral music at an elite international festival.
  • strengthen our friendships within the choir and create new international friendships.
The cost of taking around 30 choir members to France will come close to $120,000 - or about $4,000 per person.  This represents a substantial outlay from each individual. Some of our choir members are youth on limited incomes and others are single moms living on a shoestring.


We want everyone to be able to take part, regardless of income or life circumstance.

Here's how you can help:


We have set up a Tour Fund to make the trip affordable for everyone in the choir and to provide bursaries for those who cannot otherwise afford the cost of participating. We have already raised $21,700 and are continuing to build on the success of previous fundraising events.

We are looking to you, our friends and supporters of Canadian choral music, to help raise our target of $11,000 through this campaign.


*As a registered non-profit society with charitable status, the Ensemble Laude Choral Society (ELCS) can provide charitable tax receipts for donations. Please contact us at donations@ensemblelaude.org for further details about how to obtain a charitable tax receipt.



It is an honour to be invited to participate at Choralies


This  renowned international choral event takes place every three years in the ancient town of Vaison-la-Romaine. In a beautiful setting, surrounded by rocky hills and Roman ruins, five thousand singers from 20 countries gather for dozens of workshops, classes and performances in venues from small chapels to the famous Roman amphitheater.

Our program will represent Canadian music, in all its diversity.


“What did I love best at Choralies? I loved meeting other people with a common interest, other singers, other choral enthusiasts. I loved singing and watching the amazing conductors work their magic. Most of all, I loved hearing the choral concerts…some AMAZING groups. Much Ensemble Laude repertoire was found through taking notes of what they performed. I want this tour to make some dreams come true.“
- Elizabeth MacIsaac, Artistic Director

Here's what your donation gets you!


Our perks include the following, and more. They are a way for us to express our sincere thanks for your support.
  • mp3s of our music
  • 'Inspirata', our 2011 CD release
  • gifts handmade by members of the choir or their families
  • concert tickets or even a private performance
  • a golden opportunity to have a piece of music dedicated to you or a loved one


Your Support Will Make the Difference


1. Please make a donation. Your gift will go towards our Tour Fund.
2. Check out our perks, just in time for the holiday season and choose from a variety of unique options.
3. Help us spread the news! Please share our campaign with your friends!


Donate now! Share the campaign on Facebook, Email or Twitter. Tell someone about it. The bigger our social network, the more likely we will reach our goal.


Ensemble Laude

Ensemble Laude is a community of women united by a passion for choral music and the vision of our Artistic Director, Elizabeth MacIsaac. We celebrate the beauty and resilience of women’s vocal traditions through the ages and seek to share this art form through joyful, soulful, and life-enhancing  performances that gladden the heart, lift the spirit, and expand the mind.

“Have you ever imagined you could braid sunshine? Ensemble Laude’s blend of voices seems to hold that magic in their soundscape. Their contemplative music will take you on an instant holiday in your mind, leaving you relaxed and refreshed.” Arthur Claxton, audience member

For close to two decades, Ensemble Laude women’s choir has enchanted audiences on Vancouver Island with its creative blend of medieval repertoire and contemporary choral works from around the world. In 2015, the choir won second place in the CBC National Choral competition in the women’s category.


From all of us at Ensemble Laude, we offer our heartfelt appreciation for your support. We hope you will check out our website, and come and hear us sing!



www.ensemblelaude.org

story:
Introduction

The Dare to Live Tour is a performing arts and training tour geared to empowering youth that is being planned to take place in the following African cities:

  • Accra, Ghana
  • Lagos, Nigeria
  • Johannesburg, South Africa
  • Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
  • Nairobi, Kenya
  • Kampala, Uganda

The Dare to Live tour will consist of seminars that will increase self-confidence, hard work, and courage in youth; enabling their dreams to become a reality. The tour will consist of a concert made up of music and dance performances.


 Aim

The Dare to Live Tour has two aims.

  1. To build on the confidence of African youth so that they may be inspired to work hard and follow their dreams and, in turn, inspire others to do the same
  2. To initiate/provoke action among African youth in their communities through artistic creativity

Background and Proposed Work

The Dare to Live Tour team is comprised of young Africans with a passion for social innovation, economic and social development, as well as the arts. They recognize that the future of African countries is hopeful and bright and exists largely in the potential of its youth. In order for economic and social development to occur in African communities, urban or rural, individuals have to be inspired and educated. The purpose of the Dare to Live Tour is to inspire the youth as the future African engineers, designers, doctors, artists, lawyers, entrepreneurs, and more. The tour will consist of two seminars. The first seminar is entitled “Discover Your Potential” and will address how individuals can believe in themselves as they work to discover their career paths.The second seminar is entitled “Maximize Your Potential” and will address the steps that individuals have to take in order to overcome obstacles and make their dreams a reality, including the pursuit of careers that fit their passion and abilities. The Dare to Live Tour seminars will be led by inspiring individuals who have ventured out to achieve their dreams and have meaningful insight to share with African youth about the practical steps that can be taken to achieve their own goals.

The Dare to Live Tour team also plans to use performing arts as the medium recognized as most effective for capturing the attention of young people in Africa.  People are brought to action when they are made to feel, to see, and to experience. The Dare to Live Tour will be an amazing experience using music and dance performances along with training seminars to transform youth.  Its impact will be measured in the short-term by the number of youth who set goals and plans for their lives and in the long-term by the number of youth who become more active in changing their communities.  A group of 13 performers made up of musicians and dancers will travel to each country for a show production. The show will be a musical version of theatre for development – which is a live performance as a human development tool.

Depending on the level of proceeds from the tour, grants will be given to at least six young Africans (at least one in each of the six countries) between the ages of 18 and 29 years old who are involved in creative entrepreneurial projects that bring positive change in their community and that require funding. A documentary about the tour will be taped during the course of the tour and will air after its conclusion.

We invite you to join us on our tour journey!

story:
Greetings! 

I’ve spent the last 20 years playing guitar and singing all over the San Francisco bay area.  I have played in neighborhood taverns, hipster cafes, jazz lounges, blues clubs and even the venerable Fillmore’s “Poster Room”. 

 Late in 2011 a dear friend put a beat up old Gibson flattop guitar in my hands and my journey began anew. As I strummed that guitar, I heard Robert Johnson, Blind Willie Johnson and Mississippi John Hurt lurking in there and calling out to me.

So, I went into the woodshed and began learning all the old Delta blues songs that beckoned me forward. Three years later, in December 2014, after a couple hundred gigs I went into the studio and recorded my first solo album – GHOSTS, a collection of original compositions and 1920's acoustic blues.  

GHOSTS was very successful, spending five months in the Top 5 of the Acoustic Blues, Roots Music Report Independent Radio charts and garnering rave reviews from domestic and foreign press.  

For example here’s one from The Smokey Mountain Blues Society - "If you are a finger picker, or lover of that music, this is a great new CD to add to your collection. His fresh ideas, and takes on the old classics ring with a love of yesteryear, and a love of keeping it alive today."

While over in Spain the folks at La Hora Del Blues said - "Bill does a true sorcery in every song where he evokes all Delta ghosts."

Since releasing GHOSTS, I’ve continued to write original music inspired by folks like Woody Guthrie, Tom Waits and Blind Willie Johnson.  I’ve also added some new collaborators expanding my ensemble to include acoustic bass and clarinet, forming “Bill Philippe’s Delta Trio”. 

I’m now ready to get back in the studio and record a new album of original tunes so that’s where our project comes in.

The Project

The new album will feature a batch of songs that I believe are the best I’ve written in over 30 years of songwriting. These songs continue to explore the themes featured on GHOSTS, these are songs about love, loss and our journey through life’s “Parade”.  Parade is a theme that is central to this group of songs – the Parade of experiences that make up our life – the joyous, raucous, mournful and heartbreaking, all roll by and carry us along.  So it’s only fitting that this new album will be called “Parade”

I need your support to cover the costs of RECORDING, PRODUCTION and PROMOTION.  With your support I can pay for studio time, recording engineers, CD mastering, manufacturing of CD’s and radio and press promotion campaigns. By supporting my Indiegogo campaign you play a vital role in bringing this project to life! 

There are lots of fun rewards you can earn for supporting my album project, from copies of the CD to your own House Concert.

Thank you for your support - Let’s get into trouble!

Bill

story:
Short Summary

  • TipCow was founded by two residents of Austin, TX that have a similar love for seeing live local music.  Chris Bush (Founder and CEO) has been engineering software for 17 years, and Rene De La Mora (Founder and COO) has been involved in the music industry as a musician and promoter for 21 years.  Both found common ground one night at a show in which we wanted to both tip the same band, but did not have cash to do so.  

  • TipCow is a mobile application that offers a way for bands to receive tips, promote to their audience, and connect with venues.  We created this application with the sole purpose of helping live artists continue to thrive.  We want to provide artists with an additional revenue stream for their performances, as well rewarding fans for supporting their local artists.  It is important to keep our cities supporting the local arts, and maintain a strong live music foundation.  The only way we can help achieve this is to evolve with the changing trends, and emerging technology.

  • Our contributors can be a part of something amazing, and first of its kind. Contributions are very much needed to help us continue to grow, and help us keep live music going strong.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To continue operating, we need $15,000 in contributions. This helps with:

    • Hosting Costs

    • Marketing Materials

    • Feature Enhancements

    • Ongoing Development

    • Technical Support

    • Customer Service

The Impact

  • TipCow is more than just rewarding a live performance.  It is now a way for artists to keep in touch with their fans, reach new fans in new cities, and give something back to those supporting them.  This kind of reach cannot be achieved with a bucket or a jar.

  • Our successful history with previous projects have led us to this similar venture.  Rene was responsible for launching successful live music showcases three nights a week at a bar not known for live music.  Since the first show, foot traffic has increased, and profits increased by 20% yoy on the weekdays, and 30% yoy on weekends.  Chris has been integral in developing software for three different Fortune 500 companies, and leading a team of engineers in the process.  

Risks & Challenges

  • Starting a financial/payment processing company has many barriers to entry, especially when it involves legal compliance. Technical security expertise is paramount to guaranteeing both fan and band financial data is secure as we launch this application.

  • We have a legal representative experienced in assisting tech startup companies meet statutory compliance, and is also part of the local music circuit. We also have security experts reviewing the application as we go to make sure your data always stays secure.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can’t contribute here, just go to a local show to support your local music scene. Even if it’s just one more person in the audience, it can make all the difference in the world.

  • Tip the bands, connect with fans!

Customer Service
    The Impact 

TipCow is more than just rewarding a live performance.  It is now a way for artists to keep in touch with their fans, reach new fans in new cities, and give something back to those supporting them.  This kind of reach cannot be achieved with a bucket or a jar.
Our successful history with previous projects have led us to this similar venture.  Rene was responsible for launching successful live music showcases three nights a week at a bar not known for live music.  Since the first show, foot traffic has increased, and profits increased by 20% yoy on the weekdays, and 30% yoy on weekends.  Chris has been integral in developing software for three different Fortune 500 companies, and leading a team of engineers in the process.      Risks & Challenges  

Starting a financial/payment processing company has many barriers to entry, especially when it involves legal compliance. Technical security expertise is paramount to guaranteeing both fan and band financial data is secure as we launch this application.
We have a legal representative experienced in assisting tech startup companies meet statutory compliance, and is also part of the local music circuit. We also have security experts reviewing the application as we go to make sure your data always stays secure.    Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can’t contribute here, just go to a local show to support your local music scene. Even if it’s just one more person in the audience, it can make all the difference in the world.
Tip the bands, connect with fans!

story:
Kurz gesagt

Wir sammeln Geld um dann Essen zu kaufen, das wir an die Flüchtlinge in Traiskirchen verteilen.


Worum geht es?

Österreich ist ein reiches Land. Es geht uns so gut, dass wir gar nicht mehr wahrnehmen, wie gut es uns geht. Sind es einmal 30 Minuten länger zum Mittagessen als sonst sagen wir schon "ich verhungere!". In Traiskirchen sitzen Menschen, die täglich im Freien schlafen, auch bei 35 Grad und mehr keine Zuflucht im Kühlen finden, und wirklich hungern. Menschen, die von der Republik Österreich, von den Ländern und Gemeinden versorgt werden sollten. Die vermeintlichen Versorger streiten sich aber lieber um Kompetenzen, es wird Wahlkampf betrieben auf dem Rücken dieser Menschen.

Täglich kommen mehr und mehr hilfesuchende, schutzbedürftige Menschen nach Österreich. Die meisten von Ihnen haben einen langen Weg und viele Strapazen hinter sich. Sie fliehen vor Krieg, Tod, Hunger und Elend. Sie kommen nach Österreich in der Hoffnung auf ein besseres Leben. Überhaupt Leben. Wir reden viel über diese Menschen, aber nur wenig mit ihnen. Diese Menschen beherrschen seit Wochen die Medien, das Land ist gespalten. Manchmal scheint es so, als wäre die überwältigende Mehrheit der Österreicher "asylkritisch", der neue Euphemismus für fremdenfeindlich. Sie schimpfen über diese Menschen, nennen sie Wirtschaftsflüchtlinge, denken, dass sie uns etwas wegnehmen wollen. Und dann sind da die vielen persönlichen Geschichten von Menschen, die sich selbst vor Ort ein Bild gemacht haben von den Zuständen in diversen Zentren. Diese Leute berichten von chaotischen Zuständen, von fehlenden Ressourcen und überforderten Mitarbeiter/innen. Viele dieser Menschen haben auf eigene Faust Spenden gesammelt, sind einfach hingefahren um zu Helfen.


Warum hier spenden?

Viele Leute würden gerne helfen, wissen aber nicht, wie. Viele haben die Ressourcen nicht, haben kein Auto oder nicht die Mittel, Essen in diesen Mengen zu spenden. Andre Leute möchten gerne grundsätzlich helfen, haben aber nicht Zeit oder Lust sich persönlich zu involvieren. 

Klar, man könnte auch direkt an die Caritas spenden, oder ein Hygienepaket bei dm kaufen, das dm direkt übermittelt. Warum also hier? Die Caritas leistet viel Gutes, doch kann auf Grund ihrer Struktur nicht immer sofort da ansetzen, wo die Hilfe am ehesten gebraucht wird. Die Caritas müsste es richtig organisieren, es mit den Betreibern in Traiskirchen absprechen, das gute Verhältnis mit der Verwaltung nicht riskieren. 

Wir wollen den tollen Gedanken der direkten Aktion von hilfsbereiten  Bürgerinnen und Bürgern verbreiten, und so den asylsuchenden Menschen auch zeigen, dass es viele Menschen in diesem Land gibt, die sie willkommen heißen und ihnen helfen wollen. Wir wollen der fremdenfeindlichen Stimmunsgmache im Netz und in den Medien entgegentreten und zeigen, was Menschlichkeit und Mitgefühl im 21. Jahrhundert bedeuten. 

Aus den vielen Geschichten, die wir auf Facebook gelesen haben, hat sich die Idee entwickelt, doch alle Leute, die gerne was tun wollen, aber nicht wissen was und wie, doch zusammen zu bringen. Wir möchten Menschen die Möglichkeit geben, direkt da zu helfen, wo es am dringendsten nötig ist. 


Was machen wir mit eurem Geld?

Die hier gesammelten Spenden werden genutzt, um Essen zu kaufen und nach Traiskirchen zu bringen. Wir kümmern uns um Einkauf und Transport und posten dann Rechnungen und Fotos von der Verteilung, damit ihr seht, was mit eurem Geld geschehen ist.


Wie viel soll ich spenden?

Grundsätzlich kannst du spenden, so viel du willst. Der Gedanke hinter dieser Aktion ist, dass jede/r so viel beiträgt, wie er/sie kann. Wenn du lieber deine Zeit oder dein Auto zur Verfügung stellst, dann melde dich doch einfach auf unserer Facebook Seite "Essen für Traiskirchen".

story:
4 Sunday evening concerts at Leonard Nimoy Thalia! 17 world-class musicians! 5 stellar soloists! Multiple composers from the Jazz, Classical, Commercial, and World Music spheres.

www.nyjazzharmonic.org

Ron Wasserman, artistic director, Miho Hazama, associate director.

Featured Soloists:

Lara St. John, violin, Tango Nuevo tribute, March 27, 2016

Andrew Litton, conductor and pianist, Oscar Peterson tribute, May 15, 2016

Cristina Pato, galician bagpipe. Premiere of Ron Wasserman's evening length jazz suite, "The Four Seasons of New York Jazz." November 1, 2015

JP Jofre, bandoneon, tango nuevo evening, March, 27, 2016


Jim McNeely, piano, composer, American Premieres of his new works, Jan. 10, 2016

Randall Wolfgang.  Jan. 10, 2016.



    How your tax-deductible donations will help us.

    100% of the tax-deductible money raised in this campaign will go directly to presenting our inaugural season. 

    • Band member salary.
    • Soloist fees.
    • Venue rental costs.  We are presenting at the beautiful Leonard Nimoy Thalia at the Symphony Space in Manhattan.
    • New music commissioning.  We are commissioning a new suite in tribute to the 50th anniversary of John Coltrane's "A Love Supreme." Four composers will each write one movement.

    Composers we are commissioning for a tribute to the 50th Anniversary of Coltrane's "A Love Supreme."

    Rufus Reid

    Jeremy Howard Beck

    Bernie Hoffer



      Web site and tickets

      Please visit our web site for more details about our upcoming season.

      www.nyjazzharmonic.org

      For tickets to the concerts, go to:

      www.symphonyspace.org/events/series/189/new-york-jazzharmonic

      $25.00 per ticket or $80.00 for a four concert subscription.

      Our free concert this past summer at Washington Square Park attracted an audience of close to two-thousand. A good time was had by all.

      Artistic leadership:

      Ron Wasserman, and Charlie Parker Prize winner Miho Hazama

      Long Term Goals.

      We want to create an orchestra with staying power. We have planned a season that we think will have strong audience and critical support which are the keys to this.  Future plans include collaborations with dance companies, and a strong jazz music educational component.

      Ron Wasserman says,
      "I've been very lucky to have been the principal bassist of the New York City Ballet for 27 years.  That affiliation has been the single most important factor making my long concert career possible.  I'm happy now to be able to employ 17 deserving world-class musicians, and I hope that their affiliation with the New York Jazzharmonic will be a similarly long and rewarding one."

        Other Ways You Can Help

        • If you can't afford to donate, please help spread the word towards this campaign.
        • Let us know if you would like to help in other ways.  We are going to need many extra hands to put on what we believe will be very successful groundbreaking concerts.

story:
My name is Rosa Gonzalez, I am a song writer, originally from Laredo, TX and currently doing mission work in Philadelphia, PA.  I graduated from Moody Bible Institute with a Bachelor’s of Science in Biblical Studies.  While attending Moody, the Lord began to cultivate in my heart a love for musical worship, which brought back many memories as a little girl who loved singing and making up songs. His calling has been such a humble and joyful gift.  My heart only wants to honor and glorify Him, in this mission of furthering His kingdom.

From my journey of brokenness and redemption In Christ Jesus, He has given me ten beautiful songs to share with those hurting

and in need

of His redeeming grace.

 

In order to complete my album, Be Still, I need to raise $7,000.  I am currently working with Mango Media Productions, with an album completion date of December, 2016.  This project can only  be completed with God's grace, prayer and financial support from others in the body of Christ. I am asking you to consider supporting and joining me in this this wonderful ministry.  If you can support me by prayer, encouragement, financial gifts or just sharing the video I would be most grateful.  My heartfelt prayer is that this album, Be Still, will be His voice to bring healing to hurting hearts and further the glory of Jesus Christ.

 
Below is the estimated financial expected financial expenses.  God Bless you in Jesus Name
Thank you for your for your gift and prayers.
Financial Break Down Estimate: Album: Be Still
Studio per hour $35 (includes mastering, sound quality, bass, balancing tones etc...)  ($4000-$5000)
Salary for professional musicians @ $150 per musician, per song for 10 songs ($2,000)
 (Each song will have a different number of instruments)
Estimated time: 14 months

 Psalm 90:17: Let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us, And establish the work of our hands for us; yes, establish the work of our hands.

story:
Beltana Spellsinger’s “Summerland Fall” Summer CD project

Blessings, friends and loved ones!  I am Beltana Spellsinger, and I am on a mission.  My Quest?  To spread Love, Music and Passion, throughout this lovely Universe of ours. It needs it!

My desire is to bring you a new body of music, that has been inspired by the wonderful people in my life, along with Love, Happiness, Light, and an expression of my Spirit.

I ask the Universe for assistance in achieving this goal, which will help me to expand my horizons as a *real touring artist,* a working singer and songwriter… and will allow me to carry on this work into future projects and travels, to bring my music and magick to you and to the world.

I am a solo singer, songwriter and guitarist, who sings original songs inspired by both darkness and light, beauty of life, passion, magick, mysticism, and above all, I am, inspired by Love.

I’ve performed with other bands, such as SONA, F9, BellaWyck, Spellsinger, and a few others in the distant past.  I’m currently on a brand new path, focusing on my own creations, playing my own music, and sharing my very own raw soul through this music.  I think it’s pretty worthy, and I think that you will, too.

What I Need… & What You Get…

What I need to accomplish for this first campaign…

I’m already seeing this into creation, which is exciting for me.  It’s been a long time since I put out any new music, and this will really be the FIRST time that I have done such a solo effort.

So… what I am in need of:

FUNDS... naturally... for recording, CD production, artwork, some travel, fuel for the fire, a few minor van expenses, guitar strings, repair on my drum heads, a repair for the crack in the back of my trusty old Takamine guitar, and of course, packaging/mailing funds, to get this CD completed, and to get it (and the live music!) out to you, in fine form, by the end of this summer!  This will be a simple, brief campaign, just to get this first CD off the ground and running.

(FYI: For the next campaign, I’ll be planning on doing much more… including a video… having some *amazing* special guest musicians, and many more exciting things to come!  It’s going to be a colorful circus of mayhem and mahvelous madness… and you will want to stay tuned!)

What you get…

Music, music, MUSIC!!! And lots of it!  For this first campaign, I will only be offering minimal perks… allowed by what time I have available, such as an early release of the CD, (signed, of course) and the promise to bring you even more of this kind of music in the very near future.  I have a fairly busy tour schedule already for this summer; and I plan to spend my time balanced between touring and recording.  My hopes and dreams are to spend even more time in the studio over the next year, bringing to light even MORE completed work.  I have several CD’s worth of material, just waiting to be birthed!  This is just to get me started, and to get everything rolling.

If I don’t reach my full goal, I’ll still use what I’ve got to get the CD finished, and get the perk CD’s out to the folks who contribute at least $25!

Your Impact

The world needs more happiness. And Passion. The world needs more Music.  The world needs more people who are ready to share that freedom of spirit. The world desperately desires us to encourage, in others, and share our individuality, creativity, expression of itself, freedom of expression, and our good, spiritual selves. It desires that we gain the courage to go out and make that happen, for those who are willing to jump in and go for that. 

I will bring you at least some of that… by being able to do what it is that I do.  I am setting out to be a force of good in this world, and to simply just… go for it.  For you, for me, for my family, for us all.  Let’s come together, and love one another.  Let’s share good times, good memories, and good music.  Let’s support one another in our endeavors.  Let’s come together to make this lifetime a beautiful one.

That’s about the best I can do, and give you… with what I’ve got.

I’ve got a guitar, a van, some songs, and a beautiful little girl to care for, who means more in the world to me than anything else.  Help me show her that living your truth, and that living a lifetime of fulfilling your dreams is not only possible, but is necessary. ;-)

Other ways you can help…

Contribute, please… if you can.  Any amount will help. Amounts of $25 and $100, and up, are most helpful. If you can contribute, thank you so much.

Can’t afford to contribute?  Please just help me spread the word.  Your word of mouth is worth millions, and it is appreciated more than you can ever know!

Thank you for your time!  I am blessed to have been touched, in some way, by each and every one of you.

Blessed Be,

Beltana Spellsinger

Beltana Spellsinger Facebook Music Page: www.facebook.com/mfspellsinger

Beltana Spellsinger personal Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1073060800

Reverbnation 2015 Tour Schedule & More: www.reverbnation.com/spellsinger

Music Links: www.soundclick.com/beltanaspellsinger

Music Links: www.soundclick.com/beltanaspellsinger

story:
Summary

We Are Brown is a compilation disc of songs reflecting on police brutality and race relations written and performed by Colorado musicians.  All proceeds of this project will go directly to Denver Justice Project: a non-profit that seeks to address the issue of police violence and conducts educational forums for the community.  

  • I am Andy Palmer - whitewater raft guide turned NYC public defender turned musician.  I am a mixed-race father of two young children, who is deeply saddened and upset over the racial tensions that linger in our society -- particularly between law enforcement and minorities -- and the very real dangers they pose to members of our community.  
  • We Are Brown is so titled because our team feels the issue of police violence and lack of accountability is a problem for everyone, regardless of race, color, nationality, religion, gender or sexual orientation.  We Are Brown encourages ALL people to act in solidarity with those most impacted by the troubling and all too frequent occurrence of police misconduct.  
  • Firstly, we want to thank every one of you for taking the time and having the heart to learn more about and to contribute to this campaign.  The funds we raise will be put to good use on this critical issue.   Please see below for more information about the non-profits that will be receiving the contributions made through We Are Brown.
  • Secondly, the production team here at We Are Brown needs to thank all the conscientious and generous artist contributors to this project.  Many people extended themselves greatly, and this idea would never have materialized without the huge support we have received from the community.  
  • Contributing artists include: Theo Wilson (Lucifury), Wheel Chair Sports Camp, SF1, John Common, Mama Magnolia, Toad in the Hole, Drew Schofield, The Danny Bastos Collective, Diablo Montalban, and myself.


What We Need & What You Get


  • We Are Brown seeks to raise $10,000 to donate to the Denver Justice Project.  A small portion of the money raised will necessarily go toward production costs of the social justice themed CD of songs by Colorado artists.  Any and all funds raised over production costs or costs associated with organizing the benefit show* to follow with go directly to the organizations above.  No money will be going to the contributing musicians.  
  • Depending on your level of contribution, you will get anything from a digital download of the compilation disc to a free, personal concert in your home, and many incremental rewards in between!
  • * The benefit show will occur if logistically possible.  There are many artists and activists that would need to organize and various constraints may hinder the production of the live show.  


The Recipient Non-Profit Organization

Denver Justice Project

The Denver Justice Project's (DJP) mandate is to transform law enforcement, end mass incarceration, and seek racial justice.  DJP was started in 2015 by long-time activist, community organizer, and victim of police brutality Alex Landau.  In 2009, Alex was nearly beat to death by Denver police officers, following a traffic stop for an illegal left turn.  Alex required 45 stitches after the assault and was left with a concussion and a traumatic brain injury.  The city eventually awarded Alex a settlement of $795,000, but did not prosecute any of the officers engaged in the assault.  

Following the 2009 beating by Denver police
Alex was an organizer in the Economic and Racial Justice division of The Colorado Progressive Coalition until last year, when he launched DJP.  He frequently travels the U.S. as a passionate an persuasive speaker in forums about police misconduct and social justice.  

Lecturing at the University of Denver
Alex's story hits close to home for me, as we are both minorities but were adopted by white families at young ages.  As a result, we struggle particularly acutely with the knowledge that racism continues to persist so adamantly and grotesquely within our communities.  

With his supportive and activist mother
Hear an emotional conversation between Alex and his mother on NPR's Story Corps here.
Learn more about the facts of the case by reading here.
Explore current DJP projects here.

_________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute financially but believe in what we are trying to do, tell your friends and family about us!  Use the Indiegogo share tools (above next to the 'Back It' button) to get the word out.
  • And finally, if you cannot or choose not to offer financial support, please consider staying in contact with this great non-profit.  Follow DJP on Facebook.  'Like' them!  Share its stories and developments.  Come to its events.  Stay active!  And thank you again from all of us at We Are Brown!

Additional Thanks

Steve Vidaic at Immersive Studios, Otis Taylor, Shawn King (Devotchka), Paa Kow, Colin Bricker and Xandy Whitesel at Mighty Fine Productions, Carl Sorenson, Phil Norman, Jonah Wisneski, LadySpeech, Todd Divel at Silo Sound, Dave Beegle (mastering), Hunter Roberts (artwork), Kit Chalberg Photography, and Tage Plantell at Silver Halide Pictures.

Additional Thanks

story:
Hello!

My name is Susie Cowan, and I am a local business enthusiast. I am a founding member, the executive director, and the event planner for LoA Inc., which is the non-profit that supports Legends of Arkansas. LoA Inc. has an amazing board of directors that have volunteered countless hours over the last two years to help build this dream. We do this for the love of our community.  

In May of 2013, on a road trip to Nashville the dream of Legends of Arkansas was born. The concept of using the fun of a family-friendly live music and art festival to promote our local businesses sounded too good to be true. I'm not really sure how, but just over three months later, on September 15th, we had the first all-Arkansas music and art festival, Legends of Arkansas. It was wonderful. There were 20 bands, 3 stages, 30 art and craft vendors, performing artists and workshops all over the place, and over 1000 attendees. In 2013, we had a $45,000 economic impact on our River Market District according to the Little Rock Convention and Visitor Bureau. There were more than a few challenges, but there were even more sweet moments making it all worth it. 

Before the dust had even settled, we started planning Legends of Arkansas 2014. On May 30th, 2014, we had the second Legends of Arkansas, all-Arkansas Music and Art Festival. It rained on and off all day long, and we still had over 5000 attendees. There were four stages this year, over 40 bands, over 50 art and craft vendors, and over 5000 attendees. Our economic impact in 2014 was $159,000. 

So here we are now in 2015 planning for 10,000 to 20,000 attendees, which should more than double the economic impact in the River Market District. There will be 2 stages including the History Pavilion and the First Security Amphitheater. So far this year there are over 20 local bands, a great variety of art and craft vendors, a kid's area, a top selection of local food trucks, a great variety of local breweries, live painting, live art, performing art, a hip-hop workshop, family yoga, aerial silks performances, a hula hoop play shop, the Mallory Award winner performance, the Living Legend Award presentation, fire performances, as well as non-profits out there to educate and have fun too. 

We created Legends of Arkansas for four main reasons:
1. To promote independent business in Arkansas, 
2. To help educate the people on how easy it can be to live local,
3. To showcase the talented people of Arkansas, and
4. To celebrate our friends and neighbors for living their dreams.

The mission of LoA Inc. is to improve the quality of life by strengthening the communities of Arkansas from within through Arkansas based, family-friendly, live music and art events. Our hopes are to help grow our own economy to be able to support more local sustainable jobs in the music, art, and creative industry in Arkansas.  

Legends of Arkansas is a free admission event. We pay for the rental fees of the History Pavilion and First Security Amphitheater, the production company, the advertising and printing, as well as the artists' fees with money from sponsorship donations. This crowd funding campaign will fill in the gap. All of our sponsors are locally owned and operated businesses, so their sponsorship levels are priced as such. 

This campaign is also about getting more people involved in our community festival. We want all walks of life to come out, and all kinds of Arkansas represented in music, art, and independent business. The more people of Arkansas that get involved, the more it will earn the name Legends of Arkansas. This is not about the legends of the past; this festival is about celebrating and promoting the legends of today.  

Our goal for this campaign is $5000. Our budget for this year's event is just over $19,000. Any and all funds raised will go right back into our community by way of advertising dollars; printing t-shirts, posters and banners; and artists' pay. If we exceed our goal, the absolute first thing we will do is hire a tent company to come put up and break down all those tents! That, in itself, would be a dream come true. The next goal would be to hire a security company to run all the entrances and help direct the flow of people as we grow. Our volunteers are great, and as we grow, our needs are growing. This crowd funding campaign could help us take our grassroots festival to the next level and make it fully self-sustainable annual event. 

The perks for donating to this campaign are fun, and you get something for donating as little as $5.  It starts with thank yous and stickers, and work your way up to posters and t-shirts. There is even a deluxe package that includes signed posters of your choice of a headliner with all the goodies to go along with it. All stickers, posters, and t-shirts must be picked up at the Will Call Booth at the main entrance of the amphitheater the day of the festival.

The next level is tickets to our Trolley Party, and it is a blast. The ticket will include local beer, liquor, and live music all while on the trolley; we will also stop for hors d'oeuvres along the way. It's a two hour tour around the lovely Argenta Art District and through the River Market District in a private trolley car. 

As the levels go up, there are different options for the VIP passes. All VIP passes include a special area with complimentary local beer, liquor, water, and heavy hors d'oeuvres being served at different times. Quantities are limited, but we will do our best to keep different selections coming out throughout the day. There will be shaded tents in that area, and it has a special view of the stage. From 4:00pm-8:00pm, Kent Walker is sponsoring the Cheese and Wine Tent and will provide complimentary cheese and wine samplings. The Cheese and Wine Tent tickets, VIP Passes, and Trolley Party Passes are ONLY available through this campaign and there are a limited amount. 

This is where campaign really starts to get interesting. There are five different themed VIP tents available for your own private party for you and 3 of your friends. You are welcome to invite as many friends as you want; they will just need to bring their own chairs and blankets. These packages include a decorated tent of the theme of your choice, 4 VIP passes, 4 Wine and Cheese Tent passes, 4 posters, 4 stickers, and a personal thank you on the website and social media. The bad news is you don't get to keep the tent, decorations, chairs, or tables. The good news is you can pick up your stickers, posters, and t-shirts the day of the festival when you check in and receive for your armbands. You will check in at the Will Call Tent, which will be located at the main entrance of the First Security Amphitheater. 

That leaves us with the ultimate in rock star status; VIP level and side-stage private party for you and 9 of your closest friends. There will be a roped off area on the side-stage of the First Security Amphitheater just for your party. There will a hospitality table stocked with local goodies, seating for 10, and plenty of dancing room. This package also includes access to the side-stage premium viewing area for 10 people total, 10 VIP Passes for the other hospitality area, 10 Wine and Cheese passes, 10 t-shirts, 10 posters, 10 stickers, as well as a shout out live on stage the day of the festival, on the website, and social media. All the stickers, posters, and t-shirts will be available the day of the festival when you check in for your armbands. You will check in at the Will Call Tent at the main entrance of the First Security Amphitheater. 

There are several ways you can help support Legends of Arkansas. You can choose one of the awesome perk levels above, share our campaign with your friends on social media, and also contact us if you are interested in sponsorship opportunities and/or if you would like to donate your time to volunteer the day of the festival. If you would like to donate anonymously, you can always do that on the top right corner of our website at www.LegendsofArkansas.com. Any way you choose, we appreciate your support for your local musicians, artists, and artisans. 

Please join us for an all-Arkansas kind of good time on Saturday, September 19th at the Riverfront Park and First Security Amphitheater in Little Rock, AR.

story:
My name is Jon Coley; I’m a singer/songwriter from Chester, in the North West of England. Before anything else, I would like to thank you for taking the time to look over and support my first ever crowd funding campaign. We are looking to raise £3500 in order for me to create my first ever studio EP - Raincloudman, and release a lot of other content along the way, including both a live album and live action videos.

I’ve been writing music for around 4 years now, and for me, it is both a great emotional release and verbal communicator. I draw a lot of influence from both folk artists like John Martyn and the early delta blues sound of people like Robert Johnson, and much like them, I find it a lot easier to express myself through my music than I do in conversation. Over the course of this period of time, I have concentrated on writing and performing as much as I can, and have had some amazing opportunities and experiences. I’ve self recorded and released 2 albums, and had some really positive responses – the fact that other people tell me they can relate to my music means so much to me, and has given me the drive to continue to try and find new outlets for my songs.

It is because of this that I have decided it is time to create my first studio EP. This is really exciting for me, because it is my first chance to have you to truly hear my songs the way I have always envisioned. I’ve managed to get together a fantastic team of producers and musicians, and together we are working to give my songs a new lease of life, rearranged and recorded in a way I have never done before.

This is where I need your help. In return for your financial support, we have a list of perks and exclusive content available for purchase. All funds raised will go towards the creation of the Raincloudman EP. This means studio time, the producer, the engineer, the session musicians and the mixing and mastering of the EP. 

They are as follows:

£1 gets you a digital download of one of the 2 exclusive tracks I have recorded just for this campaign and that won’t be available after it’s over.

For £3, you will receive both of the exclusive tracks, as well a signed Raincloudman A4 size poster.

£5 gets you a digital copy of the Raincloudman EP, upon its release.

To support my EP campaign, I’ve recorded a live album of songs, just me and my guitar. For £10 you’ll receive a digital download of this album, as well as the Raincloudman EP, upon its release.

£15 gets you a full digital release package, consisting on the live album, Raincloudman EP, and the 2 exclusive campaign tracks. Included with this is a signed A2 poster.

For £20, you will receive the Digital download package, and 1 of 5 exclusive hand drawn sketches. These will be mounted and of a very limited run.

£40 gets you the digital download package, as well as a framed set of the guitar strings I used to record the exclusive tracks or the live album. Only 2 of these will ever be available.

For £50, you will be able to receive the two exclusive campaign tracks as Side A + B of a very limited Vinyl Pressing. I love Vinyl records, and I’m very pleased to be able to offer my music in this format.

As a perk for my campaign, I have made a one off leather bound book of the lyrics to my songs. This is very personal to me and only one of these is available, priced at £75.

For a £100 contribution to my campaign, I’m offering the exclusive opportunity to commission me to write a song. Your ideas will be used as inspiration and it can be made with a specific person or subject in mind. This is a truly unique opportunity to provide an entirely personal gift for a friend, loved one or family member. The song will be recorded and sent to you via digital download or as a CD, at your request.

For £200, you can purchase one of my guitars. I have owned and treasured this for years, learning and writing much of what I’ve done on it. I hope it will serve you as well as it has me.

£275 gets you a commissioned song, written on the guitar described above, and the guitar itself.

For £300, you will receive a commissioned song. However, as well as the audio, you will receive a personalised video of me performing it, with specific introductions and dedications by request.

For £350, I’ll perform a private 1 hour acoustic concert at your house. Terms and conditions will apply, as travel and timescale may have to be factored in.

£500 will get you the unique experience of spending the day with me at the recording studio where I intend to create the Raincloudman EP. It’s located in the beautiful Cheshire countryside, and while there we’ll have the opportunity to talk, write and record music.

An incredibly generous donation of £1000 would allow me to write a specifically commissioned song for you, and have that song added to the Raincloudman EP. You will also receive credit as co-writer. This is a truly unique opportunity to contribute to a studio recorded and released EP, and have my entire audience listen to music you helped inspire and create. Terms and conditions will apply, as legal details will have to be worked out prior.

Finally, in return for a £2000 donation, the production company I am working with (Stage:Life LTD) will organise and film an exclusive private event for you to invite all of your friends and family, at which I will perform. Terms and conditions will apply, as location and timing will have to be co-ordinated.

To realise this project will mean the absolute world to me, and anything you can give, no matter how much, is very much appreciated. Once again, thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and for all of your generous support.

really exciting for me, because it is my first chance to have you to truly hear my
songs the way I have always envisioned. I’ve managed to get together a fantastic
team of producers and musicians, and together we are working to give my songs a
new lease of life, rearranged and recorded in a way I have never done before.

This is where I need your help. In return for your financial support, we have a list of
perks and exclusive content available for purchase. All funds raised will go towards
the creation of the Raincloudman EP. This means studio time, the producer, the engineer, the session musicians and the mixing and mastering of the EP. 
They are as follows:

£1 gets you a digital download of one of the 2 exclusive tracks I have recorded just
for this campaign and that won’t be available after it’s over.

For £3, you will receive both of the exclusive tracks, as well a signed Raincloudman
A4 size poster.

£5 gets you a digital copy of the Raincloudman EP, upon its release.

To support my EP campaign, I’ve recorded a live album of songs, just me and my
guitar. For £10 you’ll receive a digital download of this album, as well as the
Raincloudman EP, upon its release.







£15 gets you a full digital release package, consisting on the live album,
Raincloudman EP, and the 2 exclusive campaign tracks. Included with this is a
signed A2 poster.

For £20, you will receive the Digital download package, and 1 of 5 exclusive hand
drawn sketches. These will be mounted and of a very limited run.

£40 gets you the digital download package, as well as a framed set of the guitar
strings I used to record the exclusive tracks or the live album. Only 2 of these will
ever be available.

For £50, you will be able to receive the two exclusive campaign tracks as Side A + B
of a very limited Vinyl Pressing. I love Vinyl records, and I’m very pleased to be able
to offer my music in this format.

As a perk for my campaign, I have made a one off leather bound book of the lyrics to
my songs. This is very personal to me and only one of these is available, priced at
£75.

For a £100 contribution to my campaign, I’m offering the exclusive opportunity to
commission me to write a song. Your ideas will be used as inspiration and it can be
made with a specific person or subject in mind. This is a truly unique opportunity to
provide an entirely personal gift for a friend, loved one or family member. The song
will be recorded and sent to you via digital download or as a CD, at your request.

For £200, you can purchase one of my guitars. I have owned and treasured this for
years, learning and writing much of what I’ve done on it. I hope it will serve you as
well as it has me.

£275 gets you a commissioned song, written on the guitar described above, and the
guitar itself.

For £300, you will receive a commissioned song. However, as well as the audio, you
will receive a personalised video of me performing it, with specific introductions and
dedications by request.

For £350, I’ll perform a private 1 hour acoustic concert at your house. Terms and
conditions will apply, as travel and timescale may have to be factored in.

£500 will get you the unique experience of spending the day with me at the recording
studio where I intend to create the Raincloudman EP. It’s located in the beautiful
Cheshire countryside, and while there we’ll have the opportunity to talk, write and
record music.

An incredibly generous donation of £1000 would allow me to write a specifically
commissioned song for you, and have that song added to the Raincloudman EP. You
will also receive credit as co-writer. This is a truly unique opportunity to contribute to
a studio recorded and released EP, and have my entire audience listen to music you
helped inspire and create. Terms and conditions will apply, as legal details will have
to be worked out prior.







Finally, in return for a £2000 donation, the production company I am working with
(Stage:Life LTD) will organise and film an exclusive private event for you to invite all
of your friends and family, at which I will perform. Terms and conditions will apply, as
location and timing will have to be co-ordinated.

To realise this project will mean the absolute world to me, and anything you can
give, no matter how much, is very much appreciated. Once again, thank you so much
for taking the time to read this, and for all of your generous support.

story:
Programmation 2015

We are Wolves, Ponctuation, Chocolat, Saratoga, Canailles, Organ Mood, Santosh Lalonde, Dan Livingston, Désiré Renard, Mon doux Saigneur, Oktoplut, Belmondo, Avec le soleil sortant de sa bouche, Automatisme, L'Algorythme, Les Enfant du feu et plusieurs autres.

Une prog' ultime pour éblouir nos oreilles qui raffole de musique underground et de stimulations anatomiques. Que les déhanchements commencent!


Présentation

Saint-Hyacinthe, ce n'est pas que des champs à perte de vue, c'est aussi un sacré terreau fertile à l'art et à la musique. Ce que le Festival Agrirock tente de mettre de l'avant, c'est justement cette propension à la créativité propre à cette région.

Du 24 au 27 septembre prochain, musiciens et artistes multidisciplinaires prendront d'assaut le centre-ville de Saint-Hyacinthe pour le plus grand plaisir de ses passants et de ses festivaliers. Durant ces 3 jours, c'est plus de 20 groupes musicaux qui fouleront les planches d'une dizaine de lieux au centre-ville, sans compter les nombreuses activités gratuites qui s'y dérouleront.

Unique en son genre dans la région, Le Festival Agrirock est un incontournable pour quiconque aime l'art et la découverte. Issu de la collaboration entre divers acteurs régionaux, cet événement ne pourrait voir le jour sans la complicité des artistes, artisans, du public et des commerçant.e.s. 

De plus, entièrement financé de façon indépendante, Le Festival Agrirock compte sur une solide équipe de bénévoles passionné.e.s et compétent.e.s. Nous travaillons durant toute l'année sur ce projet d'envergure afin de présenter à nos spectateurs un événement de qualité.

Il est à noter que l'entièreté des profits du Festival servent à rémunérer les artistes qui en font partie.

Pourquoi nous aider?

Nous avons besoin d'aide financière parce que :
  • Nous travaillons de façon bénévole et indépendante. 
  • Tous les profits générés par le Festival vont directement aux artistes invité.e.s.
  • Nous tenons à coeur la diffusion de la culture dans la région de Saint-Hyacinthe.
  • Nous tentons d'augmenter le nombres d'activités proposées pour cet 3e édition.

Pour y arriver, nous avons besoin de votre soutien financier afin de :

  • Assurer une rémunération adéquate aux groupes / artistes invité.e.s.
  • Mettre en place une campagne de visibilité à grand déploiement pour rejoindre un maximum de spectateurs potentiels.
  • Attirer des artistes d'envergure internationale. 
  • Augmenter les activités extérieures gratuites (spectacles instores, foodtruck, librairie roulante, etc.).
  • Assurer la tenue d'une 4e édition en 2016.
Toute contribution servira ces buts et permettra la mise en place de ces objectifs à divers degrés dépendamment de l'atteinte ou non de l'objectif visé.
Si vous ne pouvez contribuer financièrement, sachez que nous sommes à la recherche de bénévoles lors de la tenue de l'événement et que vous pouvez vous inscrire ici : http://festivalagrirock.com/accueil#benevoles
De plus, tout partage et diffusion de notre mission est appréciée.

story:
Short Summary

Launched in May 2012, PPRN Radio has been a major force in bringing the best of new independent music and the brightest under-the-radar comedians, filmmakers, actors, writers and assorted iconoclasts to a global audience. Created and hosted by Peter Pinho, PPRN Radio is broadcast twice a week over seven Internet channels with live, unscripted and uncensored programs that mixes politically incorrect humor and provocative conversation with live music performances. The result is invigorating, sometimes outrageous and always entertaining.

What We Need & What You Get

After three years on the air, PPRN Radio needs to upgrade its operations to a new level. For the first time ever, PPRN Radio is asking its listeners to help alleviate some of the costs that go into producing a twice-a-week live four-hour show. 

As a result of this fundraising effort, PPRN Radio will be able to purchase new microphones, a new sound board and other audio technology. PPRN Radio is also planning to upgrade its online presence with a new website, and it is exploring the possibility of adding a video component to its broadcasts.

As a special thank you, PPRN Radio is offering a series of gifts to listeners that are able to help us in this fundraising effort.


The Impact

Have you ever turned on the radio and then turned it off because you tired of hearing the same music for the 50 millionth time, or because you were bored by the monotonous conversation on so-called talk radio, or because the comedy by the allegedly funny DJs was dull? PPRN Radio strives to bring new energy, new talent and original humor to its audiences.  And many of the performers that are guests on PPRN Radio are making their first-ever broadcast appearances - we've lost track of the number of new singers, comics and filmmakers that we've introduced to radio listeners.

Our mission is to bring a new era in online entertainment to people seeking something fresh, bold and different. 


Risks & Challenges

We realize that money is tight and many people have other priorities that require their financial attention.  But we hope that you can find a way to offer a donation that will help keep PPRN Radio online for years to come.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please share our link - PPRNLiveRadio.com - with your friends and please help spread the word about this campaign.  Truly, every little bit of kindness helps us to achieve our goals.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hey! My name is Miron Dumitrel and I'm from Romania. I produce electronic music under my alias Skyloud.

I've been making music for 1 year and I love what I do.
In all this time of work and struggling, I've released tracks which got very liked and a lot of people loved them!

Recently I've made 2,400 followers on my Soundcloud account and that is a huge accomplishment for me!

I have tracks which even made +100k views on YouTube and I'm really glad that people love what I do :).

What We Need & What You Get

Lately, my computer couldn't handle all the sounds and process of tracks I've been working. I would have to export the song every 5 minutes to hear my progress because I couldn't handle the lag of it.

My computer at this moment:

 -2 GB of RAM

 - Intel Pentium Dual Core 1,80 ghz

 - ATI Radeon x1550

From my calcules and the wishlist I did, the new computer would be just 600 EUR!

The rest of the funds I would get, will be for buying new studio equipment because all I have right now it's a 4:3 monitor, pair of old speakers and one computer..

All I need is 600 EUR to get that new PC I wish to have and continue make music for my fans :)

    The Impact

    My personal goal is to make people happy with my songs and help them through hard times with my songs vibes!

    We all know that music help us through hard times and it's there when we need it, don't we? :)

    That's what I want to do with my project Skyloud! Entertain people!

    It seems like I successfully did it with +150.000 people. Why not continue this awesome journey?


    Other ways you can help me

    You can't help with money? There is no problem! There are always ways to help me fulfill my dream :)

    The main thing you can do is spreading the word! Tell your friends about my campaign and maybe they can help!

    Thanks!

story:
Hello! My name is Kai Hoffman. Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!


The Luckiest Girl Alive album project is all about enjoying life in the moment, and being happy in your own skin. 


My new album, Luckiest Girl Alive, is a mixture of my own original material and songs by my favourite female rhythm & blues and rockabilly artists from the 1950s - women who helped create the universal sound of rock & roll.  In my opinion, these women are unsung heroines of music history, and I would love, with your help, to bring their stories back to life!


We singers are so lucky to be able to entertain people, spreading joy.  

With your help, I would love to bring my music and the fantastic sounds of these wonderful female singers from the 1950s to the world, and spread the feeling of being The Luckiest Girl Alive!


You'll find tunes originally performed by Annisteen Allen, Lillian Briggs, Ruth Brown, Wynona Carr, Varetta Dillard, Lula Reid and Dinah Washington. The recordings of Wanda Jackson and Sister Rosetta Tharpe provided inspiration for my own songwriting too!


As a full-time professional singer, you can see and hear me performing live at my monthly club night, Live and Let Jive, held at Ronnie Scott’s Jazz Club (Europe’s oldest jazz club!) in London every first Thursday of the month. You can also find me on facebook, youtube and my website, www.kaihoffman.co.uk.  


With my brand new five-piece Kombo, made up of some of London’s finest professional rock & roll and rhythm & blues musicians, we are creating a fantastic product which is all about capturing the energy of a live performance, just like they did in the 1950s. And that costs money. Costs include the studio recording, the physical CD printing, the copyright licensing, paying the band and distribution. And you can help us make this wonderful project a reality!


If you love the sounds of Elvis, the Beatles, Bob Dylan, Dr John, and more, this album is going to be right up your street!


Help support the project and donate today - all donations accepted - and every penny counts. You can pre-order the album, choose one of the special perks like singing lessons or even book us for a live show!  


Thank you!!! CAN’T WAIT to send you YOUR copy!!!


Xxx Kai
