story:
Short Summary

Thank you all for taking time to check out my campaign.  Alot of you are probably wondering who I am, why I chose the picture that I did and more importantly, why I am looking for funding for music creation if I am already a DJ.  Those are all great questions and I plan to answer them, so lets get started.

A bit about the man that is The Fennec:

He was born April 19th, 1983 in Thunderbay, Ontario, Canada and spent most of his life roaming throughout Ontario.  Back around the end of 2011 him and his dear friend Nakomis, started a “club” in an popular social community “game” called Second Life.  It was just after the opening of this “club” called Frosty Nights Entertainment or Club FNE for short, that she persuaded Spirit to give djing a chance.  After a few sets he started to fall in love with the job and kept it up since then.  Sadly near the end of 2011 Nakomis passed on and Club FNE was passed on to Spirit.  He carried out the club as best he could but inevitably had to close down.  During this time, Spirit was in talks with his new friend, Koda, the blind tribal Otter, in regards to moving from Ontario to British Columbia back near the middle of 2012, and in no time the deal was finalized and Spirit was on his way to leaving everything he ever knew and to explore the beautiful west side of Canada.

In no time at all Spirit, became accustomed to his new surroundings filled with beautiful mountains and trees as far as the eye can see, and as breathtaking as it was, Spirit still felt restless and like he was missing something.  It seems that the call of djing was being ever so loud in his mind and he decided again to start up a “Club” in Second Life now called “The Cove”, and with the help and effort of Koda, and many others (Including a generous donation from Sarah Hibbert to get the Sim procured) the beautiful club atmosphere that is the sim affectionately known as “Eternal Spirit” was made giving birth to the relaxed feeling SL (Second Life) club that is “The Cove”.

As for Spirit?  What more is there to say?  He comes from a long line of rare but highly regarded music teachings (6th in line directly from Franz Liszt’s teachings) and has had a real passion for music for as long as he can remember.  Music is a passion and a lifestyle to him, regardless of what any other musician or musical artist says, he feels there is a place and time for every genre and style of music out there.  One thing he feels many people have forgotten is; music is a language of expression, while some may not approve of a specific language or style of speech  it is not for any one man to judge how another expresses their thoughts.  It is the right of each and every person to embrace how they best connect with that expression.

Really that’s all there is to be said, hes a man who is who he is.  He doesn’t expect everyone to embrace or love him, but he doesn’t expect someone to expect him to change to their liking either.  If you want to know more about him, feel free to contact him or hit him up.

Comments From Others

Interesting writeup. Here’s an excerpt from grandpa’s history:
“Robert Loeffler continued with his concert studies in Detroit for the following six years with John Harrison, who was the assistant to the distinguished concert pianist Micha Kothler. Since Mr. Kothler studied with Emil von Sauer, who was the last pupil of Franz Liszt, these gentlemen, were indirectly all a great influence in the training of Mr. Loeffler.”
I think you are actually 6th in line: 1) Franz Liszt to Emil von Sauer, 2) Emil von Sauer to Micha Kothler, 3) Micha Kothler to John Harrison, 4) John Harrison to Robert Loeffler, 5) Robert Loeffler to Nancy Loeffler, 6) Nancy Loeffler to YOU.

Quoting from your info:
“One thing he feels many people have forgotten is music is a language of expression, while some may not approve of a specific language or style of speach, it is not for any one man to judge how another expresses their thoughts. It is the right of each and every person to embrace how they best connect with that expression.” Regarding approving of a specific language or style of speech, perhaps the distinguishing differences refer to the complexity of the music and the ability of the artist. Electronics radically changed the scene of long accepted standards.  Keep up the good work!”

-Ken Loeffler

So that covers who I am and partly why I chose my image as I did. I prefer to perform in a more unique manner just like DeadMau5 and others before him, in the guise of a fennec fox, as they have large ears and hear everything around them, much like an average DJ should.

I am a radio DJ currently with some experimentation into music creation but I feel that I still have a long way to go.

Through your funding and support I will be able to further that with equipment and further training.  Imagine this, YOU yes YOU would be responsible for a new artist emerging into the music industry and I have not forgotten my roots thus far and would never forget the support you all would show.  This means staying in touch and remembering that I couldn't be where I am without all of you.  So for that many incentives will be setup to show you just how appreciative I am.  YOUR contributions help mold the way for music, radio broadcasting and puts you in the directors chair as I would want to consult with each and every one of you for ideas for new music and releases.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

In order for us to accomplish what I am setting out to do, I have put the goal at $2000.00.  This would cover the costs of newer equipment, laptops new sound boards, mixers and some basic learning and upgrading of my current knowledge.  The costs may be more in the end but we need to start somewhere.

Now lets cut to the chase, "What's in it for me if I contribute?" some of you may ask. That is a great question so lets examine it a bit more.

How would you like exclusive access to tracks that will never be released to the public? Consistent updates and 1st chance at grabs for tickets to any of my performance at possibly a reduced or no cost?  How would you like music tracks with shout-outs and dedication directly to you?  Or maybe you want to ask a favor like needing a love song made for your soon to be fiance?  The possibilities are endless and I plan to accommodate as much as possible to you for being one of my backers.

"$2000.00 is alot of money, what if you don't meet your goal?  Will the funding be wasted?"

Absolutely not, any and all funding will go towards this project and regardless, I plan to honor any and all funding perks regardless of the turnout.

The Impact

So, why is this campaign important?  Simply put, it allows for new music to hit and a DJ that remembers that music is about performing for the audience, NOT for himself.  This means more types of mixes and songs that are attuned to what YOU want to hear.
"Well so far I like what I hear, but what kind of a track record do you have?"  Great question!  Since 2013 I have launched and maintained The Cove Radio online radio station with alot of support from people just like you!  One of our contributors/investors, donated over $20,000 after just 2 meetings because he saw the value and importance of the work I am trying to do.  Those funds are still furthering the station and I plan to keep that work going for years to come.

Risks & Challenges

Like with anything, there are some risks and challenges as a DJ or a musician, there is no denying that.  So many new DJs and musicians come out every day it seems.  So what sets me apart from the others and what will I do to overcome them?  Simple, unlike many other DJs I have The Cove Radio as my backing, I will always have an outlet to continue my work and share it with the world, something you will always be remembered and a part of.  I had people in past try very hard to destroy the hard work I put into The Cove Radio Ltd. and yet here it still stands, government agencies looked into the operations and found everything being done by the books as I always maintain.  So if the government of Canada, can trust the work I do, then you can too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!  If you want to help but just don't have the funding then try spreading the word about this campaign.  Share it with the social media links, ask your friends to do the same, odds are from every 20 people you tell about me, one of them will be able to help support the campaign.
story_txt:
Short Summary Thank you all for taking time to check out my campaign.  Alot of you are probably wondering who I am, why I chose the picture that I did and more importantly, why I am looking for funding for music creation if I am already a DJ.  Those are all great questions and I plan to answer them, so lets get started.
A bit about the man that is The Fennec:
He was born April 19th, 1983 in Thunderbay, Ontario, Canada and spent most of his life roaming throughout Ontario.  Back around the end of 2011 him and his dear friend Nakomis, started a “club” in an popular social community “game” called Second Life.  It was just after the opening of this “club” called Frosty Nights Entertainment or Club FNE for short, that she persuaded Spirit to give djing a chance.  After a few sets he started to fall in love with the job and kept it up since then.  Sadly near the end of 2011 Nakomis passed on and Club FNE was passed on to Spirit.  He carried out the club as best he could but inevitably had to close down.  During this time, Spirit was in talks with his new friend, Koda, the blind tribal Otter, in regards to moving from Ontario to British Columbia back near the middle of 2012, and in no time the deal was finalized and Spirit was on his way to leaving everything he ever knew and to explore the beautiful west side of Canada.
In no time at all Spirit, became accustomed to his new surroundings filled with beautiful mountains and trees as far as the eye can see, and as breathtaking as it was, Spirit still felt restless and like he was missing something.  It seems that the call of djing was being ever so loud in his mind and he decided again to start up a “Club” in Second Life now called “The Cove”, and with the help and effort of Koda, and many others (Including a generous donation from Sarah Hibbert to get the Sim procured) the beautiful club atmosphere that is the sim affectionately known as “Eternal Spirit” was made giving birth to the relaxed feeling SL (Second Life) club that is “The Cove”.
As for Spirit?  What more is there to say?  He comes from a long line of rare but highly regarded music teachings (6th in line directly from Franz Liszt’s teachings) and has had a real passion for music for as long as he can remember.  Music is a passion and a lifestyle to him, regardless of what any other musician or musical artist says, he feels there is a place and time for every genre and style of music out there.  One thing he feels many people have forgotten is; music is a language of expression, while some may not approve of a specific language or style of speech  it is not for any one man to judge how another expresses their thoughts.  It is the right of each and every person to embrace how they best connect with that expression.
Really that’s all there is to be said, hes a man who is who he is.  He doesn’t expect everyone to embrace or love him, but he doesn’t expect someone to expect him to change to their liking either.  If you want to know more about him, feel free to contact him or hit him up.
Comments From Others
Interesting writeup. Here’s an excerpt from grandpa’s history:“Robert Loeffler continued with his concert studies in Detroit for the following six years with John Harrison, who was the assistant to the distinguished concert pianist Micha Kothler. Since Mr. Kothler studied with Emil von Sauer, who was the last pupil of Franz Liszt, these gentlemen, were indirectly all a great influence in the training of Mr. Loeffler.”I think you are actually 6th in line: 1) Franz Liszt to Emil von Sauer, 2) Emil von Sauer to Micha Kothler, 3) Micha Kothler to John Harrison, 4) John Harrison to Robert Loeffler, 5) Robert Loeffler to Nancy Loeffler, 6) Nancy Loeffler to YOU.
Quoting from your info:“One thing he feels many people have forgotten is music is a language of expression, while some may not approve of a specific language or style of speach, it is not for any one man to judge how another expresses their thoughts. It is the right of each and every person to embrace how they best connect with that expression.” Regarding approving of a specific language or style of speech, perhaps the distinguishing differences refer to the complexity of the music and the ability of the artist. Electronics radically changed the scene of long accepted standards.  Keep up the good work!”
-Ken LoefflerSo that covers who I am and partly why I chose my image as I did. I prefer to perform in a more unique manner just like DeadMau5 and others before him, in the guise of a fennec fox, as they have large ears and hear everything around them, much like an average DJ should.I am a radio DJ currently with some experimentation into music creation but I feel that I still have a long way to go.
Through your funding and support I will be able to further that with equipment and further training.  Imagine this, YOU yes YOU would be responsible for a new artist emerging into the music industry and I have not forgotten my roots thus far and would never forget the support you all would show.  This means staying in touch and remembering that I couldn't be where I am without all of you.  So for that many incentives will be setup to show you just how appreciative I am.  YOUR contributions help mold the way for music, radio broadcasting and puts you in the directors chair as I would want to consult with each and every one of you for ideas for new music and releases.   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:
In order for us to accomplish what I am setting out to do, I have put the goal at $2000.00.  This would cover the costs of newer equipment, laptops new sound boards, mixers and some basic learning and upgrading of my current knowledge.  The costs may be more in the end but we need to start somewhere.
Now lets cut to the chase, "What's in it for me if I contribute?" some of you may ask. That is a great question so lets examine it a bit more.
How would you like exclusive access to tracks that will never be released to the public? Consistent updates and 1st chance at grabs for tickets to any of my performance at possibly a reduced or no cost?  How would you like music tracks with shout-outs and dedication directly to you?  Or maybe you want to ask a favor like needing a love song made for your soon to be fiance?  The possibilities are endless and I plan to accommodate as much as possible to you for being one of my backers.
"$2000.00 is alot of money, what if you don't meet your goal?  Will the funding be wasted?"
Absolutely not, any and all funding will go towards this project and regardless, I plan to honor any and all funding perks regardless of the turnout.   The Impact
So, why is this campaign important?  Simply put, it allows for new music to hit and a DJ that remembers that music is about performing for the audience, NOT for himself.  This means more types of mixes and songs that are attuned to what YOU want to hear.
"Well so far I like what I hear, but what kind of a track record do you have?"  Great question!  Since 2013 I have launched and maintained The Cove Radio online radio station with alot of support from people just like you!  One of our contributors/investors, donated over $20,000 after just 2 meetings because he saw the value and importance of the work I am trying to do.  Those funds are still furthering the station and I plan to keep that work going for years to come.   Risks & Challenges Like with anything, there are some risks and challenges as a DJ or a musician, there is no denying that.  So many new DJs and musicians come out every day it seems.  So what sets me apart from the others and what will I do to overcome them?  Simple, unlike many other DJs I have The Cove Radio as my backing, I will always have an outlet to continue my work and share it with the world, something you will always be remembered and a part of.  I had people in past try very hard to destroy the hard work I put into The Cove Radio Ltd. and yet here it still stands, government agencies looked into the operations and found everything being done by the books as I always maintain.  So if the government of Canada, can trust the work I do, then you can too.   Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!  If you want to help but just don't have the funding then try spreading the word about this campaign.  Share it with the social media links, ask your friends to do the same, odds are from every 20 people you tell about me, one of them will be able to help support the campaign.

story:
Somos WYWYCGB 

- WHERE YOU WERE YOU CAN GO BACK -

(English Below)

Pasado

Nos conocimos en un concierto de Anathema en el 2009 en Barcelona y al poco tiempo ya nos encontramos haciendo música. 
Buscamos batería durante varios meses pero al ver que no había nadie con el mismo nivel de motivación decidimos tirar por la electrónica. Y así fue como con un formato de guitarra, bajo, voz y electrónica lanzamos la primera demo, The Sounds of our Suffocation, y al poco tiempo y decididos a hacer de nuestro arte nuestro futuro compusimos un CD de 10 temas llamado Crystal, que fue promocionado a través de unbia serie de Micro-Conciertos en Barcelona.

Presente

Decidimos alejarnos de la ciudad y apostar por un entorno mas natural y aquí estamos,  en una casita en el Montseny con un CD auto-editado a punto de mezclar y masterizar. Y planeando nuestro siguiente paso, que sera llevar nuestro trabajo a Berlín a principios de verano. Nuestra próxima gran aventura!

La Idea y Recompensas Exclusivas

Hemos pensado que como el CD ya está obsoleto, hacer una primera edición de  Mini-Books en calidad fotográfica donde adjuntaremos nuestro arte, letras y ademas el arte de otros artistas que estén interesados, nos gusten o estén en harmonía con lo que hacemos. Trabajar juntos para expandir el arte por donde estemos, primera parada, Berlin!

Otra idea que pensamos es hacer camisetas con un diseño de un artista que escojamos de un mini concurso dedicado a todos los mecenas interesados en participar y que quieran formar parte de nuestra imagen.

Y por último, haremos un USB para quien quiera un formato físico, en lugar del CD.

*Las recompensas que ofrecemos en general para los mecenas serán musica, las Mini-Books, camisetas y usb
*Las recompensas podrán ser recogidas en mano en Girona o Lleida y para cualquier otro destino, los gastos correrán a cargo del mecenas.
*Tened en caso de no llegar a la cantidad que necesitamos para desarrollar estas ideas no podremos recompensar a ningún mecena con ellas.

La Magnitud

Con esto nos ayudareis a poder seguir trabajando, promocionarnos y promocionar a otros artistas por todo el mundo. Y a que haya continuidad de las mini-magazines, pudiendo así sacar otras ediciones con otros artistas.

En Resumen

La Magnitud de lo que queremos conseguir es la retroalimentación de toda la energía artística en constante ebullición!

Llevamos 6 años juntos trabajando para crecer de dentro hacia fuera, para SER sin ningún tipo de compromiso u obligación, para ofrecer algo sincero. Buscamos siempre soluciones y nos encanta comernos la cabeza para crear ideas que puedan mezclarse con nuestro arte y promocionar todos los excelentes artistas que hay sueltos por ahí. 
Que sepais que cualquier fondo ira directo a nuestro proyecto artístico sea mas o menos la cantidad que nos llegue, porque nuestra decisión ya esta tomada. 

Si no puedes aportar no pasa nada, puedes ayudarnos igualmente difundiendo nuestra campaña por todos los medios que creas convenientes y utilizando las herramientas de IndieGoGo Mismo.

Si has llegado hasta aqui...Gracias!!!
WYWYCGB

www.wywycgb.com

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Past

We met each other in Anathema's concert in 2009 in Barcelona, soon we were already making music.

We lookfor a drummer, but because it was too difficult to find a person with the same motivation at the end we decided to make all bases by ourselves.

In this way we started to make electronic music, and we discover we love it!

We start with our demo Sounds Of Our Suffocation, then came our first Cd Crystal, which came along with lots of Micro-Concerts in Barcelona


Present

We decided to compose the next album changing drastically our life landscape, looking for a natural environment.

And here we are! in a small house in the middle of the Montseny, with an almost finished 2nd album and planning our big next step... move to Berlin, our next big adventure!!


The idea and unique rewards

The idea that Cd format has died is a fact, but all like to have something in physical format, for this reason we thought about Mini-Books. In this Mini-Books you will find not only our artwork, pictures and lyrics of our songs, but you will also find works from others artist we believe in our want to get more visivility and are in harmony with our work. Work together!

Their art will travel with us all over, first stop, Berlín.
Another idea to give visibility to designers, is to open a competition among the sponsors of this offer, to design our shirt.
And finally we will make usb pens, for those who don't feel confortable with the download code
 *the rewards we offer to our sponsors, it will  be in general,  download codes of our last album, Mini-Books, USB and shirts.

* The rewards can be picked by hand in Girona and Lleida and for any other destination, the costs borne by the mecenas.

* In the case we dont reach the amount we need to develop these ideas we can not reward any mecena with them.

The magnitude

With this you will help us to keep working and give  visibility to others artist all over the world.

The summary
The magnitude of what we want to achieve is the feedback from all the artistic energy constanttly boiling!

We are working for 6 years now growing up from inside to offer you something honest.

We always find solutions and we enjoy looking for new ideas to combine with our art. 

And especially for us it is a pleasure to collaborate with other artists, it's something like a synergy of  creative energy.

Let you know that any funds will go directly to our art project.

If you cannot help us monatary nothing happens, you can also help us by spreading our campaign by all ways that you think convenient and using the tools of IndieGoGo itself.

If you've got here ... Thanks !!!

WYWYCGB


www.wywycgb.com

story:
NEW UPDATE: Elijah Rock and this Indiegogo Campaign Featured on... 

      

          Click here to read Article

                                                                            

          Click here to read Article

       

         Click here to read Article                  

The Lowdown

My name is Elijah Rock and I have been singing the Great American Songbook for over 15 years. Now it's time for me to record my debut Jazz Traditional Pop album entitled, "GERSHWIN FOR THE SOUL."

Before moving to Los Angeles, I cut my teeth in New York City, starring in a Swing review called, "Things are Still What They Used to Be"  with my 7-piece Swing Band! I even got to tour with a 21-piece big band in the musical "Forever Swing."  Upon moving to Los Angeles, I formed a jazz ensemble, The Downtown Project, where we had a residency at the Edison Club in downtown Los Angeles for over a year. For the past few years, I've Headlined the KJAZZ (88.1)FM Hollywood and Highland Summer Concert Series in Los Angeles with my little big band. Recently, I packed the house with my Jazz Cabaret at the Colony Theater, in Burbank. The timing couldn't be BETTER!

In April of 2015, I played the role of 'The Crooner' in the Los Angeles Premier of the musical play, "Words by Ira Gershwin," also at the prestigious Colony Theatre. I got to sing songs like "Isn't It A Pity," "They All Laughed," "Love Walked In," "Fascinating Rhythm," and more!

I FELL IN LOVE WITH THE MUSIC OF GEORGE AND IRA GERSHWIN!

George Gershwin wrote most of his vocal and theatrical works, including more than a dozen Broadway shows and several films in collaboration with his elder brother, lyricist Ira Gershwin. George’s musical compositions have been used in numerous films and on television, and many became jazz standards recorded in numerous variations.

About the Project

I couldn't resist the idea of transforming our LIVE experience with "Words" into an ALBUM recording! I had so much fun singing these amazing songs every night for 2 months LIVE and in the THEATRE! Who get's that kind of opportunity these days? It's an opportunity of a LIFETIME to record this album. The show closed on May 24th, so it's still fresh and in our minds, bodies and SOULS!

Who Am I working with? - (PIANO, DRUMS, BASS, GUITAR)

Kevin Toney- Producer/Pianist/Arranger: (Musical Director/Pianist for "Words by Ira Gershwin") 

                

Kevin Toney is an award winning musician and was an original member of The Blackbyrds, the famous Jazz Fusion Group. He has gone on as a world class solo recording artist and composer. Toney was a conductor and arranger for many well known and respected recording and performing artists including: James Ingram, Patti Austin, Michael McDonald, Marilyn McCoo, Billy Davis, Jr., Carl Anderson, Edwin Hawkins and Isaac Hayes. He has also recorded and/or performed with Aretha Franklin, Whitney Houston, Frank Sinatra, Donald Byrd, Stevie Wonder, Seal, Annie Lennox, Shirley Caesar, Ray Charles, Ray Parker Jr., Pink, Kenny Burrell, Nancy Wilson and O.C. Smith to name a few.

Kevin and I believe that with my sound and with his fresh and exciting arrangements, we can produce and Gershwin record with a first-class quartet of PIANO, BASS, DRUM & GUITAR that will be soulfully timeless! We will record 12 SONGS! (10 incredible Gershwin Songs and 2 Originals). THIS WILL BE A FIRST-CLASS RECORDING AT AN A++ STUDIO. We have the top musicians playing on the record. 

On Drums:

 


Rayford Griffin is internationally respected as among the most inventive, volcanic and versatile drummers in music, having amassed stellar credits with virtuosos ranging from Jean-Luc Ponty and The Stanley Clarke Band, George Duke, to Dave Koz, Anita Baker and Michael Jackson. Rayford has roots that extend back to the most revolutionary era of jazz – be bop – thanks to his uncle: the great trumpeter/composer Clifford Brown.

Greg Paul is one of the most exciting upcoming drummers on the LA scene. Greg recently graduated  from the University of Southern California with a Masters in Jazz Studies and has played with The Blackbyrds, Vanessa Williams, Adina Howard, TC Carson and more.

On Bass: 

John B. Williams has performed and/or recorded with Horace Silver, Hugh Masekela, Dizzy Gillespie, Kenny Burrell, Jon Hendricks, Jimmy Smith, Sir Roland Hanna, Benny Carter, Louie Bellson, Freddie Hubbard, Count Basie, Louis Armstrong and many others. John was the house bassist for late night TV icons Johnny Carson and Arsenio Hall and was a member of the Nancy Wilson Trio for twenty-five years. 

On Guitar: 

Terry Wollman is a Billboard charting Guitarist. He has performed with an array of artists including Billy Preston, The 5th Dimension, Wilson Phillips, Al Jarreau, Joan Baez, Joe Walsh, Keb' Mo', Little Richard, Gerald Albright and Eartha Kitt. Recently he co-produced Melissa Manchester's latest album, "You Gotta Love the Life."

There will be more special guests as well! DON'T YOU LOVE A SURPRISE? 


"It is clear to me that we need more young entertainers like you who are passionate to carry on our tradition. You know how to vocally craft a lyric so each phrase carries depth and meaning. I know Ira would have been impressed had he had the opportunity to experience you LIVE on the stage in Burbank!

- Michael S. Strunsky, (Trustee, The Ira and Leonore Gershwin Trusts)                  

"The Great American Songbook is alive and well with the SUPREMELY TALENTED Elijah Rock- a triple threat entertainer, breathing new life into our rich tradition." - Bennie Maupin (Jazz Musician/Composer)

"Elijah Rock is a fine singer!"- Robert Guillaume (Actor, Singer)

"Every once in a while, an Artist like Elijah Rock emerges and reminds you what great singing and showmanship really looks like."  

-Antwone Fisher (Writer, Director, Personality)

"His is an epic voice that can splendidly carry on the legacies of Billy Eckstine, Frank Sinatra, Johnny Hartman, Harry Connick, Jr and other great Jazz crooners."  - Irma P. Hall (Actress)

"An incredibly talented singer and performer, better than almost anyone doing Standards today! " - Shadoe Stevens (Radio Host/TV Personality)

"It's clear we've found our next Superstar Entertainer in Elijah Rock!"

 -Bill Cobbs (Actor) 

"A voice filled with elegance and grace."  

- Leo Manzari (Tap Dancer, Actor of the Manzari Brothers)    

                                                     

Here's what some of the critics had to say about my performances in "Words by Ira Gershwin"

“Rock also moves easily between styles, particularly turning his arias from Porgy and Bess into passionate showstoppers that make this musical evening ring with elegant sophistication.” BroadwayWorld

“But it is Elijah Rock (Crooner) who steals the show. With a voice resonant and loud enough for opera, this recurring guest star on Showtime’s “Masters of Sex” has the stage presence and dancing ability to go as far as his talent will take him. Here, the 2014 NAACP Theatre Award Winner displays a deep and natural understanding of and flair for the material. This critic hopes to see Rock on the stages of Burbank or Los Angeles again soon.”
NoHoArtsDistrict

“Baritone Rock (NAACP Theatre Award-winner for his 2014 performance in “Breath and Imagination” at the Colony), with charm to spare, shifts smoothly from crisp jazz phrasings to the operatic “Oh Bess, Oh Where Is My Bess?” and he proves to be a notable tapper in “They All Laughed,” a sizzling rhythm match with drummer Webster. Glendale News-Press                                                     

                                       

One of the ways I will give back is by teaching Master Classes to students of the Arts and underprivileged teens about the history and importance of the Great American Songbook. I will also be teaching students how to SUCCESSFULLY crowdfund their dream! By making this campaign a success, you will be helping me give back to thousands of students and kids worldwide!

Your help is critical in manifesting this special dedication to George and Ira Gershwin's music while launching me as a Recording Artist.  I CAN'T WAIT TO SING FOR YOU AND TOUR ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND AROUND THE WORLD!!! GEORGE and IRA GERSHWIN'S music is AMERICA'S CLASSICAL music. I appreciate your financial blessings and for preserving our rich legacy, upheld by great artists like Louis Armstrong, Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Tony Bennett, Billy Eckstine, Johnny Harman, Natalie Cole, Dianna Krall, Lady Gaga and others before them. I pledge that I will represent our Great American Songbook with class, passion, heart and good old fashioned Entertainment!

THANK YOU AND WITH MUCH GRATITUDE!  WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge with this project is securing the funds, and that is where we need your help and why we launched this campaign! Everything else is lined up and ready to go. The team is waiting in the dressing room, ready to make our grand entrance as soon as we have the financing we need!  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word to your friends and family about this campaign!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • For more information about Elijah go to the Elijah Rock Website
  • Twitter, Facebook
story_txt:
NEW UPDATE: Elijah Rock and this Indiegogo Campaign Featured on...       
          Click here to read Article






                                                                            
          Click here to read Article




       
         Click here to read Article                  

The Lowdown





My
name is Elijah Rock and I have been singing the Great American Songbook for over 15 years. Now it's time for me to record
my debut Jazz Traditional Pop album entitled, "GERSHWIN FOR THE SOUL."


Before moving to Los Angeles, I cut my teeth in New York City, starring in a Swing review called, "Things are Still What They Used to Be"  with my 7-piece Swing Band! I even got to tour with a 21-piece big band in the musical "Forever Swing."  Upon moving to Los Angeles, I formed a jazz ensemble, The Downtown Project, where we had a residency at the Edison Club in downtown Los Angeles for over a year. For
the past few years, I've Headlined the
KJAZZ (88.1)FM Hollywood and Highland Summer Concert Series in Los
Angeles with my little big band. Recently, I packed the
house with my Jazz Cabaret at the Colony Theater, in Burbank. The
timing couldn't be BETTER!


In
April of 2015, I played the role of 'The Crooner' in the Los Angeles
Premier of the musical play, "Words by Ira
Gershwin," also at the prestigious Colony Theatre. I
got to sing songs like "Isn't It A Pity," "They All
Laughed," "Love Walked In," "Fascinating Rhythm,"
and more!

I
FELL IN LOVE WITH THE MUSIC OF GEORGE AND IRA GERSHWIN!












George
Gershwin wrote most of his vocal and theatrical works, including more
than a dozen Broadway shows and several films in collaboration with
his elder brother, lyricist Ira Gershwin. George’s musical
compositions have been used in numerous films and on television, and
many became jazz standards recorded in numerous variations.





About
the Project


I couldn't resist the idea of transforming our LIVE experience with "Words" into
an ALBUM recording! I had so much fun singing these amazing songs
every night for 2 months LIVE and in the THEATRE! Who get's that
kind of opportunity these days? It's an opportunity of a LIFETIME to
record this album. The show closed on May 24th, so it's still fresh and
in our minds, bodies and SOULS!



Who Am I working with? - (PIANO, DRUMS, BASS, GUITAR)



Kevin
Toney- Producer/Pianist/Arranger: (Musical Director/Pianist for "Words by Ira Gershwin") 

                

Kevin Toney is an award winning musician and was an original member of The Blackbyrds, the famous Jazz Fusion Group. He has gone on as a world class solo recording artist and composer. Toney was a conductor and
arranger for many well known and respected recording and performing
artists including: James
Ingram, Patti
Austin, Michael
McDonald, Marilyn
McCoo, Billy
Davis, Jr.,
Carl Anderson, Edwin
Hawkins and Isaac
Hayes.
He has also recorded and/or performed with Aretha
Franklin, Whitney
Houston, Frank
Sinatra, Donald Byrd, Stevie
Wonder,
Seal, Annie Lennox, Shirley
Caesar, Ray
Charles,
Ray Parker Jr., Pink, Kenny Burrell, Nancy Wilson and O.C.
Smith to
name a few.


Kevin
and I believe that with my sound and with his fresh and exciting
arrangements, we can produce and Gershwin record with a first-class
quartet of PIANO, BASS, DRUM & GUITAR that will be soulfully
timeless! We will record 12 SONGS! (10 incredible Gershwin Songs and
2 Originals). THIS WILL BE A FIRST-CLASS RECORDING AT AN A++ STUDIO.
We have the top musicians playing on the record. 

On
Drums:
 Rayford Griffin is internationally respected as among the most inventive, volcanic
and versatile drummers in music, having amassed stellar credits with
virtuosos ranging
from Jean-Luc Ponty and The Stanley Clarke Band,
George Duke, to Dave Koz, Anita Baker and Michael
Jackson. Rayford has roots that extend back to the most revolutionary era of
jazz – be bop – thanks to his uncle: the
great trumpeter/composer Clifford Brown.

Greg Paul is one of the most exciting upcoming drummers on the LA scene. Greg recently graduated  from the University of Southern California with a Masters in Jazz Studies and has played with The Blackbyrds, Vanessa Williams, Adina Howard, TC Carson and more.
On Bass: 



John B. Williams has
performed and/or recorded with Horace Silver, Hugh Masekela, Dizzy
Gillespie, Kenny Burrell, Jon Hendricks, Jimmy Smith, Sir Roland
Hanna, Benny Carter, Louie Bellson, Freddie Hubbard, Count Basie,
Louis Armstrong and many others. John was the house bassist for
late night TV icons Johnny Carson and Arsenio Hall and was a member
of the Nancy Wilson Trio for twenty-five years. 



On
Guitar: 


Terry Wollman is a Billboard charting Guitarist. He has performed with an array of artists including Billy Preston, The 5th Dimension, Wilson Phillips, Al Jarreau, Joan Baez, Joe Walsh, Keb' Mo', Little Richard, Gerald Albright and Eartha Kitt. Recently he co-produced Melissa Manchester's latest album, "You Gotta Love the Life."

There
will be more special guests as well! DON'T YOU LOVE A SURPRISE? 








"It is
clear to me that we need more young entertainers like you who are
passionate to carry on our tradition. You know how to vocally craft a
lyric so each phrase carries depth and meaning. I know Ira would have
been impressed had he had the opportunity to experience you LIVE on
the stage in Burbank!


-
Michael S. Strunsky, (Trustee, The
Ira and Leonore Gershwin Trusts)                  

"The
Great American Songbook is alive and well with the SUPREMELY TALENTED
Elijah Rock- a triple threat entertainer, breathing new life into our
rich tradition." - Bennie
Maupin (Jazz Musician/Composer)



"Elijah Rock is a fine singer!"- Robert Guillaume (Actor, Singer)
"Every once in a while, an Artist like Elijah Rock emerges and reminds you what great singing and showmanship really looks like."  
-Antwone Fisher (Writer, Director, Personality)
"His is an epic voice that can splendidly carry on the legacies of Billy Eckstine, Frank Sinatra, Johnny Hartman, Harry Connick, Jr and other great Jazz crooners."  - Irma P. Hall (Actress)
"An incredibly talented singer and performer, better than almost anyone doing Standards today! " - Shadoe Stevens (Radio Host/TV Personality)
"It's clear we've found our next Superstar Entertainer in Elijah Rock!"
 -Bill Cobbs (Actor) 
"A voice filled with elegance and grace."  
- Leo Manzari (Tap Dancer, Actor of the Manzari Brothers)    





                                                     
Here's
what some of the critics had to say about my performances in "Words
by Ira Gershwin"


“Rock also moves easily between styles, particularly turning his arias from Porgy and Bess into passionate showstoppers that make this musical evening ring with elegant sophistication.” BroadwayWorld
“But it is Elijah Rock (Crooner) who steals the show. With a voice resonant and loud enough for opera, this recurring guest star on Showtime’s “Masters of Sex” has the stage presence and dancing ability to go as far as his talent will take him. Here, the 2014 NAACP Theatre Award Winner displays a deep and natural understanding of and flair for the material. This critic hopes to see Rock on the stages of Burbank or Los Angeles again soon.”NoHoArtsDistrict
“Baritone Rock (NAACP Theatre Award-winner for his 2014 performance in “Breath and Imagination” at the Colony), with charm to spare, shifts smoothly from crisp jazz phrasings to the operatic “Oh Bess, Oh Where Is My Bess?” and he proves to be a notable tapper in “They All Laughed,” a sizzling rhythm match with drummer Webster. Glendale News-Press                                                     


                                        
One of the ways I will give back is by teaching Master Classes to students of the Arts and underprivileged teens about the history and importance of the Great American Songbook. I will also be teaching students how to SUCCESSFULLY crowdfund their dream! By making this campaign a success, you will be helping me give back to thousands of students and kids worldwide!





Your help is critical in manifesting this special dedication to George and Ira Gershwin's music while launching me as a Recording Artist.  I CAN'T WAIT TO SING FOR YOU AND TOUR ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND AROUND THE WORLD!!! GEORGE and IRA GERSHWIN'S music is AMERICA'S CLASSICAL music. I appreciate your financial blessings and for preserving our rich legacy, upheld by great artists like Louis Armstrong, Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Tony Bennett, Billy Eckstine, Johnny Harman, Natalie Cole, Dianna Krall, Lady Gaga and others before them. I pledge that I will represent our Great American Songbook with class, passion, heart and good old fashioned Entertainment!
THANK YOU AND WITH MUCH GRATITUDE!  WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

Risks & Challenges
The only challenge with this project is securing the funds, and that is where we need your help and why we launched this campaign! Everything else is lined up and ready to go. The team is waiting in the dressing room, ready to make our grand entrance as soon as we have the financing we need!  
   Other Ways You Can Help
  Please spread the word to your friends and family about this campaign! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
For more information about Elijah go to the Elijah Rock Website


Twitter, Facebook

story:
Groove LTD. feat. U-Nam | Shannon Kennedy Debut Album "First Class"

Hey everyone! My name is Shannon Kennedy and along with U-Nam, we are Groove LTD. 


We are so thrilled to announce that we’re getting ready to put the final touches on our first album. 

We’ve been hard at work in the studio the past few months, preparing this project for you and it’s currently in the mixing stage, so this campaign is going to be a bit different than some of the other album campaigns out there. 

With this campaign, we’re asking you to help us fund the mastering, manufacturing, and marketing (such as radio promotion and ads). And the great news is, because the album is close to completion, we’ll have a lot of great stuff to share with you sooner so that you don’t have to wait long to hear what we’ve been up to. 

In exchange for pre-ordering the album (and some of the other awesome incentives we’re offering), you’ll help us with the final stages of our project. And helping us fund this campaign will get the music and tons of other great stuff that won’t be offered elsewhere into your hands before anyone else! 

We want you to be a part of our team and to be a part of the making of this album! 

We have a first class lineup with us on the project including chart topping keyboardist Jonathan Fritzen, soulstress Maysa Leak, Neo-Soul singer Myron Davis, and the legendary percussionist, Paulinho DaCosta, drummer, Michael White (George Benson, Maze etc..), steel drums superstar, Andy Narell, bassist, Dwayne “Smitty” Smith (Boney James, Isley Brothers…), and many more...
"It's Only Love" Official Music Video 

Make sure you check out the incentives for our project - there’s a lot of really fun and unique items including the saxophone from the “It’s Only Love” music video, exclusive versions of tracks, signed CDs, Skype Lessons and even a private Google Hangout acoustic show for you and your friends. 

We’re also going to include the mp3 download of “It’s Only Love” as a gift to everyone who contributes to the project which will be available for immediate download. It was the album’s first single and it saw a lot of success and airplay worldwide. And whether or not you choose to contribute, we’d really appreciate your helping us share this campaign with your friends!

U-Nam and I are so excited to be on this new adventure with you. Thank you so much from the bottom of our hearts for all your love and support! We love you all! 

www.grooveltd.com 


There is a sneak peek preview of some of the new songs in the campaign video :) ...Did you check it out yet ?

"First Class" digital album download will be available approximately 3 weeks before the physical CD.


Groove Ltd. "First Class" Debut Album 

Produced, Arranged & Mixed by U-Nam
Horns Arrangements by U-Nam
Strings Arrangements by Raymond Gimenes & U-Nam
Musicians:
Saxophones & Flute: Shannon Kennedy
Guitars, Synths, Programming & Editing: U-Nam
Lead Vocals: Maysa Leak, Myron Davis
Background Vocals: Maysa Leak, Myron Davis, Kim Chandler
Percussion: Paulinho DaCosta, Denis Benarrosh
Piano: Jonathan Fritzen, Franck Sitbon
Drums: Michael White, Tony Moore, Fran Merante
Bass: Dwayne "Smitty" Smith, U-Nam
Fender Rhodes: Bill Steinway, Franck Sitbon
Strings: Maria Grig, Raymond Gimenes, U-Nam
Trumpet: Christian Martinez
Trombone: Bernard Camoin
Steel Drums: Andy Narell


About Groove LTD.

- Shannon Kennedy

Creating an accomplished reputation in an ever-expanding array of musical genres, Shannon Kennedy is recognized as an extraordinarily multi-faceted artist, composer, producer, performer, and recording artist.

Primarily recognized as a ‘powerhouse saxophonist’ throughout Southern California, Kennedy made her international debut performing on the 2007 Smooth Jazz Cruise with some of Smooth Jazz’s best-known performers – Brian Culberston, Craig Chaquico, Boney James, Nick Colionne, Candy Dulfer, and Michael Lington. Since she has toured and performed with 10,000 Maniacs, Peter White, and has made an appearance on the television series America’s Got Talent as well as the Jimmy Kimmel Show with Mø.

Visit www.shannon-kennedy.com for more information.


- U-Nam

Accomplished producer, composer and guitarist U-Nam is best known for his #1 hit “Street Life” on the US Billboard charts in 2007. But it isn’t just in Smooth Jazz that he has proven himself as a force to be reckoned with, he is also well-known as a respected songwriter and producer in France in the Pop and R&B genres having worked with artists such as Barry White, Kool & the Gang, Billy Paul, French Pop-Idol, MC Solaar and more.

His previous solo release, “Weekend in L.A” (A Tribute to George Benson) has reached the #1 position on Amazon US in the Neo-Soul and Smooth Jazz categories and #1 on iTunes for Jazz in Japan. The album features stars including Patrice Rushen, Phil Perry, Stokley Williams, George Duke, Marcus Miller, et al.

U-Nam has had the opportunity to perform in Russia, Dubai, Malaysia, and tour the US and Europe as part of major festivals.

“C’est Le Funk” the first single from his latest album of the same name, was selected as the “Song of the Year” on KHIT-HD3 ST LOUIS. “Something’s Up,” the second single from C’est Le Funk, reached #29 on the US Billboard Jazz Charts and #15 on the  SmoothJazz . com Charts.

In 2014, U-Nam has been touring with saxophonist Shannon Kennedy. Their performances brought them to SoCal (Humphrey’s San Diego, Spaghetinni Seal Beach, Jazz in the Gardens Palm Springs) as well as Malaysia for the World Youth Jazz Festival.

On September 8th, U-Nam released his latest album “C’est Le Funk” which went straight to the top of the charts on its first day, reaching #1 on the Amazon US“Best Sellers” List for Funk Albums, #1 for Smooth Jazz Albums and #19 in Overall Jazz.

The single from his latest release, “Smoovin’,” reached #18 on the US BillboardCharts and his highly acclaimed album, “C’est le Funk”, was #1 on the AmazonBest Selling list for Smooth Jazz, Funk and Jazz Fusion.

The album has also been #6 on the SmoothJazz . com Top 50 Charts and #2 on their Indie Charts. 

Visit www.unammusic.com for more information.

story:
Hi there, my name is Evan Diamond. I am 19 years old and am originally from Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Last year my parents and I decided to relocate to Southern California so that I could pursue my dream of being a songwriter and performing artist.

Music has always been a huge part of my life. My dad introduced me to the music of his generation which included so many of the greatest bands of all time. When he first played me some Beatles tunes I completely fell in love and they are still my favorite band to this day.  My mother’s musical tastes were more along the lines of folk rock icons like Carole King and James Taylor, influences which I am pleased to incorporate into my own musical style.

I would say I finally realized my passion to be a musician when I was in university. Growing up I never seemed to fit in. I was bullied in school for being different and unfortunately my struggle to be part of the crowd followed me to university as well. Along with that, about a week before my 18th birthday, a very dear friend and mentor of mine passed away. I couldn’t get out of bed for a week after that. However, after spending a day scrolling through the internet I found a song by Demi Lovato called Nightingale and I actually broke down in tears at how much the song touched me after just one listen. Her lyrics resonated with me and made me realize that I wasn’t alone. That’s when it all really clicked for me. I wanted to do that. I wanted someone to turn on my music when they were feeling down or alone and have it touch their hearts.

After that I began to write songs and melodies on my guitar. It was a way to get my feelings out so I didn’t just drown in negative emotion but found myself able to deal with my issues in a much more positive way. I just kept writing, not necessarily sad songs, but stories, about love, happiness, loss, anything that I was feeling or inspired me and made me want to tell other people about. It is my ultimate hope that no matter who you are or what you’re going through, you can turn on my music and start to feel even a little bit better and possibly be inspired to find the passion that lies within you, as I found mine.


That is why I am launching this campaign to raise enough money to take the best of my material and record an EP so that my music can reach a much wider audience and hopefully have the same impact on them as other songwriters have had on me. I can only do that with your help!

I’m looking to raise $15,000 to produce and record this EP with 5 to 6 of my songs. That includes musicians, studio time, mixing and mastering plus manufacturing and distribution all under the watchful eye of my producer and mentor Jimmy Gnecco of the band Ours.

For helping us achieve this goal, I have created a number of awesome and limited edition merchandise and perks ranging from a personalized thank you to lifetime VIP passes to all my concerts.

If I am unable to achieve my full campaign goal I will still utilize the proceeds from the campaign towards the production of the EP with fewer songs. I have no intention of giving up on this project.  

Over the course of this year I have been invited to perform at multiple venues in San Diego and Los Angeles including the World Famous San Diego Fair at Del Mar, Knott’s Berry Farm, Lestat's West and 9 on Vine in Hollywood. I’ve also appeared as a guest numerous times on internet radio station Restless Nation Radio, which airs worldwide. Mike Wearren, the show’s host said, “You’ve got to see her folks. She’s one of those artists you really have to see live to see the emotion and expression she gives in her performances.”

Your donations will be instrumental in funding the EP but if we are able to raise additional money it will be utilized towards additional recording and touring expenses.

My parents and brother have always been my strongest supporters for everything that I have done in my life. During the difficult times when I found it so hard to relate to kids my own age, my brother Eli was always there to take me under his wing and look out for me. Now he has continued to be my great big brother, having helped me to get me an introduction, through an associate, to Jimmy Gnecco, a phenomenal singer and leader of the band Ours. When Jimmy called me after having received some live performance videos of my songs and told me how much he enjoyed my music and how pleased he would be to work with me I felt so excited and extremely validated. Jimmy Gnecco is an amazingly talented, beautiful and giving individual and it has been a privilege to be able to work with him. It’s not every day you get to work with someone who has a song written about him by Lana Del Rey.

I have also been fortunate to work with other excellent vocal coaches here in San Diego.  I am currently working with Steve Grey Romande who has helped me immeasurably in developing my vocal style.  He has an extensive Broadway performance background.

As mentioned before, my parents are also two of my biggest supporters. Recently things have been difficult for us financially which is another reason why I am launching this Indiegogo campaign.

I hope that everybody who visits my campaign is able to give even just a dollar but if you choose there are other very important ways you can assist my campaign which include spreading the word through social media, word of mouth and attending any of my concerts to support my music directly.

Find me on social media!

Twitter: https://twitter.com/EDiamondGold

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/evandiamondgold

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/lizzie2228

Instagram: https://instagram.com/evandiamondmusic/

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/evandiamondmusic 

It is also my intention to donate a portion of the proceeds to mental health awareness, a struggle that not only my family but millions of others deal with regularly.  

My parents always emphasized to my brother and I that life is a pursuit of passion whatever form it takes so that you can be a participant rather than a spectator in life. Everyone can pursue their own unique dreams in order to add life’s meaning the way music has done for me. At the end of the day, I want to try to touch people’s hearts and lift people up with my songs the way artists' music has always inspired and been there for me. I hope you will contribute to my fundraising endeavor so that I have the financial ability to record my EP and enable me to reach a much wider audience with my music.

crowd followed me to university as well. Along with that, about a week before
my 18th birthday, a very dear friend and mentor of mine passed away.
I couldn’t get out of bed for a week after that. However, after spending a day
scrolling through the internet I found a song by Demi Lovato called Nightingale
and I actually broke down in tears at how much the song touched me after just
one listen. Her lyrics resonated with me and made me realize that I wasn’t
alone. That’s when it all really clicked for me. I wanted to do that. I wanted
someone to turn on my music when they were feeling down or alone and have it touch
their hearts. 
After that I began to write songs and melodies on my guitar.
It was a way to get my feelings out so I didn’t just drown in negative emotion but
found myself able to deal with my issues in a much more positive way. I just
kept writing, not necessarily sad songs, but stories, about love, happiness,
loss, anything that I was feeling or inspired me and made me want to tell other
people about. It is my ultimate hope that no matter who you are or what you’re
going through, you can turn on my music and start to feel even a little bit
better and possibly be inspired to find the passion that lies within you, as I
found mine.
That is why I am launching this campaign to raise enough
money to take the best of my material and record an EP so that my music can
reach a much wider audience and hopefully have the same impact on them as other
songwriters have had on me. I can only do that with your help!
I’m looking to raise $15,000 to produce and record this EP
with 5 to 6 of my songs. That includes musicians, studio time, mixing and
mastering plus manufacturing and distribution all under the watchful eye of my
producer and mentor Jimmy Gnecco of the band Ours. 
For helping us achieve this goal, I have created a number of
awesome and limited edition merchandise and perks ranging from a personalized
thank you to lifetime VIP passes to all my concerts. 
If I am unable to achieve my full campaign goal I will still
utilize the proceeds from the campaign towards the production of the EP with
fewer songs. I have no intention of giving up on this project.  
Over the course of this year I have been invited to perform at multiple
venues in San Diego and Los Angeles including the World Famous San Diego Fair at Del Mar,
Knott’s Berry Farm, Lestat's West and 9 on Vine in Hollywood. I’ve also appeared as a guest
numerous times on internet radio station Restless Nation Radio, which airs worldwide. Mike Wearren, the show’s host said, “You’ve
got to see her folks. She’s one of those artists you really have to see live to
see the emotion and expression she gives in her performances.” Your donations will be instrumental in funding the EP but if
we are able to raise additional money it will be utilized towards additional
recording and touring expenses. 
My parents and brother have always been my strongest
supporters for everything that I have done in my life. During the difficult
times when I found it so hard to relate to kids my own age, my brother Eli was
always there to take me under his wing and look out for me. Now he has
continued to be my great big brother, having helped me to get me an
introduction, through an associate, to Jimmy Gnecco, a phenomenal singer and leader of the band Ours. When Jimmy called me after
having received some live performance videos of my songs and told me how much
he enjoyed my music and how pleased he would be to work with me I felt so
excited and extremely validated. Jimmy Gnecco is an amazingly talented, beautiful and
giving individual and it has been a privilege to be able to work with him. It’s
not every day you get to work with someone who has a song written about him by
Lana Del Rey. 
I have also been fortunate to work with other excellent
vocal coaches here in San Diego.  I am currently working with Steve Grey Romande who has helped me immeasurably in developing my vocal style.  He has an
extensive Broadway performance background. 
As mentioned before, my parents are also two of my biggest
supporters. Recently things have been difficult for us financially which is
another reason why I am launching this Indiegogo campaign.
I hope that everybody who visits my campaign is able to give
even just a dollar but if you choose there are other very important
ways you can assist my campaign which include spreading the word through social
media, word of mouth and attending any of my concerts to support my music
directly. 
Find me on social media!Twitter: https://twitter.com/EDiamondGoldFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/evandiamondgoldYouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/lizzie2228Instagram: https://instagram.com/evandiamondmusic/Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/evandiamondmusic 
It is also my intention to donate a portion of the proceeds
to mental health awareness, a struggle that not only my family but millions of
others deal with regularly.  
My parents always emphasized to my brother and I that life
is a pursuit of passion whatever form it takes so that you can be a participant
rather than a spectator in life. Everyone can pursue their own unique dreams in
order to add life’s meaning the way music has done for me. At the end of the
day, I want to try to touch people’s hearts and lift people up with my songs
the way artists' music has always inspired and been there for me. I hope you
will contribute to my fundraising endeavor so that I have the financial ability
to record my EP and enable me to reach a much wider audience with my music.

story:
Who Are We & What Are We Up To?

(Please note: as amazing as it would be, we have not been asked by The Gaslight Anthem to produce this video. All campaigning is unaffiliated with the band, no copyright infringement intended.)

It's Yersel Media and Orange Tip Productions are two teen production companies collaborating on what we hope will be an amazing project. Most of us met on a regional BFI Film Academy course in Edinburgh last year and as a crew cannot wait to get back behind the camera again.
This project is a little different to what we're used to, but with your help, a little perseverance and lots of laughs, we're certain we can pull it off. What we're hoping to produce is a short film/music video for New Jersey rock band, The Gaslight Anthem's, song  'Underneath The Ground.' The song, we believe, tells a very important story about life, what lies ahead, and what we leave behind. You can look at it from many different angles- every song means something different to each individual- but we would love to share with you our take, through this video production. 
The script is well underway and our shoot will take place between Friday 21st and Sunday 23rd of August 2015 in Edinburgh and the surrounding areas.

Meet The Team!

Writer/Director/Producer: Beth M. Cameron

Executive Producers: Jojo Johnstone, Jamie “McCarron” Thomson

Director of Photography: Edward Kondracki

Hair/Makeup/Costumes: Rebecca Collins

Crew: Michael Shaw, Innes Goodall, Nathan Pearson, Cleo Denholm, Bruce Scott

Cast (so far!): Nichole MJ Cook, Innes Ramsay, Ruairidh Keiller, Liam Henderson

How Can You Help Us?

We are looking for small donations to go towards our shoot weekend (filming can be a little pricey...and there's only so far summer job money can go!). Any funds raised will go directly towards 

  • Travel: many of the team live outside of the city and will have to travel into Edinburgh each day of the shoot. We will also have to travel from location to location either by car or bus. Petrol and fare money would be handy.
  • Location bookings: some of the locations we have booked into (e.g. music studios, rehearsal rooms) charge for the use of the space.
  • Props, Makeup & Costumes: most of this we will likely already have through borrowing and lending, however some purchases may have to be made for certain scenes. 
  • Catering: Although we are unable to pay our actors for their work, we'd like to be able to pay for their meals throughout the weekend. Any left over funds, will go towards food and drink for the crew. Hungry film crew= sad/grumpy/unproductive film crew.
  • Music: We may purchase some royalty free tracks to place in the opening scenes of the video. Sometimes these are free of charge but most require a payment.
  • Publicity: If our fundraising campaign is successful, we may use spare funds to spread the word about the finished project via social media ads etc. 

What's In It For You?

We'd like to offer you some perks after you donate. These are still in progress...more are on the way! So far our perks range from your name in the credits to a first look at the video. Also if you live close enough, we can offer you free hugs for being so kind to donate to this project!

Risks & Challenges

As excited as we are to get started on this project, we do realise that we are going to reach some hurdles. As with any film shoot, there's the possibility that we may not get all of the filming done in the one weekend and the project will be postponed, however we are optimistic that it will run smoothly. If we stick to a nice schedule we'll hopefully have everything done and ready for you all to see by late September!

Other Ways You Can Help

We would value any contribution to this project, and we don't just mean financially we would love if you could:

  • Spread the word: give this project a share on social media.
  • Follow us on Twitter @orangetipmedia
  • Like Orange Tip Productions on Facebook: www.facebook.com/orangetipproductions
  • Like It's Yersel Media on Facebook: www.facebook.com/itsyerselmedia
  • Just check out the song and check out The Gaslight Anthem! www.thegaslightanthem.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey! I'm putting together an album of new songs that I've written. I'd really like you to hear them! 

For those of you that don't know me, I live and play music in Austin Texas. Was raised in Shreveport Louisiana, where I first heard Huddie 'Leadbelly' Ledbetter, turned me onto the Blues, Folk, Jazz and traditional Americana roots music. 

I've been writing songs for over 10 years now, and I think I'm finally getting the hang of it. Really, this album that I'm putting together now is a collection of songs that I'm proud of. It' going to be recorded in an all analog studio here in Austin, with some amazing musicians. 

I'm putting together merch packages, making T-shirts, buttons and such. Also offering my services as a musician here in Austin for house shows or children's birthday parties.

So donate, get some new music, and some cool shit!

story:
In October 2015 Voices from the Hills, a new choir from Sechu-Zubza, a small village/town in Nagaland, North East India is planning to travel to Malaysia for the first time to perform in front of a live audience, and needs your help to make this happen.


The founder and composer of Voices from the Hills is 26 year old Toto Chucha, a young man whose untapped natural musical talent was discovered at a leadership and peacebuilding Conference at Sechu-Zubza in 2012. Many talented musicians from this region like Toto have not had the opportunity to develop their creative skills due to lack of money and support. Since gaining some recognition and financial support, Toto has been able  to get some formal music training, and as a result he has started up Prelude Music School for local young people. Toto is determined  that other creative young children from Sechu-Zubza and the neighbouring villages have the opportunity to grow and maintain their passion for music and do not struggle like he did as a child. Since its inception in 2014  the school has benefitted 18 young boys and girls.


Voices of the Hills is made up of 10 young men and women, and is a  result of Toto’s belief that music can encourage peace building making development possible. Nagaland has long been associated with a staggering host of problems; namely alcoholism, drug addiction, extortion, and other forms of corruption. This is a fledgling but precious step in celebrating the wealth of music and culture in Nagaland, alongside its pristine and unspoilt nature that is visited by tourists.  


Sechu-Zubza has a growing relationship with friends from Malaysia and Initiatives of Change, a global charity and network of individuals building bridges between different cultures to encourage peace, understanding and human security. Already friends in Malaysia have responded to enable Voices of the Hills to make a professional recording, as well as providing a concert hall for them to sing in. This two week visit to Malaysia will have a huge impact on the choir members and the villages in their area. The following are some of the outcomes expected:

  • Put Naga people firmly on the cultural map by touching the hearts and minds of the people of Malaysia
  • Increase the social, business and cultural interaction between Naga people and Malaysia
  • Enable them to become leaders  and income earners in their community
  • Become Ambassadors for their country
  • Build their confidence and take pride in their talent for music
  • Give them a strong sense of purpose and meaning for their lives

20% of the budget has already been achieved with contributions from well wishers, and mainly by fundraising amongst the choir members. To cover the cost of fares and expenses during their stay in Malaysia, we need to raise another 3000 Pounds for Voices of the Hills to make this life and world-changing visit to Malaysia in October. Your contribution will make a significant impact and influence on the appreciation and practice of culture, that is key to the development of the Naga people.

story:
Hello!

Hi everyone! We are Static Charmer, an Indie Pop/Rock band from Hamden, CT. We have started this Indiegogo to help the upcoming release of our debut EP. The songs are recorded and ready to be released! However we need the $600 for other expenses involving the EP such as physical copies, t-shirts, gas money to tour with, etc. 


Where you come in to play:

Ever since we met in 6th grade, we both loved music and eventually grew to start this band! We can really use all the help we can get since this is a 100% independent release. We are proud to be able to do this all ourselves and it has always been a big dream of both of ours to be musicians, and we'd love to have your support along the way! To anyone that donates, we cannot thank you enough! We will be forever grateful for every donation even as small as $1. If we get fully funded that would be absolutely amazing, but even if we don't, the money raised will go right back into other expenses involving the EP or even the recording of our next release! So we are so glad to have you donate!

When you do, there are many perks including:

Digital downloads, Signed physical CD's, personal acoustic shows on and offline, and some even better ones so check them out!


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate, thats totally fine, don't feel bad, we're poor too! But if you still want to help, feel free to share this on social media, blogs, youtube, anything you can think of! We are so grateful for anything you can give us! Feel free to contact us if you want, we always respond to everyone and love talking to our fans, so don't be shy! We love you all so much and once again, thank you from the very bottom of our hearts!


- STATIC CHARMER

story:
Geek Musica is a new musical venture featuring student, new, and young musicians that will perform regular concerts of video-game and film scores. 

Who doesn't love a good story? And who doesn't love film and video-game music? We're a group of student and emerging professional musicians who love games, films, and the music that accompanies them. 
What we're funding for: I want this to not just be another resume-filler for young musicians - I also want to pay young musicians for their work. The majority of the money raised will be spent on paying the artists who perform with Geek Musica, while the rest will be dedicated to acquiring sheet music (and we need a LOT!) travel expenses where necessary, and potentially paying for rehearsal or performance space. The aim of this project is to bring new, promising, and talented young musicians together to learn, grow, earn, and travel! 
My other current collaborative project, Seeds of Atropos, has hosted half a dozen collaborators up until now, and in the same collaborative spirit, I think Geek Musica can be a tremendous success...with your help! 
Every little bit helps, so if you're inclined to part with a few dollars to help this group spring off the ground and into your nearest concert hall, you would have our gratitude!

story:
My Story:

Hello, my name is Megan Leonardo. I am a 24 year old singer/songwriter, originally from Montauk, New York, but a recent Austin, Texas transplant. For the past 3 years, I have been working the amateur performance circuit, showcasing my love of music and performing around the local and statewide scene. I’ve performed in a number of festivals and showcases, and have even played a SXSW showcase and was featured as the winner for the United Auto Insurance jingle contest in Chicago!


Impact:

My campaign is incredibly important to building my career as a singer/songwriter. I created this crowdfund project to help raise money to further my musical career. My sound and genre has changed over the past few years, and I have been working to build my fanbase. Unfortunately, without having a few really great albums to produce and distribute, having fans can only go so far in getting recognized and moving forward!

What I Need:

I am attempting to raise $5,000 to make a new album with full production in a professional studio. I have connected with Westfall Recording Company, who has worked with artists on major labels like Sony. My sound has changed since I released my first LP, and I am looking to make a album that has more of my "grown up" sound that actually got me booked at several larger-scale festivals and showcases. The $5,000 will be used to record and produce 6 songs with full production, including studio musicians.

My long-term goal with this campaign and the album production is to start submitting my music to labels and agents. I've been starting to build a lot of hype, but haven't been able to hang onto it as much for lack of recordings. This would put me over the edge and give me a chance to get where I need to be in my career.

How You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, you can still help support my growing career! Please take a moment and share my campaign and information with your family and friends via social media, email, and word of mouth. With your help I can raise the funding necessary to get my album produced and distributed for a wider audience, and hopefully connect with a label!
