story:
I've been a singer-songwriter, performing in the Boston area and beyond since the mid-70's.  My first band, New Harmony Sisterhood, recorded  "And Ain't I a Woman"  on the Paredon/Folkways label. It is now part of the Smithsonian American Folk collection. 
I released a solo album of original songs, "Around the Next Bend," in the late 80's on the Flying Fish/Rounder label.  That album was nominated for Folk album of the year in the Annual Boston Music Awards. 


 Following that I performed and recorded two additional albums, "If You Build It," and "Grand Design" with my 4 woman a capella group, Taproot, containing many of my original compositions.  After a 10 year hiatus, Taproot has reconvened and performs in the Boston area. 
Fast forward and I have returned to performing on my own with fantastic new backup musicians, including Eric Wells on guitar and harmony vocals, Eric Levenson on bass and Eric Kilburn on mandolin and dobro (that's right, three Erics!).  And, I have written a slew of new songs which are ready and waiting for a new album of their own. 
My plan is to go into the studio this fall, 2015.  We'll be recording at Wellspring Sound in Acton , MA with Eric Kilburne at the board.  Eric K. has recorded many of the finest acoustic and Americana musicians performing on the national stage.  His response to a personal preview of the new material slated for this album was more than enthusiastic.  He's eager, in addition to recording the album, to contribute his own world class mandolin backup.   I also am looking forward to bringing in as many other musicians on vocals and instrumentals as possible.  All of these are people I've been fortunate to share both stage and studio with over the course of my music career in Boston. 
This is where you come in....  
Studio time is costly and that time determines the production possibilities for the songs.  The more resources I have to work with, the more we'll be able to give each song the arrangement it deserves.  In addition to guitar and bass, the sounds of fiddle, banjo, dobro and mandolin are already reverberating in my head. Your contribution will allow me to continue to share my music, not just locally, but beyond.  Anything you can offer will be deeply appreciated.  
And PLEASE pass this along to anyone you know who might also be interested.

If you would like a sneak peak, visit my website here: http://www.debobiz.com/listen/
THANK YOU!!!!!!!!  
Deborah
story_txt:
I've been a singer-songwriter, performing in the Boston area and beyond since the mid-70's.  My first band, New Harmony Sisterhood, recorded  "And Ain't I a Woman"  on the Paredon/Folkways label. It is now part of the Smithsonian American Folk collection. I released a solo album of original songs, "Around the Next Bend," in the late 80's on the Flying Fish/Rounder label.  That album was nominated for Folk album of the year in the Annual Boston Music Awards. 


 Following that I performed and recorded two additional albums, "If You Build It," and "Grand Design" with my 4 woman a capella group, Taproot, containing many of my original compositions.  After a 10 year hiatus, Taproot has reconvened and performs in the Boston area. 
Fast forward and I have returned to performing on my own with fantastic new backup musicians, including Eric Wells on guitar and harmony vocals, Eric Levenson on bass and Eric Kilburn on mandolin and dobro (that's right, three Erics!).  And, I have written a slew of new songs which are ready and waiting for a new album of their own. 
My plan is to go into the studio this fall, 2015.  We'll be recording at Wellspring Sound in Acton , MA with Eric Kilburne at the board.  Eric K. has recorded many of the finest acoustic and Americana musicians performing on the national stage.  His response to a personal preview of the new material slated for this album was more than enthusiastic.  He's eager, in addition to recording the album, to contribute his own world class mandolin backup.  

I also am looking forward to bringing in as many other musicians on vocals and instrumentals as possible.  All of these are people I've been fortunate to share both stage and studio with over the course of my music career in Boston. This is where you come in....  Studio time is costly and that time determines the production possibilities for the songs.  The more resources I have to work with, the more we'll be able to give each song the arrangement it deserves.  In addition to guitar and bass, the sounds of fiddle, banjo, dobro and mandolin are already reverberating in my head.
Your contribution will allow me to continue to share my music, not just locally, but beyond.  Anything you can offer will be deeply appreciated.  And PLEASE pass this along to anyone you know who might also be interested.

If you would like a sneak peak, visit my website here: http://www.debobiz.com/listen/
THANK YOU!!!!!!!!  
Deborah

story:
Hey folks!  We are Abalone Grey, an up and coming Americana band based out of Santa Cruz, CA.  During the past 6 months, we’ve made a lot of amazing new discoveries.  First, we discovered each other.  Like moths to a light in the dark, we were all drawn together by a love for music and the astounding talent we all saw in each other.  Though each one of us has our own distinctive skills and sound, together we have formed something much greater than the sum of the parts.  A collective energy has created Abalone Grey, and our newest discovery is that the same energy has brought us to the stage in a band’s life when it needs to spread its wings and take to the road.  But we need your help!  Our dream is to share our music with the world, so please help us get on the road for our very first tour through the Northwestern United States!

Our humble entourage consists of Bobcat Rob Armenti (guitar, vocals), Luke Kinney (mandolin, vocals), Kat Factor (guitar, vocals, washboard), Emma Shaw (upright bass, vocals), and Noah Freedman (fiddle, vocals).  As you can see, we all love to sing, but what makes us truly unique is the fact that every member brings forward new songs and ideas which leads to the creation of collectively constructed music.  We are absolutely in love with the art of music making, and we hope you can hear our passion in our sound.

Below is our currently planned tour starting off in our home town of Santa Cruz at the Crepe Place on September 9th and ending at the Lost Sierra Hoedown in Johnsville, CA on September 25th.

9/9 - Santa Cruz, CA 

9/12 - Pescadero, CA

9/14 - Pacifica, CA 

9/15 - Tahoe City, CA

9/16 - South Lake Tahoe, CA

9/17 - Eugene, OR

9/18 - Portland, OR

9/19 - Seattle, WA 

9/22 - San Francisco, CA

9/24-27 - Johnsville, CA

Now what we really need from you, our friends, families, fans, and the community is the funding to make this tour possible!  Going on the road is always a financial challenge, but the results are always worth it and we can overcome this obstacle with your aid.  The majority of the contributions to this cause will help fuel our transportation up the coast.  With more than 2,000 miles to cover, we need all the help we can get to keep our touring vehicle going strong.  Beyond simply the cost of gas, there will be inevitable vehicle repairs and other related costs.  We also need another kind of fuel however.  Although we will cut the cost of food as best we can, cook collectively and buy smart, groceries will still need to be bought and bellies will need to be filled.  For lodging, we plan to camp as much as possible (where fees must still be paid), but a shared hotel room may be unavoidable at times.  Additional money will be spent on keeping our instruments, recording equipment, camera equipment, and amps in working condition.  These costs are unavoidable as well and always seem to come at the worst time.  If by some amazing and beautiful chance our supporting community provides us with extra finances, all the proceeds will go to funding our much needed future recording sessions.  This really helps get our music out there and also gets our songs back into your hands!

As a band, we have decided that your support cannot not go unrewarded, and to show our appreciation, we have provided a collection of different and awesome perks you can receive for helping us out.  These presents include CDs of our music, digital recordings, T-shirts, stickers, and beer koozies.

We are so, so grateful for all of the love and support you have all given us so far on our journey, but now we really need everyone to come together give us another little push to send us toward our dreams.  Anything you can contribute is more than appreciated and no donation is too small.  Again thank you so much and keep the good tunes a’rollin!

story:
Short Summary


The Liberation Music Collective is a socially-conscious big band dedicated to performing original compositions about contemporary social issues. We're currently making our first studio album, Siglo XXI. Our goal is to bring a fresh 21st-century approach to the tradition of protest music in jazz, following in the footsteps of Charlie Haden, Max Roach, Charles Mingus, and many others. In addition to the jazz canon, we draw from the plurality of genres present in America, including hip-hop, Afro-Cuban music, Sacred Harp hymns, Islamic liturgy, and post-modern classical music. By focusing on social issues and embracing this plurality of styles within a jazz context, we hope to bring jazz back into the socially provocative music of our era.


What We Need & What You Get


We're recording our first studio album, Siglo XXI. Earlier in May, we had a whirlwind week of rehearsals, a live gig, and our days in the studio. Now we're in the mixing and mastering process. We received grant money from our university to cover costs up to this point, but we want this music to reach the world--and that means hiring professional promotion and manufacturing physical CDs with album artwork and liner notes, which is not cheap! This is where you come in. If you believe in socially relevant music and grassroots social justice, please consider donating to the Liberation Music Collective. 

We want to give back to you too--by donating, you gain access to a variety of "perks" that we are very excited to share with you. Whatever your donation level, you'll get something in return. Check out the right hand side of this page to see all of your options!

The Impact


We feel that the power of this project rests in the music. Each song on the album is dedicated to a specific issue in today's society. Here's the line-up:


1. Murasaki: a tribute to Lady Murasaki Shikibu, who is credited with writing the world's first novel (The Tale of Genji), and to all the women whose contributions to the arts and to humanity continue to go unsung.


2. War Department: based on a Sacred Harp Hymn of the same name, this blistering free jazz arrangement explores the absurdity and confusion in war and our continuous failure as a society to escape its cycle.


3. Bismillah: this song is a tribute to the beautiful and peaceful activists in Islam who work simultaneously against Islamic extremists and Islamophobes.

 
4. El Viento: a contrafact of "Baba Fururu," a Santerían hymn to the deity of justice and wisdom Obatalá, that explores immigration justice in the U.S.


5. Interitus: this tour de force chronicles humanity’s relationship with the planet earth, from our start in primordial pools, to the apogee of civilization, to our mismanagement and desecration of the environment into inevitable disaster.

 
6. Child's Song for an Incarcerated Parent: based on the hymn "Father I Adore You," this piece is an exploration of the emotional tumult of having a parent in a U.S. prison (a reality that far too many children in our country experience).


7. Wedding Hymn: a meditation on the love and devotion  expressed between LGBTQ+ couples—and a miniature narrative about the struggle for marriage equality and against homophobia worldwide.


8. Herstory: a raging feminist manifesto that still manages not to be about man-hating (calm down already).


9. Black & Red: words fail us when trying to express our grief and outrage at racial profiling and police brutality in this country, but hopefully this song begins to give voice to that pain. 


10. Anthem of the 99%: what we can do together collectively can change all of our lives for the better—and someday, for the best.


Other Ways You Can Help


There are lots of ways to show your support for the Liberation Music Collective. Like and follow us on Facebook, check out our YouTube channel, come to a live show, share the Indigogo page with all of your friends, or help us spread by word of mouth!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alexandra Klausner and in 2017 - under the full moon - I transformed into Werekitten! She's my music alter-ego who follows her dreams, gets signed to labels, and inspires others to dance so hard they lose their underwear.

When I started making music I never imagined my songs would go anywhere other than my living room - let alone a music label! I’m joyful, in disbelief, and ready to embark on this next adventure. My voice was lowered to sound like a man but it makes the video that much more fun!

The funds raised will help me to make a professional quality music video. The real deal!

 

What We Need & What You Get

By donating to my campaign you’ll help me to afford a professional director of photography, camera equipment rentals, a great location, hair and makeup, and food and drinks for actors. Music videos can get expensive but I have a group of talented people willing to shoot the production at a discounted rate.

If you can’t donate your funds, I’m also looking for dancers and actors to dance in the video and would love your participation! Everything helps. Anyone interested can shoot me a message on my Werekitten Facebook page.

 

The Impact

I want you to dance, to feel comfortable and sexy in your own skin, and to have an infinite amount of fun. That’s what this video is about: shedding your layers and being true to yourself. Oh! And dancing! Lots of dancing!

 

Risks & Challenges

No new project comes without challenges. I’ve never made a music video before and I’m sure I’ll experience some hurdles along the way. Luckily, I’m surrounded by a group of talented people who will mentor me through the process.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a position to give money or time but like the cause, please feel free to share it with your friends! You can share the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
Why Jazz? Why Terence Blanchard? And why Film Fest Gent?

2017 is a year full of festivities in the world of jazz. Due to its 100th birthday, celebrations are going on everywhere, and the Film Fest Gent team is honouring the genre by dedicating the World Soundtrack Awards to jazz @ the movies. Each year, we produce a compilation album with the work of a film composer. Terence Blanchard is the biggest composer of jazz soundtracks from the past 20 years. Therefore, Film Fest Gent is joining forces with Mr Blanchard to bundle up the best of his jazzy film scores, from Mo Better Blues to Jungle Fever, from 25th Hour to Inside Man. The only thing we need to succeed in making this compilation, is your support!

 

About Us 

Launched in 2001 by Film Fest Gent, the World Soundtrack Awards aim to organise and oversee the educational, cultural and professional aspects of the art of film music, including the preservation of the history of the soundtrack and its worldwide promotion. We believe film music deserves appropriate recognition for its integral role in filmmaking.

The World Soundtrack Awards 2017 are a two-night event with jazz music as its central theme. On October 18, there will be an Awards Gala with a concert of contemporary jazz scores performed by Brussels Philharmonic & Brussels Jazz Orchestra conducted by Dirk Brossé. That night, Terence Blanchard will play scores you can find on the album live with the orchestra. The second night, October 19, will include a trip through 100 years of jazz at the movies with clips from The Pink Panther, Chinatown, The Man with the Golden Arm, and many more.

Info & tickets World Soundtrack Awards Gala & Concert 18/10/2017
Info & tickets for Symphonic Jazz Concert  19/10/2017 

Take a look at the World Soundtrack Awards 2016

 

Why you should back us

Each year we release an exclusive compilation where we bring the best of a composer’s work in film to life with the help of the acclaimed Brussels Philharmonic conducted by Maestro Dirk Brossé. This way, we can create a unique album with outstanding performances where we can focus on the whole of a composer’s most important work in film instead of just one film or television series, an absolute scoop! For this year’s album, Terence Blanchard’s film scores will be recorded by a full symphonic & jazz orchestra.

You can bring Terence Blanchard's jazzy scores to your ears by backing this crowdfunding campaign. The album will completely dedicated to Mr Blanchard’s film music oeuvre. In total, we need €10.000 to pay the conductor, orchestra, studio and lots of other things, but every donation counts!

If you become part of our backing club you can receive numerous perks. The more money we collect, the better we can make the album: extra soloists, different instruments, more songs, etc. The extra's will rise with the amount we raise, so don’t hesitate and back our crowdfunding.


About Terence Blanchard

World-renowned trumpeter/composer/band leader and Blue Note recording artist Terence Blanchard is considered the most prolific jazz musician to ever compose for motion pictures. He began performing in the Lionel Hampton Orchestra. Two years later, he succeeded Wynton Marsalis in the legendary Jazz Messengers before forming his own influential groups.

As a film composer, Terence Blanchard is most known and admired for his unique collaboration with director Spike Lee that started in 1991 and includes Mo Better Blues, Malcolm X, Clockers, 25th Hour, Jungle Fever, Inside Man. His innovative approach to film scoring results in film music that can be gritty urban, but also heartfelt, richly emotional or low key. Sometimes there’s a blues sensibility at work but his jazz-flavoured arrangements also express a sense of anguish.


What's in it for YOU

There are some pretty cool perks, like a MEET & GREET with Mr. Blanchard himself, a DUO VIP-ticket for the 17th World Soundtrack Awards Gala & Concert, your name on the thanks page of the album, a hotel stay, attending the World Soundtrack Awards Rehearsal, attending a recording session for the album, and MANY MORE! 

Look at the perks for more information!

Our backers will be awarded regularly with some cool news, gadgets and surprises! #staytuned

story:
Hi!

Hey!
We are Ru (Berlin-based Swedish musician) and Carlos Vin Lopes (Berlin-based Brazilian film director).
We decided to create two visual music projects in the middle of an island in Germany.
Two music videos for the first two songs of Ru's debut EP: https://soundcloud.com/soundsofru were made with the director, Carlos, who is one of the founders of the Film Collective The Worldrooms based in Berlin.
We would like to create a beautiful visual experiment on this amazing island together with some really good people, and then share it with you.

Step by Step

Step by step we would be able to create this experiment far away from our home in Berlin.

3000€

So, if we reach 3000€, we could pay for:
- Equipment (We need to rent some equipments)
- Transport to the Island (We need to rent a van and fuel it to the island)
- Pay our crew (We need to pay the time dedicated by our team)
- Post Production (After shooting the video, there is a process called "Color Grading" and we need to do it)

 

What You get

6 exclusive types of Big Posters created by the director and graphic designer Carlos Vin Lopes + Physical CD + Small rock from the island + Be in the shooting with us on line + House Concert

 

Nice to meet you!

And Thank you so much!

So, if we reach 3000€, we could pay for:- Equipment (We need to rent some equipments)- Transport to the Island (We need to rent a van and fuel it to the island)- Pay our crew (We need to pay the time dedicated by our team)- Post Production (After shooting the video, there is a process called "Color Grading" and we need to do it)
 What You get


6 exclusive types of Big Posters created by the director and graphic designer Carlos Vin Lopes + Physical CD + Small rock from the island + Be in the shooting with us on line + House Concert
 
Nice to meet you!
And Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Enny Owl and I'm a British indie folk singer songwriter based in Los Angeles. I started writing music at the age of eleven and have since gone on to develop my atmospheric sound. People have said that my music soothes and lifts the soul. With the release of my first album, "Scented Cigarettes," I plan to share this experience with a wider audience. 

My goal for The Naked Heart Tour is to share my music with more people and inspire other independent artists. There will be two people joining me on this tour who also share this goal.

We will not only be traveling to 19 different cities, but performing in all of them. 

  • Phoenix, AZ  |  6/27  
  • Grand Junction, CO  | 6/28
  • Denver, CO  |  6/29
  • Sioux Falls, SD  |  6/30
  • Yankton, SD  |  7/1
  • Iowa City, IA  | 7/2
  • Chicago, IL  |  7/3
  • Grand Rapids, MI  |  7/4
  • Cleveland, OH  |  7/5
  • Indianapolis, IN  |  7/6
  • St. Louis, MO  |  7/7
  • Kansas City, MO  |  7/8
  • Omaha, NE  |  7/9
  • Fort Collins, CO  |  7/11
  • Salt Lake City, UT  |  7/12
  • Boise, ID  |  7/14
  • Portland, OR  |  7/15
  • San Francisco, CA  |  7/17
  • Los Angeles, CA  |  7/18

Your contribution will get us to all of the venues safely and sanely. Your funding will also allow us to document the whole experience to later share at a film festival. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the budget breakdown for our goal of $10,000. We have calculated everything carefully so you know exactly where your money goes. 

  • Campervan Rental  |  $5,000
  • Gas & Mileage  |  $2,500
  • Sound & Camera Equipment  |  $1,500
  • Campground Fees  |  $500
  • Groceries  |  $500

Prizes

With donations comes prizes!

  • $10  |  Stickers
  • $20  |  Signed CD
  • $50  |  Signed CD  + Tee Shirt
  • $100  |  Signed CD  + Tee Shirt  +  Personal Letter
  • $500  | Signed CD  + Tee Shirt  +  Personal Letter  + YouTube Shoutout
  • $1,000  |  Signed CD  + Tee Shirt  +  Personal Letter  +  Personal Concert & Song

*All contributors will be included in the end credits of the documentary

These amounts are just a guideline. If you donate an amount that isn't listed, you will still be rewarded. Every donation is appreciated. Donate what you can. 

All funds raised will go towards making this summer's tour and documentary a reality even if  goal isn't fully reached. 

The Impact

Your contribution is the difference between us being squished together with our equipment in a mini copper or breathing as we drive across the country. 

This documentary aims to inspire other dreamers and your contribution would play a valuable part in making that possible. This will be a first time experience for me and the two artists coming along. We are all teaching ourselves to go after our aspired goals and to encourage others to do the same. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with people who believe in the importance of supporting the indie community. Every little helps :)

Another way to be a part of this experience is to show up for the events or even host a show!

https://www.ennyowl.com/tour

I hope to meet some of your lovely faces while on the road this summer!

story:
Hey everyone! My name is Danielle. I founded and produce First Festival (with a little help from some good friends). The 1st three years have been funded by ticket sales and vendor booths, but it was always my intention to make the festival FREE for everyone to attend. This campaign will help do that and I'm so excited to finally fulfill that mission. 

This campaign is not only important to me, it's important to the community-- to the artists, to the musicians, to the comics, to everyone! First Fest celebrates the local arts scene in a way that hasn't been done in our community prior. It creates a platform for local artists to reach audiences that they would never have access to otherwise. But, most importantly, it shows Sacramento all of the home grown talent that exists right here in our region. First Fest proves that local talent can support a weekend long music festival. 

Festivals are expensive.  We've built the foundation over the last three years and now it's ready to go out to the community in exchange for an epic weekend that doesn't cost a dime for those who attend. We're in this together and I know we'll come out on top. I believe in us.  

 

What We Need & Where It's Going:

 

 

I know what you're thinking. $60,000 is A LOT of money. You're right. It is. But this is what it's taken each year to fund the festival. It's been done through ticket sales, vendor booths, up-selling, credit cards, trading, in-kind donations, loans-- you name it. For the 4th year, we need to look at other options.

 In 2017 we had over 3,000 people come through over the weekend. If each of those people donated $20, then this entire campaign would be funded. That's not too bad-- especially with perks at every donation level!

We've built this festival from the ground up doing everything it takes to create a solid, reliable foundation. Everything has been done in-house to push every dollar as far as it can go. Nothing is spent without critical evaluation. The same will go for these funds. Money will be spent critically and carefully. Every dollar will be respected.

First Fest's Community Impact:

First Fest is the first and only strictly local regional music festival in Sacramento. Our mission is to give local artists and musicians a platform to showcase their projects in a festival-venue. In 3 years, we've showcased nearly 100 local bands spanning all genres. We've showcased a ton of local artists from all backgrounds and who use all different mediums. In 2017 we introduced local comedy into the lineup, highlighting 10 local comedians, including a popular podcast. We have seen nearly 200 vendors come through over the years including crafters, artists, makers, designers, local business, food trucks, food vendors, interactive booths-- you name it! Over the last 3 years we've featured over 100 different local beers on tap from local breweries-- vote on what we pour next year!

First Fest is about community first and foremost. We aren't funded and we aren't run by a corporation. We crowd source ideas and let the community vote on the beer selection and activities. We curate First Festival with Sacramento in mind alongside Sacramento. Always have and always will. Pre-fund with us and help keep First Festival alive in the Sacramento community for the year to come. 

 

Risks & Challenges

What happens if this campaign doesn't fund? Well, its likely that First Fest as we have come to know it may not happen. This fundraiser is critical. We can't financially support the event at the risk of our family and friends again. It's a hard truth we have to face and we're being 100% transparent. First Fest has always paid its bills. We've paid every artist contracted for payment on time and in full. We don't leave people high and dry and we honor our word. Always have and always will, no matter what. 

So, if it doesn't fund enough, we'll throw the best party we can with what we have. It might be one day. It might be one stage. It might only be an evening. We REALLY hope we can throw the biggest First Fest yet, but it's all a numbers game. We will do something with whatever we raise, but we REALLY hope that it's another epic First Fest. I'm willing to put in the work if you're willing to help get us there. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Share this campaign. But most importantly, write something telling your friends why it's important. Create a call to action. Tell 'em why it's important to you. 

We love you Sacramento. Thank you for showing up. See you at the park!

story:
Hello everyone who loves art, music and beauty in the world. We would like to ask for your help in the realization of our first crossover album. We first met two years ago in the middle of the Ocean, on board the Luxury Silvesea Cruise Line, and from the first  duet we sung we understood that our voices and our souls were meant to be together.

We realized that we have a lot in common. First of all the passion for musical theater and two typical Italian dramatic voices. So we decided to create original shows together, among which we would like to mention: Teatro dell’opera (a selection of famous opera arias and duets), Il bel canto (a 3 tenor’s inspired show), Mi noche de tango (a tribute to the argentine tango), Made in Italy (songs of the Italian tradition). Our show’s aim is to bring the classical music to the big audience through our typical Italian theatrical passion.

Following the suggestions of many of our lovely fans, we would like to take the next step for our duo and explore the new crossover’s world combining opera and cinema in a CD of  duets from movie’s sound tracks.

 

LUCIA AND GIOVANNI

Lucia Conte and Giovanni Palminteri  both have extensive experience in classical musical theatre and television.

Lucia, opera trained soprano, from the little ‘heel’ of Italy, is the winner of international opera competitions including “Spiros Argiris” in Sarzana and “Rosetum” in Milan. She performed operatic leading roles in many Italian, European and Asian theatres, including Il Barbiere di Siviglia, Don Giovanni, La Bohème, L’Elisird’Amore, La Traviata, Rigoletto, Nabucco.

Giovanni, opera trained tenor from Sicily has a varied career to date, including performances in  Opera Houses worldwide. He sang for important operatic and jazz festivals and events and in the Italian television. He has been company production manager on board Silversea Cruises Ltd.

HOW CAN YOU HELP US?

Your contribution is very important for the realization of this project because the costs of the production of an album are very high. We have set our funding goal at $15,000, that we will use for:

- Production of a videoclip

- Contruction of our website

- Marketing and commercial on internet and press office

- Production of original tracks + recording and mixing in studio with live orchestra

- Album design

 

We are making an effort to produce our cd by ourselves with an independent label, but this will be possible just with your help

 

WHY MAKE A DONATION?

All this kind of artistic jobs are about passion, that’s why we decided to call ourselves Passione.

This is the real meaning of life for us, and passion for us is Music, the universal language that goes beyond any obstacles, any cultural difference. We feel very lucky to have been performing for some of you and we want to try to express what we have inside with this new project.

We hope that if you have ever enjoyed one of our performances, you will consider donating to help us and keep a little piece of our heart with you forever. <3 <3 <3

story:
Short Summary

Our story goes back to 2006 when I met my dear friend Magnus Reymert. We were studying music together at two Conservatories in the Netherlands and at that time we couldn’t imagine that in a few years time our paths would lead us to this amazing opportunity:

Joining both our orchestras together for an ultimate cooperation: Il Giardino d’Amore Orchestra from Vienna / Krakow and NOR 59 Youth Orchestra from Oslo. This meeting of two orchestras and exchange of two worlds is very energetic, exciting, full of new discoveries, exceptional, and to put it in one word I would say it’s simply: MYTHICAL! ;) Four years ago Magnus invited me to Oslo for the first time to meet the teenagers and kids from his orchestra. Since then we started working together intensively with our common goal and dream to awake sensitivity for art, especially music in young peoples hearts and to make classical music an important part of their existence. At this time it is not a simple task although we are going “like a storm”!

A multicultural exchange such as this particular one gives amazing, incomparable advantages to these young musicians who will gain their experience and develop opportunities to enter the professional music world, which for many others is still closed at their age. This interaction is very powerful, because it’s based on unconditional love for music, friendship, trust, communication, and quality time in discovering art.

Now we would love to give the result of our cooperation as a gift to the world! It’s comprised of our hard work and unstoppable passion. This recording would express this very unique moment of our lives, and will stay as a memory forever.

EVERYTHING IS POSSIBLE WITH YOUR SUPPORT.

This album titled the MIDSUMMER NIGHT’S DREAM will be your excellent companion during long summer starry nights, and will load you with positive energy on cold winter mornings. It will be professionally produced by our sound engineer in Krakow and planned to be released this Autumn.

With YOUR support we are able to make this unique project come true and you will be a fantastic ambassador for us! Joining a diverse group of musicians from multiple countries to create something unforgettable is simply priceless! Therefore with our deepest gratitude we would love to offer you something in return for your heart warming support:

-    Tickets for one of our concerts,

-    A signed physical copy of our album,

-    A private concert,

-    Check out some more of our incentives below

BUDGET: Why do we need 10,000$?

Here are the things that we need to pay to make this release happen:

-    Studio 3 Days + top sound engineer from France: 2.500$

-    Mixing + Mastering: 1.500$

-    All Artwork Design: 500$

-    CD Printing: 2.000$

-    Rewards making (video + shipping of the CD’s): 500$

-    Travel costs (flights): 3.000$

PERKS: What do YOU get?

The perks (or rewards) of this crowdfunding campaign are divided into separate options based on how much you contribute.

-    $15 perk: Digital Download on release date

-    $25 perk: Physical album including shipping

-    $35 perk: Signed album including shipping

-    $50 perk: 2 free concert tickets + meet and greet with musicians + signed album

-    $100 perk: Music Lesson with Stefan, Magnus or one of our orchestra members (it can be violin, viola, cello, double bass lesson ) + a Signed album

-    $150 perk: 2 hours of Music Lesson + a Signed album

-    $250: Your (company) name printed in our Album with a special Acknowledgement + Signed album + Free concert tickets (2x)

-    $1.000 perk: Private concert by Il Giardino d’Amore Orchestra at your location (excluding travel costs)

-    $1.000 perk: Private concert by NOR 59 Orchestra at your location (excluding travel costs)

-    $1.500 perk: Private concert, Your (company) name printed in the Album with special Acknowledgement + Signed album

-    $5.000 perk: Hand Made new Violin made by our beloved violin maker - Luthier, Adam Bartosik with the special dedication written inside of the instrument.

-    $10.000 perk: Private concert by both Orchestras at your location + 200 albums (which can be used as presents for your employees/friends/relatives)

story:
The Story...

Brooklyn, New York, September of 2015; a Minneapolis-bred rapper, having just moved to NYC after a year in residence at a yoga retreat center meets a veteran NYC funk/jazz singer from a family of skilled professional artists. The two discover a shared appreciation of New Orleans-style funk and hip-hop.  They decide to build a community on dance, mindfulness, inclusive and diverse community, conscious culture, and 'parties-with-a-purpose' in the form of a high-quality live band called Big Village Little City.

Since we set out to make BVLC a reality, we've gathered an incredibly talented tribe of musicians, hosted some beautiful live music experiences, and many amazing things have begun to happen, including - of course - some awesome music. The next few steps are looking even more promising, but we'll need your help in order to make them happen!

Our song Snake Oil will be the first BVLC track to get the official music video treatment. The video plan is already mapped out, and the filmmaker is confirmed, but in order for the video to look the way we hope, we need your help taking care of the production expenses.

Snake Oil is the perfect introductory track to Big Village Little City; shining light on human's desire to find the mysterious secret recipe that contains the remedy for all of life's sufferings. In truth, the medicine (read: "funk") is the freedom we already have to celebrate, dance, and join in community with those around us.

We will be touring around the northeast US in June, between performing at Wanderlust festivals. This adventure will be called BVLC's Snake Oil Tour, because it is the first time we'll be able to bring the unique, healing 'medicine' that we offer through music and community to folks that live outside of the greater NYC area. Please help us make this tour happen! We are being as strategic as possible with our travel plans, but carting eight people around the country is no small feat no matter who you are.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Video Expenses:

  • Paying our incredibly skilled filmmaker/director
  • Renting an outdoor space in Brooklyn  to shoot the main scene of our video
  • Set pieces
  • Food & refreshments for production crew, performers, and extras

Tour Expenses:

  • A rental car (one of our two vehicles will be a rental)
  • Gas
  • Food for the band
  • Shelter for the band on nights that we're not already accounted for
  • Promotion for our non-festival shows

What You Get:

Big Village Little City will be releasing three 3-song EPs this Summer, which you could be the first to hear! Plus, in addition to band T-shirts, merch, music, and exclusive content...

...the individual members of BVLC possess a cavalcade of resources to exchange for your donation, including personal, group, or digital yoga sessions with Forefeather (Kripalu Certified E-RYT 200)...

Personal voice coaching sessions with Amy Grace...

Access to more than three album's worth of solo Forefeather music, custom-made songs or beats,  yoga music mixes, etc...

Why Contribute?

Between an official music video, three EPs, the opportunity to perform at each of the east coast Wanderlust festivals, and a handful of upcoming press nods, this summer with be a huge wave for Big Village Little City. After their first performance (at Brooklyn's House of Yes) on April 16th, 2016, BVLC is barely a year into it's life and it's been going great so far. You could be one of the first to have supported this up-and-coming Brooklyn band that has very, very bright things in its future!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please know that if you can only contribute five dollars, you're still hugely helping us reach our goal! Either way, one of the best things you can do to help is to share this campaign. Remember that IndieGoGo has a number of built-in sharing tools that you can make use of. Also, any time you comment on this campaign, you help us up its visibility. That means, if you've got something to share, please do! Let us know if you have ideas for us moving forward! Let us know what you think of the music so far! Let us know if we should come play a show in your town!

story:
Dear Beautifully Mad Friends, 

We are very excited to be making a new album Silhouette

We have released 10 albums so far including our solo projects but we're also sad that this will be our last Beautifully Mad album. 

The realities of music streaming mean that we can no longer recoup the costs of making an album and we simply can't afford to subsidize them in future on musicians wages that haven't gone up in 30 years (yes you heard right :-)

So this will be our final album. 

Having said that, we are very excited about the songs we have written over the last 2 years & have some wonderful musicians performing on it already & more to come, so we're inviting you to join us one more time on this last creative journey together.

We will make this album a limited edition CD with all the lovely artwork & lyrics because we are romantic fools & it is a labour of love. 

However, we can only make this album with your help. 

We have a list of perks on this fundraiser, which is basically a range of stuff you get for contributing. 

So we are not asking for a donation, you will actually get something for your money ranging from CD's, Digital Downloads, Artwork, we will do gigs for you & even write or record songs for you. The list goes on, so please check the fun list of perks. 

So in effect, you become a midwife birthing this baby into existence. 

We are aiming to raise $8,000 to cover most of the costs of the whole project.

This covers the artwork, printing, pressing, musicians, recording, mixing and mastering. 

To put your mind at ease, unlike some Crowd Fundraisers, we WILL make this album even if we don't reach our target (I will just have one less kidney, Nina will put her name down for medical experiments and we will have to sleep on pillows filled with lint from our clothes dryer :-) but don't worry, your contribution WON’T  fall on fallow ground.

We realize you may not be in a position to contribute financially in which case all we ask is that you spread the word & make heaps of noise about this project to people you think would be interested  and may be able to contribute. That is a huge contribution and we thank you for it!!There are indiegogo share tools on our campaign page.

If you are new to our music, you can catch up by going to www.beautifullymad.com

For anyone without a paypal account you can contribute directly by bank transfer. Just tell us which perk you want by email (tonykris@bigpond.net.au) and leave your name as a reference on the transfer :-) Our details are:

Credit Union Australia

 Account name  Moonlight cactus Music 

BSB: 814282

Account number: 10159962

We hope you can help us on this Beautifully Mad journey. Here is a sample of one of the songs written by both of us for our new album Silhouette. It is entitled Frida and is about the challenging life of the brilliant Mexican painter Frida Kahlo.

https://youtu.be/sJxbd2_OLEg

story:
Help Bryan Duncan complete an album, by clicking here, featuring new songs like Remember My Mother and I Will Shine, and new arrangements of some classic Bryan Duncan songs. You can no longer contribute using this page, which expired on July 12, but can help by clicking here.

When you support this campaign, you're not just buying music. You're investing in the impact that you believe we can have, and in the lasting value of the songs that will come from our musical journey together. 

We've included some basic rewards, like digital downloads and CDs, but we're recommending you choose the amount of support you want to provide and then select a Custom Reward Package that matches that amount. You can choose the level of support you want to provide and then work with us to create a Custom Reward Package that's right for you. We're happy to include the specific digital albums, CDs, and DVDs that you want but can also include things like concerts, personal appearances, help with your project, tributes to a loved one, a photo or video session, handwritten lyrics, special videos, your name in the album credits, and album release parties in your town, for instance. Let's get creative and design a perk that's perfect for you. Not sure what you want? We've got lots of creative ideas for perks besides the ideas noted here. Contact Christopher Redner or call 253-874-8400 to discuss your reward.

If you already know you want to help make this album happen, click the "Back It" button or the perk you want. Check them out over there and scroll down to see the various options. -->

You'll find lots more information, and videos with songs and stories below.

Please share this page with your friends and choose the level of support that's right for you.

 
We're experienced at producing quality crowdfunded albums. We're very pleased with how Conversations and The Live Experience turned out and by the wonderful response to them from listeners. We'll apply everything we've learned to the new album.
 
 
 
We share early versions of songs in Bryan Duncan's private forum and his Soul Furnace email reports. For instance, here's the story behind I Will Shine. Here's the first day of co-writing with Scott Krippayne. This is the early demo of the song and here's a later demo as the arrangement of the song progresses.
 
Here's Bryan talking about early reactions to Remember My Mother. Here's a demo of the song.
 
Backers of this campaign will receive a membership to Bryan Duncan's private forum and his Soul Furnace Reports.
 
About I Will Shine

Demo Of I Will Shine

About Remember My Mother
Demo Of Remember My Mother
 

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I support this project without having an Indiegogo account?

Yes. You can support this project with our without selecting a reward.

Can I support this project without having an Indiegogo account?

Yes, you can give directly using a check, credit card, PayPal, etc. and you can choose any of the perks listed here or a custom reward for your support. Call 253-874-8400 or contact Christopher Redner for details. 

What other kinds of custom perks/rewards are available?

Let's get creative and design a perk that's perfect for you. Almost anything is an option. We're happy to include the specific digital albums, CDs and DVDs that you want but can also include things like concerts, personal appearances, help with your project, tributes to a loved one, a photo or video session, handwritten lyrics, special videos, your name in the album credits, and album release parties in your town are just some of the options available. Call 253-874-8400 or contact Christopher Redner for details. We're happy to work with you to design a reward package you'll love.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Downloads, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something. However, if you get multiple CDs together you'll save on the CDs and the shipping. You can choose all CDs that are available now or wait and have all your CDs ship when the new album is done.

How can I connect with Bryan Duncan, and get more information about his music, etc.?

If you back this project you'll receive his Soul Furnace Reports and an invitation to a private forum. Both contain lots of behind-the-scenes stories, information, and the opportunity to connect with Bryan Duncan directly. People who are interested in Bryan but not ready to back this project are invited to get his newsletter here.

Can I give an album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message using the contact link or send a message on Facebook.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

If you choose a perk that's available now, you'll receive it within two weeks of when this campaign closes. If you choose a perk that includes the new album, you'll receive them when the album is completed.

How can I help with this campaign?

You can back this campaign and share this page. Any comments you post here also help raise the profile of this page. You can also send me a message here if you'd like to be added to the Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

Why don't I hear your songs on the radio much?

Why can't I find your albums in stores?

story:
The Overview:

I need your help to finish my next recording during the first half of 2017. It will be a 6 or 7 song EP titled "Threaded"!  In this project the goal is to push the envelope a little further and to exceed that which was released on Causality back at the end of 2014. I couldn't be more excited about this next collection of material and I want to bring it to your ears at the highest quality possible as you deserve no less! I am forever grateful to those who have stood by me through the years, even in the most terrible times of self-doubt, and I carry that with me each and every day. To put it as bluntly as possible I don't want to give them crap, they really do deserve the best possible recording! 

A sample from the upcoming release:

https://soundcloud.com/jeremygilchrist/endless-war-studio

The Plan:

  • The goal has been set at a lofty $3800 but in the recording world that is  pretty modest. To complete the EP as planned, I estimate a cost of $2500 or so to cover the remaining recording time needed with 2 songs already essentially completed at Hollow Body Studios (http://www.hollowbodystudios.com/), and to cover press/CD duplication costs. The remaining $1300 will be used to help record three pro shot and edited live songs as videos at Beehive productions (http://www.beehivepro.com/)
  • If the full goal to finish the record is not reached I will do all I can with what is given to first and foremost complete the EP, that is a must. If the amount exceeds $2500 but does not reach the full $3800 I will hold what is leftover and keep working to reach the amount required to record at Beehive. 

The Impact:

  • This project. as mentioned, will result in the best documentation of my music to date, and likely exceed prior efforts.
  • This project will be my best opportunity to reach wider audiences and to new ears via airplay on radio and online. 
  • Most importantly, I feel this recording will be something longtime friends and fans will enjoy for years to come. There is no greater accomplishment for a creator than when someone connects with your art at the deepest possible level. 

The Challenges: 

With every project comes challenges that can lead to setbacks and delays, but failure only comes when you give up.  My promise to you is that I will never give up! I will be fully open with the progress being made and provide as many updates as I possibly can. It should be understood that expected dates of release are always tentative until I actually receive the final physical copies in hand.  If a concern arises feel free to contact me about it! 

Finally: Spreading the Word is Vital:

  • I can post word of this campaign to social media until I am blue in the face, but this effort won't succeed without your help! Share it anywhere and everywhere! Indiegogo provides tools to share that make this very easy!  Even if you are unable to donate, a share can make a world of difference! 
  • Please know that regardless of he outcome of this campaign, I am forever grateful and thankful to everyone who supports me!

story:
We are classical musicians from Vienna (Emanuel Schulz: conductor & composer, Elisabeth Schulz: pianist, cellist & singer). Beside our classical concerts we also do intercultural projects and workshops of indian & western music therapy. For many years we are also composing spiritual and meditative pop music. At the moment we are producing our first Album of 11 songs. With our music (especially the vocal harmonies) we want to express the quality of the sacred feminine, a hidden and often forgotten quality. The songs should give comfort to people in difficult times (f.e. after a loss of a beloved person) and create a meditative mood. 
The Album is inspired by and dedicated to Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi. 

We need your support for the studio costs (studiotime, sound engineering, mastering and mixing of the songs) and the production of the CDs. Studio costs are about 7000 Euro and production of CD is about 1500 Euro.

For only 2€ you receive 1 digital song, for 10€ we will send you 6 digital Tracks and If you donate 15€ you will receive a digital copy of the full Album before the CD is released.

If you donate 20€ we send you the standard package of the CD per post at the beginning of december (before christmas).

For 60€ you get 1 CD and a private singing or piano lesson. 

For 100€ you get a CD and a private music therapy session (western and indian music therapy). 

For 100€ you get a CD and a private session "we show you how to compose your own song". 

For 95€ you receive 5 CDs and for 200€ we send you 10 CDs per post before christmas.

For 1000€ we will make a private concert for you (3 singers, keyboards,guitar and percussion) and you receive 10 Cds.

If you can not support us financially, you can still help us by telling others about our campaign or sharing our link at the social medias.

Thank you.
story_txt: We are classical musicians from Vienna (Emanuel Schulz: conductor & composer, Elisabeth Schulz: pianist, cellist & singer). Beside our classical concerts we also do intercultural projects and workshops of indian & western music therapy. For many years we are also composing spiritual and meditative pop music. At the moment we are producing our first Album of 11 songs. With our music (especially the vocal harmonies) we want to express the quality of the sacred feminine, a hidden and often forgotten quality. The songs should give comfort to people in difficult times (f.e. after a loss of a beloved person) and create a meditative mood. The Album is inspired by and dedicated to Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi. We need your support for the studio costs (studiotime, sound engineering, mastering and mixing of the songs) and the production of the CDs. Studio costs are about 7000 Euro and production of CD is about 1500 Euro.For only 2€ you receive 1 digital song, for 10€ we will send you 6 digital Tracks and If you donate 15€ you will receive a digital copy of the full Album before the CD is released.If you donate 20€ we send you the standard package of the CD per post at the beginning of december (before christmas).For 60€ you get 1 CD and a private singing or piano lesson. For 100€ you get a CD and a private music therapy session (western and indian music therapy). For 100€ you get a CD and a private session "we show you how to compose your own song". For 95€ you receive 5 CDs and for 200€ we send you 10 CDs per post before christmas.For 1000€ we will make a private concert for you (3 singers, keyboards,guitar and percussion) and you receive 10 Cds.If you can not support us financially, you can still help us by telling others about our campaign or sharing our link at the social medias.Thank you.

story:
"The world needs to hear this music" - Alan Jones

Hello, this is Julie Amici. I have been collaborating with my partner Dean Mueller for the past couple years performing with some of the Northwest's finest musicians. While we have garnered great success, we have always had our eye on creating our own music, our own sound, and our own voice. I am asking for your help to bring our art to the world, and by turning dreams into reality, make the world a better place.

Please choose a reward to the right and become a backer today!

The birth of a song, and a dream

On a trip back to my childhood home last year, I started channeling melodies and lyrics inspired by the place I was raised. The home I grew up in had burned down, but the memories and dreams remained. When I returned from the trip, I started working with Dean on developing this original material. After working together for a couple of months, we enlisted the help of our longtime friend and mentor, Alan Jones, to further develop the songs. Alan offered to produce the music, scheduled the studio time, and in July we started long hours of studio work.

This project turned into an exciting adventure that far exceeded our expectations. Originally, we planned to record some covers; our typical jazz and blues repertoire. But, we were thrilled when we started writing our own music, because it was naturally flowing straight from the heart. We ended up with something completely a blend of our roots in jazz, blues and country, influenced by our own personal stories. Or how Alan puts it: "The lyrics are great, and the music is an authentic expression of a snapshot of American tradition" 

It's time to show the world our music

The video above features our first single called "Yellow Roses," which is being released mid-October. It also shows footage from the music video to be released later this year. We are asking for your help to fund the production of the 5-song EP and the music video. We have set our goal for $8,500, but we hope to raise more so we can complete an entire album! But for now, first things first, help us meet our goal!

Please choose a reward to the right and become a backer today!

A call to action

The current state of the music industry is stacked against the independent musician. Writing, performing, booking, marketing, PR and the list goes on. Working on your own without label support makes it almost impossible to pull off projects without financial backing. Fortunately, the rise of crowdfunding provides an avenue for us to help raise the significant funds required to produce a world-class product.

With your backing we will pay for the musicians, producer, studio time, mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing, video production, marketing, PR, and legal fees required to produce, and promote, this project.

Please join us

This is a wonderful opportunity to share in our musical journey and to help us take our music to many more people and to enrich their lives. But there are other benefits for you as well, such as a digital download, the EP, VIP packages, a vacation stay, original artwork, or for us to perform at your event. It's a perfect time to arrange a holiday party or special event! You can make the ultimate commitment and have your name listed as executive producer for the EP or an upcoming music video.

Please choose a reward to the right and become a backer today!

Other ways you can help

Please SHARE with your friends, relatives, and on social media.

Thanks so much for your interest,

Julie & Dean

story:
Bonjour,

Je suis animateur et chroniqueur web. Étant donné que la majorité des grands médias délaissent les régions, j'ai eu l'idée de lancer une station radio internet afin d'aider au développement de ma région. En effet, très peu de couverture médiatique est offerte aux régions pour leurs activités ou leurs événements qui pourtant, sont fort intéressants. De plus, il est pratiquement impossible pour les petits commerçants indépendants de se faire connaître via ces médias dû au coup exorbitants de la production et de la diffusion de publicités.

J'adore ma région et je tient à ce qu'elle se développe et reste florissante, voilà pourquoi j'ai débuté ce projet. Votre contribution permettra de publiciser nos activités et nos événements , tout en permettant à nos petits commerçants de se faire connaître via nos ondes et notre site internet.

 

À quoi servira les fonds amassés?

Tout l'argent recueilli servira à assumer les frais de diffusion et de production pour une année complète. De cette façon, nous pourrons facturer des frais publicitaires très bas à ceux qui voudront ce faire connaître sur nos ondes. Même les plus petits commerçants auront la possibilité de s'offrir du temps d'antenne.  5000$ nous permet d'être en ondes pour au moins 6 mois.

 Quel sera l'impact de vos dons?

Bien que ce soit à petite échelle, vos dons permettrons de contribuer à la création ou au maintien d'emplois, au développement touristique et à faire connaître des artistes qui autrement, ne seront peut-être jamais entendu, malgré leur grand talent.

Le seul risque que vous courez, c'est de contribuer au développement de toute une communauté.

     

     

    Vous auriez aimé contribuer à notre financement, mais c'est impossible pour le moment? Donnez-nous un coup de main en partageant notre campagne de financement parmi vos contacts. Chaque petit geste compte pour nous. Vous pouvez dès maintenant nous écouter et vous abonner à notre site internet au www.radiomagogplus.com

    Merci

story:
Our Goals:

  • To introduce audiences to operatic gems - lesser known pieces of musical magic that deserve to be widely heard
  • To support a mix of  emerging and seasoned performers who form an collaborative artistic community
  • To share our work with the Boston area: performing in small, intimate venues, senior residences,  and schools; to spread the joy of music. We aim to lift the spirits of those in closed settings while exposing younger audiences to up-close and personal theater.
 

Our History

Executive Director Martha Birnbaum came up with the concept of an intimate, salon-like setting for lesser known operatic works. A meeting with soprano Caroline Spaeth, Artistic Administrator, at a Groupmuse Salon, led to a complete realization of this idea. Both knew that singers and audience loved the closeness and intimate connection with music and performers that a salon offers. And that atmosphere is what we will foster in The Cambridge Chamber Ensemble.

Who We Are

Caroline and Martha are both highly accomplished musicians and artisans. Caroline has performed as a soloist with such organizations as Masterworks Chorale, Calliope Music, the Miami Music Festival, and Longwood Opera. A budding graphic artist, her work is on display in our website, www.cambridgechamberensemble.org, and in the design of all promotional material including posters, ads, and publicity. Martha has performed in Lowell Opera and Opera Aperta, and has been stage director for Mass Theatrica. She has hosted musical salons at her home in Cambridge for many years and has recently been hosting GroupMuse events which are often a showcase for emerging local artists. An expert linguist, she has provided the production with original translations of both works. She also directed the Boston premiere of "A Game of Whist" in 2012, check out our gallery to see photos of her vision!

What We Do

CCE gives new young talent  just starting their careers the opportunity to perform with more seasoned artists. Mixing these forces rewards the audience with an entertaining combination of novelty and experience. For example, we recently presented a “sing-along” of Mozart’s “The Magic Flute.” Fourteen singers, from recent graduates to professional talent, were brought into Martha’s living room to sing an entire operatic role in a semi-staged production. It was a great success, and we plan on hosting more. Check out photos from this event in our gallery.

 

What We Need and What You Get

Our campaign target of $2000 will go toward our 1st production’s major expenses, the largest of which  is performance fees for 7 singers and two instrumentalists – a pianist and a violinist. Many  young companies do not pay their musicians, but we aim to provide our artists with a fully professional experience. These are among the most promising and finest performers in the Boston area, and they deserve the very best from our company. A smaller amount will be used to offset costume and prop expenses.

Other Ways you can Help

We would love your help, in both financial and non-financial ways. Pass along our Indiegogo campaign to your friends, and spread the word about our wonderful and exciting new opera company! No contribution is too small. If you cannot donate a dollar amount, tell your friends to buy  tickets (for only $15!) and come and enjoy two musically enchanting and hilarious operas.

story:
KIRSTEN VOGELSANG/cellist and composer -

completion fund for my third album GLOWING PRAYER

After graduating from Yale in 1984,  I immediately began my musical career composing music for high profile dance companies in NYC.  In 1990 I transitioned to LA after a residency at the Sundance Institute to work in the LA Film & TV Industry as both a coposer and recording cellist for the next 25 years.  

Simultaneously I continued my "own" work, completing 2 and now a 3rd "album" of my own music which infuses my classical background as a cellist with the world of electronica and film. 

I seek completion funding for my 3rd album which includes mastering and CD duplication.  This would mean so much as I have used the funds I have earned teaching and playing to record the 9 trax on this album.

I also seek assistance with marketing and artwork perhaps.

story:
Getting to know Azalea’s music is getting to know Benjamin and Mia Hackett, the husband and wife duo from Hamilton, Ontario. The way their voices blend together in song conjures an imagined romance, much like their own. Before they met, Benjamin and Mia worked hard at developing their craft but separately, each felt something was missing until one fateful songwriting session together led to the discovery that what they were missing was each other. Together, their sound has blossomed into the uniquely beautiful sound of Azalea. 

 

We have released three EP's and one single together, each project holding a special place in our hearts. However, we are most excited about this project (still to be titled) that will be released on June 16, 2017. 

 

The project will be a double album release - a fully produced studio album and an exclusive live concert recording. The album will have happy songs, and sad songs, songs that break your heart, and songs that take your broken heart and put it back together.

The new material was written and recorded with the usual homegrown heart and soul. Of course, this wouldn't be an Azalea album without love songs and two-part harmonies. “Gypsy-Americana” describes the remaining songs that combine North American folk traditions with Eastern European Gypsy vocal styles - think "The Civil Wars" meets the film "Once".

 

Our goal with this album is to spread our music further than before. So, apart from some final expenses that need to be covered (Mastering, replication, etc.), a large portion of the funds raised from this campaign will go towards a number of promotional strategies, i.e., radio and publicity campaigns, online ads, etc…

We've always felt called to make music and reach a bigger audience. So, the ability to run the promotional campaigns listed below, will put us in front of that audience. This will create a ripple effect that would see our music reach new heights! By contributing to this campaign you will in fact be helping to create a sustainable career for us, and give us lifelong opportunity in our creative endeavours.

 

We are looking to raise $20,000 CAD. Every dollar will be put to good use. Below is a list of items for which the money will be used:


Mastering - This gives our songs that extra pop & polish, and helps to unify the album.
Replication - Making the physical CD's
PR Campaigns: Radio, Print, Online, Publicity & Tour Promotion - This is how we reach that big audience we mentioned earlier!
Music Video - A special video for the album single.
Merchandise - T-shirts, Mugs, Buttons, and other fun stuff for you to enjoy.
Exclusive Live Concert Recording - A live recording of a special concert to be released to backers first! 
Graphic Design - The designers we work with express our music in visual mediums: CD Packaging, Pictures, Posters, Live Design, and Videos.
Studio Time - Our time in the studio to record and mix the songs.

 

We've come up with a number of fun perks for everyone who contributes to this campaign. It's our way of saying, "Thank you"!

Everyone who supports this campaign will receive a digital download of the "Exclusive Live Concert Recording". This will be a live & intimate concert we'll be recording in May, 2017.

Other perks include autographed CD's, T-shirts, Mugs, AzaleaGrams (we'll cover a song of your choice), and House Concerts (we'll play a concert in your living room or back yard). We'll even write you your own song!

Even if we raised part of our goal, we'd still be able to accomplish our goals, just on a smaller scale. 

 

Thank you so much for joining us on this journey. If you can contribute please do so now. Even if you can't support us monetarily, you can still help by sharing this campaign all over social media. Use the links near the top right of this page.

If you have any questions please email us - info@AzaleaMusic.net

 

With all our love and gratitude,

 

… Oh yea, our cats thank you too!
