Travel expenses, Food & SwedenWe’re going to be shooting out in the snow and will need hot food and drinks to keep our crew and band members morale strong.  In addition to this, a portion of our shoot takes place in Sweden, featuring the songs' mystery guest singer. With your help we can get there to make the most of their contribution by having them involved in the video. We will also need to reimburse crew travel costs and cover the little boring but important stuff like tape, batteries, stationary, hard drives.
FILM FESTIVALS & PROMOTION




This project is being supported by Man on Mars, a company that handles festival strategy and publicity for films creative video content. The project is being is being produced by it's founders and when the video is complete Man on Mars will be sending it to film festivals and trying to expand Pagliacci's global reach.


Please follow us on Facebook & Twitter to see the video when it comes out!



CAST & CREW BIOGRAPHIES
Zhivko Koev 
Zhivko is a Bulgarian composer, keyboardist and lyricist, foundingmember of the bands Pagliacci and Allegorist.

He started playing the piano at the age of twelve with the sole purpose of learning to compose his own music. Two years later he joined his first metal band.


Zhivko has been influenced by various genres including Prog-Rock, Gothic Metal, Symphonic Metal and Classical Music. He combines all of these influences (and more) in his original compositions.




Katerina Simeonova


Katya is a classically trained mezzo-soprano from Bulgaria.She also sings metal and alternative music. Katya started taking singinglessons at the age of 15 and has gradually focused her vocal studies in Chamber music.She sings in the metal bands Pagliacci and  Allegorist,  and hascollaborated with artists in different genres of Metal and Rock genres.
Anna Damaskova



Anna is a director and screenwriter from Bulgaria. She graduated fromher Bachelor in filmmaking from the Northern Film School, Leeds, UK.  Anna’s work extends to narrative short fiction genres and documentary.She is also a part of the creative network and film festival strategy company Man On Mars.
Simeon Chengelski
Simeon is a cinematographer from Bulgaria. He graduated from NuBoyana Film School - Movie Magic Made Real a part of the Nu BoyanaFilm Studios in Bulgaria. Simeon has worked on three feature films, a TVshow as well as on music videos and adverts. His cinematography isinspired by the landscape and natural light.
Gergana Lazarova-Runkel

Gery is a set and costume designer, currently in her last year of studying Scenography at the National Academy of Art, Bulgaria. 
She loves to experiment and lets herself be inspired in a different way, so she could find the best visual forms for every project.
Oliver Roberts 
Oliver is a producer from the United Kingdom. Graduating from the NFS with Anna Damaskova he has since continued to work with Anna and Nishad at Man on Mars, and is working on several fiction film productions and a feature documentary film.



Nishad Chaughule

Nishad is a Student Academy Award and a Royal Television Society Award winning producer based in the UK and India. He is the founder of Man on Mars and is working on various film projects with Oliver and Anna. He is also associated as a freelance producer with the independent studio Sikhya Entertainment, Mumbai.

story:
Hello fellow humans!

What is culture today?

We are going to travel from Aland Islands (Finland) to Benin (Africa) by car, taking us through close to 20 countries to find out! On our journey we will do workshops, concerts and basking. In this project we set out a quest to unite all cultures and religions using the power of music and creativity.

In whatever way your creative channels are flowing, be it music, dance, theater, paint, photo,video or any kind of art, please take part in our project. 

Join us and help us form a better future together. Through peace and artistic evolution we sow the seeds of the new world culture! 

Unite! Our new world culture is happening all around us!

World Crossing Cultures is a newly created project where we are rasing the question of what is culture today? Because of todays easy travelling and internet there is a big mix of cultures going on in the world. Everybody can hand pick their own culture from everywhere and create their own uniqe culture.

The first trip of this beautiful project is to cross the cultures between the Northern Lights of Europe and the Roots of Africa.
The plan is to go by car from Aland Islands in Finland down to Benin in Africa. On the way we will cross around 20 countries and in Europe we will make stops in most of the big citys to make performances and workshops. 

Creators of World Crossing Cultures are Alexander Sundman-Henriques and Georges Agbazahou. We are two multitalented artists who live for the creativity in all aspects of life!

Alexander comes from Aland Islands in Finland and is a flutist, drummer, dancer, healer and an artist in many other forms. He has travelled in many places of the world, such as India, Peru, Bolivia, Marocco and almost all the countries in Europe. He has a great passion for all the cultures in the world and a vision of uniting them all in himself and through oneself share it with the whole humanity!

Georges comes from Benin in Africa and has a life time of experience in many creative forms. He is a teacher and master of djembe drum, African dance choreography, art director, designer of batik and a puppeteer of traditional African marionettes. His education is from the Academy of traditional dance and percussion in Mali, Carrefur des Jeunes du Mali where he has received a Carte de member, the highest recommendation and recognition from the Academy. He has been educated in design and coloring of batik in Siguiri, Guinea, for Yann Montand, and his work has since 2000 been shown in festivals and fashion shows. His work has for instance been featured in the fashion magazine ”Amina” (april 2005) in Paris, France. He too have the vision of uniting all the cultures of the world and bring peace and harmony through all forms of creativity!

We begin our journey in the middle of November and gives it 4-6 weeks to arrive in Benin. So there is a lot of time on the way to jam and play with all the cultures and people we will be crossing. 

We will have daily updates on facebook and other social medias with videos and pictures so you can follow us and be a part of this amazing adventure and quest! 

Well down in Africa the second part of the project will be announced! There we will visit the great Voodou Festival and so much more adventure will come! But we will get back to you on that! ;)

Please visit our Facebook page World Crossing Cultures to see what we already have been doing and are preparing for the journey! 

What We Need & What You Get

In this whole project we have counted that we need around 11000€ and in that we have counted with electronic equipment such as a complete video camera gear for making documentary, electronical equipment for making a good street preformance with speakers and microphones, materials for workshops, a housetrailer to hook on the car so we have a place to sleep every night, gasoline for ca 9000km, roadtolls and visums, ferries and airplane tickets to fly back home to Finland.

BUT.. because of the time limit we have put and that we want to be in Benin for the new year to be able to be a part of the big Voodou Festival in the begining of January, We will put the time for this funding at 30 days but we will start the travel before with just a small amount of money that we already have and make street basking shows and be waiting for the funding to be ready. And we have reduced the original amount  of 11000€ to 5000€ just for the necessities like food, gasoline. roadtolls, ferries, visums and  a housetrailer for sleeping and living. This we did just to be sure that we can make the quest and arrive in Benin one way or another! With full funding we will be able to make a documentary on the phenomena of the New World Culture and that will also make better quality in our performances and workshops!

Since World Crossing Cultures is recently funded, we still have many more journeys and projects to come, this being the first of them. All the contributes will help maintain the vision for WCC and all our upcoming events. 

So if you fund us we will gladly come and make performances and workshops with you!

Please book us for performances for all ages and purposes. We also make workshops in djembe, African dancing, batik and marionette making.

Alexander Sundman-Henriques, cosmic.alex13@gmail.com +3584573449694 Georges Agbazahou, georges.agbazahou@googlemail.com +358445230471

Thank you for contributing!

All in One, One in All

story:
Performing with Salsabrosa


My Story

Have you ever had a dream that you held onto through every unexpected twist and bump in your life? Something that you loved with such an irrational passion that you sometimes wondered whether you were still entirely sane? Then you know how I feel about Cuban music. Something happened to me long ago and ever since I've been infected with this unquenchable thirst for the joyous rhythms of Cuban music, dance and culture. When I was 13 years old I promised myself that I would go to Cuba to study and now I'm thrilled to say that this promise is coming true. 


For those who don't know me, I'm a pianist, singer-songwriter and dancer from Northern Wisconsin. At age 14 I became a dedicated student of Latin pianist and educator Rebeca Mauleón-Santana in San Francisco and have continued to study Cuban music obsessively over the last eleven years. When I was 15 I started sneaking into clubs in the Twin Cities to sub as a pianist with every Latin band in town, including a group called Salsabrosa which I now direct and perform with full-time. At 17, I started my own band with some of the best Latin players in the cities. We toured a bit and made a CD called La Banda Nueva: Live at the Alvord. As a dancer, I've studied Afro-Cuban and salsa extensively and have been teaching and performing this style for about 10 years. I've been living in St. Paul, Minnesota since 2012 pursuing a degree at McNally Smith College of Music on a Presidential Scholarship and performing throughout the Midwest. 

Dancing with Yeniel "Chini" Perez at St. Paul Children's Festival

And now, after years of scheming, I'm finally putting all the pieces together and am going to La Habana, Cuba for 4 months this January. I will be studying music at the Instituto Superior de Arte, as well as taking private lessons in piano, singing, percussion, and dance. I've also been invited by Cuban Hip-Hop artist Yrak Saenz to collaborate with him recording a few songs at a studio in La Habana.

La Bodeguita del Medio in La Habana, photo by Bruno Rivera

My trip is aligning with a very important time in Cuban and American history. As an artist, I believe that sharing different cultures with mutual respect is one of the most valuable things you can do.  I’ve always dreamt of exploring the bridge between my passion for Cuban music and my own culture as an American, and this trip is the next step for me on this journey. 

The Breakdown

But I need your help to do it! It turns out staying alive for 4 months is really expensive. Especially when you're planning to study every day and have to travel across the globe to get there. Here's the breakdown of what I need to pay for:

Travel to and from Cuba  $1,600
Living expenses in La Habana for 4 months  $10,000
Classes at ISA  $2,000
Private lessons  $1,600
Concerts/shows  $1,600
Transport within the country  $3,000
15% of funds raised for IndieGoGo fees and perk fulfillment $3,800

Total: $23,600

To accommodate for the exchange rate to CUC and unforeseen expenses I have rounded up to $25,000.

If everyone gets super excited and we surpass our goal, every additional penny will go towards creating my next album upon my return to the States, which will focus on the integration of what I learned in Cuba with my own songwriting.

In the event that we don't reach our complete goal, my plan is to simply shorten the trip by whatever amount necessary.


Risks and Challenges


I'm going to let you guys in on a little secret: I'm terrified. 
I'm leaving behind everything I know that is comfortable. I will be speaking exclusively my second language in a foreign country for four months. I will most likely find myself feeling very alone at times. I will not have an address when I return home. But there's something sort of magical about looking down and feeling that fear and then... jumping. This is what I need to do. This is the next step, and I am going to live it with everything I have.

Of course there are the financial risks involved as well. What if I don't make enough money to pull it off? Or worse, what if I run out of money while I'm there and have to make an escape plan? These are all scenarios that I've imagined and planned ahead for. Then I put them away in a little box where I don't think about them at all because I want to focus on the good stuff. 

Because every hour of these next two months is precious. I've taken on a lot for a human. I'm finishing my degree at McNally Smith this semester, organizing all the details of my trip, and moving out of my apartment to become a nomad by Christmas. Sound crazy? Probably. But with your help, I can pull it off.

Can I just say this? Thank you. Thank you so much, even just for reading this far. For giving this a share on Facebook. For telling your friends. For contributing. It all adds up to form a web of support that means the world to me. I will not be alone in this, I know. I'm honored to share it with you.

story:
What is Angels' Share Glass?

Angels' Share Glass is a family glassblowing company based in Bridge of Allan, near Stirling. Created by Master Glassblower Thomas Young and his daughter Karen Somerville, the company produces handmade glass whisky gifts using traditional glassblowing techniques which Tom has perfected in a career spanning over 60 years, much of which involved the whisky industry.

Starting in 2013, the company has outgrown the temporary home studio which allowed us to grow this far and we now need to build a bigger one with updated equipment to allow us to meet demand for our products as well as create a place to train the next generation of glassblowers.

This studio will enable us to reach our full potential and provide the necessary space to tutor apprentices and keep the glassblowing craft alive.


Why Do We Need Your Help?

To build and kit out our new studio we need £25,000. This is broken down as follows:

  • Kiln £5000
  • Lathe £5000
  • Extraction system £5000
  • Glassblowing torches £1000
  • Glass polishing and cutting equipment £1000
  • Installation £3000
  • Legal and compliance £5000
In return for helping us achieve our goal we have several unique and special perks available as a way of showing our appreciation.
As we make all our products by hand we can create small runs of limited and special edition Angels and glassware as perks which will not be available to anyone outside of the crowdfunding campaign. Also, once we have our new completed studio, we will be able to have visitors and our top perk gives you the opportunity to spend the day with Tom learning the craft and creating your own pieces.
All funds raised, whether we reach our target or not, will go towards the build of our new studio. 

What Will This Means To Us?

This campaign is more than just helping a business to grow: it is essential to help us train new glassblowers and keep this traditional craft alive. The quality of our glassware is far greater than mass-produced products with each product being lovingly crafted and rigorously inspected before leaving the studio. We think it's important for this way of glassmaking to remain and we'll also be able to offer classes and training to the public.
Angels' Share Glass, in its short life so far, has won several business awards, including Co-Founder Karen Somerville winning Entrepreneur of the Year 2015. and our products are stocked across the globe from Canada to New Zealand.
Our current studio at Tom's house isn't set up for visitors or training. You can see the space we have at the moment in this video:

Can You Help in Other Ways?

We realise that not everyone will be able to contribute but there are other things you can do to help. Please share our campaign with all your friends and family.

There are Social Media links on the page which you can use to help get the word out. 

Thank you!

story:
What is light up north east?

Well i would like to start by introducing my self. My name is Marcus Stroud, i was born and raised right in Rockland County, NY. I have been to many parties in my life time and have always been business oriented and decided to put one and one together to make Light Up North East. 

Light Up North East is the ultimate party experience for anyone living in or around the states of NY, CT, PA, or NJ. We will rent out clubs, and open spaces for each event in any one of these states listed above and turn it into a party for anyone to attend.

What types of events will be hosted?

We will be hosting many events including:

  • Teens Night Out: A night of all different styles of music including Hip-Hop, EDM, and Reggae.

  • Glow Parties: Strictly EDM such as Future House, House, Trap, Grime and more.

  • Special Events: Events such as our up and coming End of School Bash and Memorial Night!
 

We are always looking for more events to have and better equipment to provide the best experience we can. We travel from town to town so that every one will get the chance to experience this wonderful event.

During each event we will also have water and other soft beverages sold for people to stay hydrated. Costs are lower then other venues ($2.00 bottle water, $3.00 soda)

We also want to give back so we will host many raffles, giveaways, and contests. These will sometimes be announced on the event page or only at the event.


Will this be safe for my 16 year old?

At any of these events there may be risk but we do try to minimize the risks involved and here's how.

We clearly outline our rules for each and every event, all of our events are alcohol and smoke free. We will have a dedicated security staff at each event and will be in contact with local police forces in the event someone is under the influence of any drug or alcohol. Each person will be searched upon entering the property for items that include but are not limited to bottles/containers (this includes both opened and closed), weapons, lighters, illegal substances and much more. 

Our events will all be insured to help cover any medical costs and or third party damage to the location. Intentional damage will be paid by the individual(s) who are responsible for it.

For more info on safety visit our Yapsody page here and view what the rules and regulations are for each event.

Our current state

We are in the middle of negotiations for land and buildings to use for our events. We

are lucky enough to have just gotten Event Insurance to help cover the costs of any injuries or damage to property. Our website is almost completed and will be posted on here the moment it is finished. With the help of Yapsody we have online ticket sales which can be printed out and bought with you, there are also promoter discount codes and ways for you to make money with us. We have an assortment of lights from black lights to strobe and shower lights. We also have over 6,000 Watts of sound including 2 way speakers,and only bass speakers.

 What else do we need and what is the challenge associated with each?

  • property and land 
We know that location rentals can be expensive so this is our main problem, we will be able to pay for them after our first event for sure, but until then we need a start up fund which is why we came here.

  • Promotions

We will promote our events but to do so will cost a small amount in paying for keeping the website up, paying for google ads, physical flyers to hand out to schools and friends to give to others.

  • Equipment

We currently do have a variety of speakers, turntables and lights to host a small event, we hope to host events with excess of 500 people in the future. What we need to purchase are ticket scanning devices (currently it is used off of mobile phones), barriers to set up stages and physical tickets for our promoters to sell in cash.

Members of our team


Who's involved?

  








             Marcus Stroud                                                      Cameron Peligri
                  DJ Mslay                                                             DJ Silent Noisez
                   Founder                                                                 Resident DJ


   
           





            Chris Stroud                                    Terrance Stroud
                 CFO                                                Head of Security

             Hakeem Jean
                DJ Keems
              Resident DJ

More members will be announced with updates to our campaign! We are looking to hire more Resident DJ's, and promoters!

What will my donation do?

Your donation will do many things for us that include:

       To start, it will help us purchase a preforming license from           both the BMI and ASCAP.



You will also help us cover the costs of Promoting all of our events to reach the largest amount of people we possibly can. This weekend we will purchase a Domain and release our website! We are planning to open it on Sunday so stay tuned to our updates page.

   This will help with purchasing Sound and Light equipment.


Lastly it will help us cover any trademarking and business costs!


Okay okay we know, you want specifics? Here you can see the sound and lighting equipment and exactly what we will be. purchasing:

We already have a 2x Rockville RPG 15inch, 2x 800Watt Bass speaker, Stands, Blacklight, Strobe light, Shower lights and proper wires. We also need:

            Seismic Audio Tremor 18' Sub x 4 = $1259.96




Mackie SRM650 15' Speaker x 3 = $2099.97





              Numark NV DJ Controller x1 = $699.00



American DJ Micro Galaxian Laser x2 = $155.98
(Red / Green)


     1 Eyourlife 10W DMX512 = $95.99





ADJ Products UV LED Bar20 x 2 = $594.96



Total Price: $4905.86


That is what we hope to buy and the order we plan to purchase the items in. These will be bought after the first location is set in stone. The location that we choose will be posted on our website and our events page. The other costs will be for different things such as location renting, promotional flyers, Web hosting and other low costs fees. We don't need these right away and will be bought over time to increase the sound performace and visual effects at each show.


What do i get back?

Well that's up to you! All perks are related to the other so at $10 level you get both the $5 perks and the $10 perks. $25 level gets you the $10 perks and the $5 perks as well. At the $50 level you only receive 3 free tickets, not 4.



Thank you guys for reading and if you have any questions or want more information feel free to message me here on indiegogo! I soon hope that we can party togeather!
story_txt:
What is light up north east?
Well i would like to start by introducing my self. My name is Marcus Stroud, i was born and raised right in Rockland County, NY. I have been to many parties in my life time and have always been business oriented and decided to put 
one and one together to make Light Up North East. 

Light Up North East is the ultimate party experience for anyone living in or around the states of NY, CT, PA, or NJ. We will rent out clubs, and open spaces for each event in any one of these states listed above and turn it into a party for anyone to attend. 


What types of events will be hosted?
We will be hosting many events including:
 
Teens Night Out: A night of all different styles of music including Hip-Hop, EDM, and Reggae.

Glow Parties: Strictly EDM such as Future House, House, Trap, Grime and more.

Special Events: Events such as our up and coming End of School Bash and Memorial Night! 
 
 
We are always looking for more events to have and better equipment to provide the best experience we can. We travel from town to town so that every one will get the chance to experience this wonderful event.During each event we will also have water and other soft beverages sold for people to stay hydrated. Costs are lower then other venues ($2.00 bottle water, $3.00 soda)We also want to give back so we will host many raffles, giveaways, and contests. These will sometimes be announced on the event page or only at the event.Will this be safe for my 16 year old?At any of these events there may be risk but we do try to minimize the risks involved and here's how.We clearly outline our rules for each and every event, all of our events are alcohol and smoke free. We will have a dedicated security staff at each event and will be in contact with local police forces in the event someone is under the influence of any drug or alcohol. Each person will be searched upon entering the property for items that include but are not limited to bottles/containers (this includes both opened and closed), weapons, lighters, illegal substances and much more. Our events will all be insured to help cover any medical costs and or third party damage to the location. Intentional damage will be paid by the individual(s) who are responsible for it.For more info on safety visit our Yapsody page here and view what the rules and regulations are for each event.


Our current state
We are in the middle of negotiations for land and buildings to use for our events. We 
are lucky enough to have just gotten Event Insurance to help cover the costs of any injuries or damage to property. Our website is almost completed and will be posted on here the moment it is finished. With the help of Yapsody we have online ticket sales which can be printed out and bought with you, there are also promoter discount codes and ways for you to make money with us. We have an assortment of lights from black lights to strobe and shower lights. We also have over 6,000 Watts of sound including 2 way speakers,and only bass speakers.
 What else do we need and what is the challenge associated with each?
 property and land 

We know that location rentals can be expensive so this is our main problem, we will be able to pay for them after our first event for sure, but until then we need a start up fund which is why we came here. Promotions   We will promote our events but to do so will cost a small amount in paying for keeping the website up, paying for google ads, physical flyers to hand out to schools and friends to give to others.
 Equipment  We currently do have a variety of speakers, turntables and lights to host a small event, we hope to host events with excess of 500 people in the future. What we need to purchase are ticket scanning devices (currently it is used off of mobile phones), barriers to set up stages and physical tickets for our promoters to sell in cash.

Members of our team
Who's involved?


  







             Marcus Stroud                                                      Cameron Peligri                  DJ Mslay                                                             DJ Silent Noisez                   Founder                                                                 Resident DJ
